Apparently our ambassador has been snubbed repeatedly by this foreign administration, and has been delegated to speaking to civil servants instead of being allowed direct access to the country's decision makers. This diplomatic back-and-forth has been going on for two months.
Inform them of the potential consequences of continued non-cooperation
Send an official letter thanking them for their time, and end the negotiations

A colonial regiment in one of our colonies has had an encounter with a regiment from another colonial power, which had, according to a military report, crossed into our colonial claim on an obscure waterway a fair distance into the colony's hinterland. The report further goes on to state that this foreign regiment was, when encountered by our patrol, in the process of conducting a geological survey of the area, the object of which is as of yet unknown to us. Hawkish members of our war cabinet see this as a direct assault on $COUNTRY$'s territorial integrity, and call for the execution of a plan they have termed, quite simply, 'Operation $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Fury'.
An invasion through there, and then deploy the troops so and so... interesting
I do not believe that this is really worth going to war over, truth to be told

On this subject I would like to bring up the issue of a merchant, operating out of one of my constituencies, who wrote to me last month with a most distressing story of how trade goods of his had been seized by customs officials in a foreign port. Again, I can only reiterate that further tolerance of these abridgments of the unrestricted freedom of international trade will only serve to compound the problem further with every year that passes.'\n\nAn MP known for his ardent support of free trade has held a speech in parliament today, detailing grievances against a foreign power.
Intolerable! Forceful action must certainly be considered

Many moons have passed since the foreigners arrived on our shores, but many more shall not pass until they are forced again to leave, or so say the leaders of our religious and military castes. There has been talk in the high councils for some time now of showing the Europeans that they cannot unopposed continue this ravaging exploitation of our native homeland.
This must be given serious consideration
This so-called 'buffer state' will not stop us.
There is no longer a need to justify a claim in $STATENAME$, since it already exists.
This will only cause more conflict.
There is no longer a need for the assimilation policies currently underway in $STATENAME$.
There is nothing we can do.
We will not stand for this!
Only keep territories with our cores. Return the rest.
We will keep everything we've gained.

The Spanish who control the island of Hainan have approached us to negotiate a treaty of friendship and assistance between the Catholic king and our leader. In exchange of Macao or Hong-Kong, they are ready to assist us in our Crusade and protect us from the European dogs lurking on our riches
The holy Crusade does not need strangers!
Give them an island in exchange for some help
The Taiping dogs have refused to give us the ports along the Pearl Delta. Already we are making preparations to 'protect the locals' from the mad heretics
We'll consider other means to benefit from South China....
The Taiping leaders have accepted to lease us the port of Macao in exchange of some protection.
We'll use Macao for the time being

The Chinese have accepted to give us the control of Macao and Hong-Kong, allowing us to exert a great influence in the area. However, we are now expected to protect them against the various threats of the Chinese claimants

The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not going well. These damnable foreigners are in our lands and blockading our ports, and to the embarassment of our government there seems to be little we can do to stop them. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us to negotiate a 'fair' settlement. While we could drag the war on and see if the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have the wherewithal to finish their assault, it might be in our best interest to give them a concession port and reparations. Indeed, this might even help us in some ways, though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership has signed our peace treaty, granting us a concession port on their coast as well as reparations. This has improved relations between our countries tremendously, and should go a long way to ensuring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in China remains strong.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have refused to submit. The war must go on.

The Khanate of Dzungaria is the last great remnant of the Mongolian Empire. Founded by OIrat Mongol in the XVIIth century it grew in importance in the following century unifying the Mongolian camps and vainquishing the Qing during several campaigns. It is said that its thanks to the Oirat that China is not dominated by the Manchu. The actual Khan, Galdan converted to Islam following his conquests of Samarkand and khiva but has shown tolerance towards the Buddhists lamas of his realm. While already aged he has said he wanted to advance into China but already his sons want to divide the Khanate following their desires.
We will lead the Steppes peoples to greatness!

Galdan Khan, the supreme chief of the Asian steppe died yesterday at the venerable age of 76 years. The size of the Khanate combined with the ambitions of his sons has seen the Empire already divided, each army pledging an oath to a different son. The heir Tushiyetu has seized the crown lands of Dzungaria but he now must choose: will he try to stop his brothers ambition or will he completely let the Empire disrupt?
We will strengthen the Oirat and let the others do as they please!
The Mongols, Kazaks and Uzbeks can go but we will fight for Kashgar and Tannu!

The Khan let his brothers disrupt the Khanate years ago but Uyghurs have been a thorn in our side for too long! They often pose problems in Urumqi siding in feuds of their community and trade routes have been let to waste under their rule. The Oirat must step up and take back this territory in memory of our great Khans!

The Khanate of Mongolia is our principal opponent in the area. The Mongols are our direct brothers compared to the Turkic people of the Steppes but their leader is too ambitious to accept our hegemony without fighting. Some call on to our leader to use the new knowledge he gained to strike at our enemies and see them submit once again before their rightful Khan!
We will see them driven before us!
The Kazakh Khanate lies in the steppes of the West. With our base secured in the East there has been talk about annexing back the Kazakhs.
Let us hear the lamentations of their women!
Tannu Tuva is a desolate frozen place. Sitting on the north of our border, we have little interest in attacking them but it would be anoying that someone else took the lands instead of us.
It's better to leave them be

The Western World is coming to the Asian Steppe. We feel it everyday with new ideas spreading through the old Silk Road. Fortunately we are isolated naturally with Siberia and the Divided China not allowing the Europeans to approach our cities and peoples. But the Khan has had enough. Japanese, Russians, all are looking into the Future and they will surely threaten the Oirat when they are ready. To this extent the Khan has gathered a little group tasked to find help in this modernization process but where shall they be sent?
To the West through the Tatar Lands.

Roman Stroganov-Romanov is a strange man but he has found his home here in the open steppe, riding a horse with a falcon on his wrist and feeling the wind in his hair. His military ability in the recent campaigns is worthy of praise. Despite his foreign background he is well perceived by the quriltai. We could nominate him as our right arm, Minister as they say in the civilized states, make him the leader of our forces or order him to leave...

Tibet is the religious center of the Buddhists of Central Asia. The dalai-lamas were installed rulers thanks to the Oirat two centuries ago and we have thus acquired a special place in Tibetan affairs. The current Dalai-lama is rebellious and has vigorously condemned our expansion through Asia. Our European minister has proposed we conduct a punitive expedition to make the Dalai-lama understand his place and why not recuperate some territories settled by Nomads?
We don't want to anger the Buddhists.
Our new overlords have asked us to transfer some territories where Mongol populations live.
With Tibet submitted we have acquired some Qinghai territories

Our minister Stroganov-Romanov has been pushing for some time for a modernization of our armies. He wants to institute 'Asiatic' Legions with professional officers trained with mixed European and Chinese tactics. This project is widely refused by our traditional belligerent elite and the actual officers who might lose their position. But if the reforms were to pass we would then acquire an ascendant on our neighbours!
It's probably better to leave it as it is...

Since he was left on his own in the steppe by the Oirat Stroganov-Romanov has been going mad. Lately he has assembled a whole corp of cavalry, delcaring his intention to build a Great Empire to purge back Europe. Thus he has attacked the Khan in Ugra to take power in Mongolia. If he wins he has declared that the Oirat would be next.
Stroganov-Romanov has taken control of Mongolia and has decided to 'purge us' for our faults!
The Creation of the Urumqi university

Amongst the men who came back from their mission to the outer world years ago, a wealthy Uygur from Urumqi has decided to build a library in our capital and has asked for our patronage. The collection is limited, consisting mostly of Buddhist treaties and Qurans but he says that he could try to buy them abroad with our help. Moreover he says we could establish an institute tasked of educating the children of our nation and help the development of our growing bureaucracy.
Expand the library but do not go further.

Our University still growing has welcomed several European archaeologists following certain discoveries in the Tarim basin. Apparently European looking people appear in cave paintings from the area and it has interested many archaeologists. What should we do about this discovery?
Publicly support the expedition and 'protect' the European envoys

Central Asia has entered on the world stage following the recent findings of archaelogists in the Tarim Basin. Cave findings and other remains have made the world discover a new civilization there, since long dead but who seems to be the Tokharoi described in the Greek texts. Anyway these findings have increased the prestige of the Oirat state which despite his entrance in the Modern World is still very isolated.

The National Library of Urumqi is filling with books since our investment! But our scholars have asked ourselves which script we should use for the translation of foreign books into our language. Central Asia has been using plenty of ways of writing: Muslim elites often use Arabic, merchants used Chinese, monks use Tibetan... A Mongol script was created by Genghis Khan and is still enduring. We could also adapt the Latin alphabet to our needs and become closer to the Western World or promulgate Arabic to please the Muslim populations.
The old Mongol alphabet will be fit for the Modern Age!
Yesterday a ship brought several Oirat men with gifts from the Khan in Urumqi. They have asked us to study here in Japan for a while before going back to their homeland.
Interesting. Maybe we could take advantage of this...

Our chosen men who travelled to Japan have come back filled with new knowledge gained in the Japanese universities. A lot of them have come to consider Japan as a natural ally for our country and with them getting new positions at the court, the Tenno can count on several allies in Urumqi.
Yesterday a caravan has arrived from Japan with a letter from the Emperor. He asks us to protect a group of Buddhist monks who want to travel to Tibet without crossing the ever-warring China.
Let him go to Tibet unharmed
Forbid him access through our passes!

Yesterday a caravan arrived from Urumqi with several Japanese monks who have come to study our sacred texts and establish better relations between Japan and Tibet. Their leader Kawaguchi has already gained the support of the current dalai-lama, who considers him one of the most 'wise monks' he ever encountered.
A group of Buddhist monks have entered Lhasa, the isolated capital of Tibet. Few men have and their success brings prestige over our nation!

The Steppe is a hard place to control. Far from our Home Islands and empty they only have interesting ressources. It is thus more interesting to use 'friendly regimes' to rule over these populations. The Dzungar Khanate would be a fine target as a puppet of our glorious nation and would enhance our position as masters of Asia.
The Steppes will be brought under our control!
Who brought such an idea to the court?
Japan has attacked us over a futile matter! We have to resist the Imperialist forces!
With Japanese demands enforced our countries we are forced to secede our northern provinces...
We bow before our Japanese overlords...
Siberian territories have been transferred to us following our victory over Dzungaria.
A delegation coming from the isolated khanate of Urumqi has entered our Indian colonies. They ask to be brought to Europe to learn of our ways. What do we say to our colonial adviser?
Bring them to Europe and show them our power!
Make them return to their steppes!

Our delegation has finally made its way back to Urumqi! They have spent many months in $FROMCOUNTRY$, attending to universities and military schools. They seem to have been quite the attraction in Europe from what they say and we are now known to European courts as an effect.

The imam who travelled to Europe with the delegation has published a book describing the trip he made to Europe. The great sense of detail of the book along with the reflexion on the Western Civilization has charmed our literate elite!

Our expedition has eventually come back from the West! They have brought with them limitless knowledge on politics, science and war. They have also established contact with most of the khans of Europe, who for most of them did not know the existence of our glorious country! To serve as military advisers they have also hired Cossacks, great warriors from the Western Steppes they claim. Their leader the Baron Roman Stroganov-Romanov, a disinherited noble has made a great impression to the Khan but he seems to be an ambitious man, full of eccentricities.

Once the wind of Western civilization blows to the East, every blade of grass and every tree in the East follow what the Western wind brings.'\n\nWe call them omens, the strange things that have transpired lately. Off our coastlines, strange ships have begun appearing. Strange ships, with masts so tall as to seem to touch the face of God. At first a curiosity, soon every so often -- increasing in intensity as gale grows to storm -- and tomorrow? Strange are their ships, and stranger still their customs, but there can be no doubt that we must adopt a policy with regards to the foreigners from 'Europe'.
We will allow the westerners into $COUNTRY$, so long as they cause no trouble.
They bring dangerous ideas. $COUNTRY$ will refuse them all access.

An old pond
A frog jumps in 
The sound of water.'

-- Matsuo Basho

One of our coastal provinces is bustling with rumors about the strange people who were found along its shorelines earlier this morning. The more precise origin of these shipwrecked sailors is as of yet uncertain, but, wherever they are from, they are definitely not from $COUNTRY$. The difficulty now lies in deciding what to do with them: if we send them home, we are effectively changing our policy of non-interaction with the westerners. Ignoring them and allowing them to stay, however, means permitting a western presence in $COUNTRY$ despite all our efforts.

One of our subjects has been discovered wearing foreign clothes, and further interrogation by the authorities has lead to the slow unraveling of a foreign smuggling ring. These foreigners come into $COUNTRY$ without permission, knowing they face execution should they be caught-- yet some of our advisors say there are benefits to their presence, as they can supply needs to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people that we cannot.
Shut it down and confiscate the contraband.
Do whatever it takes to eliminate this menace.

An old pond
A frog jumps in 
The sound of water.'

-- Matsuo Basho

One of our coastal provinces is bustling with rumors about the strange people who were found along its shorelines earlier this morning. The more precise origin of these shipwrecked sailors is as of yet uncertain, but, wherever they are from, they are definitely not $COUNTRY_ADJ$.
Round them up and execute them.
There is nothing we can do.

News reaches us that an expatriate community of foreigners, from various European countries and Great Powers, has formed in one of our cities. Doubtlessly, this is a direct effect of our government's policy of open ports and borders. This influx might be positive, as our government seems to believe, however some voices have less kind things to say about the foreigners.
Force of arms must be considered.
We must respect and tolerate the differences between our respective cultures.

Despite the obvious rightness of our country's trade policies, greater amounts of foreign goods could be useful, and elements within our administration have suggested setting up a limited trading post in one of our coastal cities, where foreign ships can moor and trade, without compromising the cultural integrity of $COUNTRYNAME$. It could be an economic boon to the area and the nation, but conservative voices warn that destructive foreign influences might further creep into our society.
Keep it small. Keep it simple. Keep it under control.

A sweet, pungent stench hangs over the backstreets and alleys in one of our cities, emanating and spreading in every direction from an epicenter at the foreign trade station. The European traders have brought with them the habit of opium smoking, and our subjects have taken to it on a scale that threatens to become epidemic. It seems that, for every new ship that lands, more and more of our people get caught in the deadly and pacifying web of addiction. What should we do?
It is not our place to intervene
Issue an edict banning the sale of opium
Do whatever it takes to uproot them.

The great clippers ply our coastlines from north to south, like wolves culling out the weak and the corruptible with the poison they sell. Wherever there is an unexposed harbor, a foreign ship soon docks, and drives another fang into our national body. The use of opium has spread to $PROVINCENAME$.
Order local officials to destroy opium shipments

The use of opium in a neighboring province has now spread to the inland. Farmers and laborers in $PROVINCENAME$ fail to turn up for work, and entire fields fall fallow, as the people of $PROVINCENAME$ slip further and further down into the mists of consuming dependence.
It is not our place to intervene

We find that your country is sixty or seventy thousand li from $COUNTRY$. Yet there are barbarian ships that strive to come here for trade for the purpose of making a great profit. The wealth of $COUNTRY$ is used to profit the barbarians. By what right do they then in return use the poisonous drug to injure the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people?'\n\nOne of our governors has taken the opium problem into his own hands, and written a letter to a foreign head of state, questioning the morality of their support of the opium trade.
No! Apologize and stop this nonsense!

Rangaku', literally translated as 'Dutch learning', and by extension 'Western learning', is a Japanese word used to describe a particular body of knowledge and learning imported from the west via a Dutch trading station at Dejima. Something similar has ocurred at the trading station in one of our provinces, where local officials are busy translating western books and treatises on science, advancing $COUNTRY_ADJ$ science and understanding of the world.

He hides his face and speaks with controlled anger. A local aristocrat has been insulted by one of the foreigners living in one of our provinces. Apperantly, the foreigner in question failed to bow in the appropriate manner when passing the aristocrat on the street. Shall we tolerate such blatant ignorance of our customs?
The foreigner is ignorant, not malevolent
Perhaps some gold could make things better?

He unveils the device with the excitement of a child. - 'You can see their eyes!', he cries, pointing excitedly at the jar of beetles. He instructs you to look into the object -- the glass and metal is cold against your face -- there, in curves of an optic lense, reality is magnified ten times over. - 'It's a microscope!, he laughs. - 'I bought it from one of the foreigners!'

The foreigners have gone too far! Their missionaries spread false teachings, subverting our people and our national unity, they break our customs, and their opium clouds our minds. At least that is the message you will get if you ask the people in $PROVINCENAME$ where anti-foreign sentiments have been running high for the past months.

We have decided to open our doors to the West, and if we expect our subjects to embrace this policy, it becomes important that we ourselves, the Royal family, set good examples. Well educated leaders will be absolutely essential if we are to fully take our rightful place in the court of nations, and by sending our progeny abroad for education in Europe, or by hiring Westerners to educate them here, we can accomplish just that. What say you, your majesty?

The European governess we have hired to educate the court seems to be doing fairly well at her job, but she has been introducing some rather strange ideas around the place. For instance, she has been throwing around, in quite harsh language, the idea that all men are created equal, and that $COUNTRY$ should abolish the time-honored institution of slavery. I don't know, your majesty, this sounds like dangerous stuff...
Enjoy the conversations, but ultimately do nothing
Dangerous or not, I believe she is right

One of the Great Powers of the West has taken an interest in our country, and has offered to establish a military mission. While this might be beneficial to our research, it might also prove a liability in the event of war, however, turning down such a generous offer might be perceived as somewhat of an insult. Do we wish to allow the establishment of a military mission?
Certainly! Our troops need to modernize
I think we can manage without it

Some intelligence concerning our military preparations has spread from the military mission in one of our provinces, severely hurting our war effort. We have expelled the members of the mission, but the damage has already been done.

The high militancy among certain parts of the population in $PROVINCENAME$ has lead to an outbreak of violence directed at local expatriate foreigners. The embassies of the Great Powers have all lodged formal diplomatic complaints with our government, and seem to expect some sort of action on our part. What should we do?
What shall we do with the drunken sailor?

Sailors winding up drunk in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ prisons aren't normally affairs of state, but this is an exception. A navyman from one of the Great Powers has been arrested by officials in one of our cities, after having murdered one of our subjects in what appears to have started as a bar fight. The diplomatic attaché insists that the sailor be handed over to the country in question, and tried according to their laws. This presents us with a conundrum. Granting this privilege once is tantamount to allowing extraterritoriality to all foreign subjects, but not doing so might very well cause international uproar. This issue merits careful consideration.
Hand him over to the foreigners

A depesch has arrived from our attaché in $FROMCOUNTRY$, detailing the tragedy of a sailor in our merchant marine. Apperantly, the sailor killed a local in a scuffle during an extended shore leave in $FROMPROVINCE$. Despite pressures from our diplomatic mission, he was later tried and executed according to $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ laws. While we mourn his passing, we should also take some time to consider what we should do about this grave and serious insult to our national honor.

News reaches us from $FROMCOUNTRY$ that they have decided to allow foreigners to be tried according to the laws of their native countries. Doubtlessly caused by pressure from within the circles of the Great Powers, these are good news nevertheless.
Refuse. We don't need their methods.
They have our permission to continue, but we can offer no support.
This is not in our best interest.

With the European presence in our part of the world steadily increasing, the need for military reform becomes more dire every day. Where the Europeans field regiments of drilled professionals, we meet them with an army that is old and outdated, and organised along the lines of clan, family, nobility and personal loyalties.
We will not abandon our traditional ways

We have suffered a defeat. Despite our policy of splendid isolation, a hostile world has made inroads into ours. $SPHEREMASTER$ has forced our country open, and the gravitation of their might and power has brought our political life into orbit around theirs. Foreign traders, missionaries and spies pour across our borders, all the while undermining our traditional sovereignty over this, our homeland. No longer the masters of our own fate, our first priority now is to obey. But some dark night...

News reaches us from $FROMCOUNTRY$ that the local ruling elites have thrown our ambassador out of the country, and that their troops are laying siege to our embassy with apparent intent to enforce that decision. This affair is developing into an enormous loss of international face, one which can only be avoided through a formal declaration of war against $FROMCOUNTRY$. Sire, how should we respond?
Perhaps we should let the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Dragon sleep.
We will not go to war over this.

So shall ye not only be Our good and faithful subjects, but render illustrious the best traditions of your forefathers.'\n\n$COUNTRYNAME$'s educational system is deeply mired in ancient tradition and long-established dogma. While it has helped maintain the traditional order in eras past, the old system has a hard time integrating the new knowledge that is spreading from the civilized nations of the west. By reforming the system we risk upsetting the vested interests of the traditionalists, but can we afford not to?
Why? They have nothing to offer us?

Wandering alone in the streets of $CAPITAL$ can be a dangerous thing, as a foreign ambassador in the Legation Quarter recently found out. Guards report having found him dead at 4 a.m. in the morning, apperently the vicitm of a robbery, however the foreigners accuse us of having failed in our supposed responsibility to protect their diplomats. We fear that even a formal apology will not be enough to placate them, however, something more tangible might...
Grudgingly erect a monument to the diplomat
Apologize, but leave it at that
This is nonsense, he put himself in harm's way!

The oil lamp flickered, casting an orange, sooty glow across the moist brown of the cargo hold. The average ship docking in $PROVINCENAME$ carried very little to raise an eyebrow, but years of being fooled and fooled again by foreign merchants, trying to dodge some excise or other, had left him with a sixth sense for when things were out of order. A rat scurrying between some crates tipped him off. A sweet, pungent scent too familiar not to be alluring. Opium. A cargo hold full of opium.

One of our traders was turned away from the port in $FROMPROVINCE$ some time ago. Apperantly he was discovered by local customs officials trying to smuggle opium, despite the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ban on opium imports. A liberal politician in our lower house has addressed the matter.\n\n'The right to trade freely, and openly, across the seas and on land, is one of the unalienable rights of mankind. Our rights have been denied in $FROMCOUNTRY$, and I for one wonder how long the government will stand for these slights at the hands of uncivilized heathens.
We have more important matters to attend to

Your trading restrictions are a disgrace to the world, and to yourself. Loyal $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ subjects, merely wishing to see their rights of trade upheld, have been turned away from your ports, and we request that this slight be immediately undone. $COUNTRYNAME$ will cease this infraction, or prepare itself to face the consequences.
Bending with the wind is also a form of resistance
You do your worst, and we shall do our best

The trade disputes between $FROMCOUNTRY$ and the Great Powers had been on-going since the latter half of the 18th century. Tensions finally escalated to the boiling point in $MONTH$ of $YEAR$, when $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officials had repeatedly turned down $COUNTRY_ADJ$ requests for unlimited trade access, including a lifting of the ban on the sale of opium. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, already deeply invested in a policy of confrontation, found itself with no options but to declare war, thus, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Opium War begun.
The reforms sweeping through our country have upset the landed elites in one of our cities.

Our defeat in the last war has left us with the clear realization that certain things within our country need to adapt to the realities of the new world, and a quick campaign of reform could bring us up to speed.

Our country is under intellectual assault by modernity and the Western World. In the fields of modern technology, industry and military theory, the old traditions and institutions no longer serve us as they used to. Everywhere we turn, western influences spread like wildfire through our nation, our population, and our souls. If we are to remain what we always have been, and not become something else entirely, now is the time to assume control of our own destiny. It has become apparent to the leading members of our intellectual elite, that the only way to turn the tide on the Western Leviathan is to swim with it, for, as Sun Tu says: The reed that bends before the wind, also offers a form of resistance.

By parliamentary class struggle, and as effect of intensified class struggle on account of the increasing exploitation of the proletariat by the capitalist classes, the gradual concentration of the means of production in the hands of the few, a club and a revolver, our so called democracy has now transformed into a dictatorship of the proletariat.

Concerned by the growing chaos in $COUNTRY$, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leadership has stepped in to declare martial law and assume full control over the government. Civil freedoms have been curtailed, and already there is a growing certainty in the streets of $CAPITAL$ that this is the beginning of a military dictatorship. Will the new government be so quick to relinquish power once the current crisis has passed?
This is only temporary until the crisis passes

In the interests of protecting the principles of liberty from the crushing onslaught of democracy, plebian aristocracy and mob rule, a committee of concerned citizens have seized power and transformed the country into a minimal government dictatorship. It's only temporary, they say.

The voting rights have been curtailed, the party system gradually slips under state control, and, just yesterday, a bill on the expansion of the extraordinary powers of the state passed the house. The signs are clear and plain. The fascist ruling party has transformed our nation from a democracy to a fascist dictatorship.

The dictatorship is not what it used to be. Increased pluralism, combined with extended political reforms, have led to the dictatorship more and more taking on the trappings of a democracy. While this doesn't necessarily mean that the party has given up it's reign on power, it does mean that the opposition now has some chance of making its voice heard.

Your Majesty, on account of the unstable parliamentary situation, we see no other option than to declare a restoration of the crown to the principles of absolute monarchy. The principles and documents of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ constitutionalism are, effective immediately, declared null and void. Long live the king!

The political reforms enacted in the past few years have led to a situation where the absolutism of our Monarchy can now legitimately be called into question. No longer is the king free to dictate the course of the nation to his own musings, but instead has had to accept several constitutional hems and restrictions on his excercise of power. For these reasons, our government form is no longer most accurately described as an absolute monarchy.

The sweeping reforms to our party system that have been enacted during the past few years have turned our country from an absolute monarchy to a constitutional monarchy. The Monarch, now serving as a symbolic head-of-state, no longer has the power to personally control and determine the fate of the nation, but is instead forced to accept the mitigating influences of pluralism and limited democracy.

Lately an eerie feeling has crept over you that $COUNTRY$ is growing silent. Where before the free exchange of opinion and ideas could be heard, from street corners and bus stops to bars and universities, now only the sounds of silence gives echo. The conclusion that is becoming ever more evident, is that the tradition of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ democracy has been subverted. In $COUNTRY$, at least, the government for, of and by the people, has perished from the earth.

A sentiment of cultural nationalism is sweeping $COUNTRY$, as people begin to clamor for unification with our cultural brethren in $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. We have little reason to doubt that they would object to a petition of annexation.

Following a surge in popular nationalist sentiments, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has placed a formal request with our authorities in $CAPITAL$ that they be allowed to join $COUNTRY$ in perpetual union. There seems to be little reason to oppose this move.
Otherwise people would exploit the situation

Today crowds gathered in $CAPITAL$ to celebrate $COUNTRY$'s independence. In the modern world, independence can be a fleeting thing-- so we must enjoy it while we can. Today, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags wave from every window and corner, and jubilant citizens sing the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ anthem. It is a heartfelt theme that speaks of better tomorrows.
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.
It has been agreed that Gran Columbia should be divided, but there has not yet been a decision on who will decide how Gran Columbia is divided.
It shall be divided into Granada, Quito, and Essequibo.
It shall be divided into Granada, Quito, Arequipa, and Essequibo.
The Maya shall have their own state.
The Maya, Purepecha, and Zapotec shall have their own states.
The Maya, Purepecha, Zapotec, and Nahua shall have their own states.
The different republics are united against the Spanish oppressor. However it is not assured to stay like this forever...
We have vainquished the revolutionnaries and taken back our colonies! Long live Espana!

Now we have defeated the rebels we have to decide how we shall administer this vast territory. Some are in favor of keeping the Colombians under our rule but it will cost us tremendous amounts of money to successfully rule the area. Most are proposing home rule. Some propose to reestablish the vice-royalties of Lusitania, Mexico and Granada along with the Capitancy-General of Greater Salvador. However we could also dislocate the Granadan territory between a colony around Cartagena, establishing a new Capitancy in Essequibo and giving the rest of Tierra Firme to a Castillian vice-royalty around Caracas. The Andes provinces would be divided between Arequipa and Quito and to avoid a strong Mexico we would separate Jalisco. The choice is the hands of the king.
Keeping them under our surveillance is the best thing to do

The old imperial city of the Incan Empire is in our hands since the end of the rebellion. Cuzco has been under our control since 1575 but the area is still predominantly inhabited by Quechua people and few have adopted our customs. Some in our government have suggested to give the territories depending of the Arequipa Capitancy to the Incan Empire to thank them for their intervention during the war. Although they were forced to surrender, the Incans decided the issue of the war by killing the Rebel leader Jacinto de Gravina. Ceding Cuzco would surely assure us a period of peace in Colombia and ease the tensions that have accumulated over the years.
We'll give it to them as a payment for their help

The rebels have spread liberal ideas throughout Colombia and many people in our colonies are inclined toward these. Many of the soldiers fighting in the war have heard of them and it seems the liberal hydra will be hard to stop. We can choose to keep absolutism and force the colonies to bow before our representatives. However reconciling with them by allowing them to elect their government under our supervision will be appreciated over the Atlantic but will create dissent here in Spain. Or more simply we could grant a Constitution to both the Colombians and the Spanish peoples.
Absolutism will keep our empire strong
Homerule for the colonies but absolutism at home
The war proved the necessity of reforms here and there
The Royal officers are enforcing the Spanish law in our country...
The King has granted us concessions and partial home-rule!
The governor is placing the politics under the Spanish law. No reform is allowed by the Crown...
The governor knows what is best
The end of the colonial order?
With the end of absolutism in Spain, our subjects from Colombia are asking us to grant them partial home-rule
We will allow the colonies to have partial home-rule
It is not the right time

Rejoice citizens of Gran Columbia! Our armies have expelled the Spanish corps that had occupied the Lusitanian coast. The loyalists in the area have already given a copious donation for the war effort

After fierce fightings in the jungle our armed forces have successfully repelled the Monarchists from the Yucatan peninsula. A threat to the heart of the resistance has been deleted and a generous donation has been made for the war effort!

The Antioquia region has been retaken by the glorious forces of his Majesty. Once the heart of the vice-royalty of Granada, Cartagena de Indias is now in ruins. Victim of fierce fightings between Loyalists and Independentists, the city was shelled by the Spanish navy in 1819 and never fully recovered. However many of the landowners of the area are trusting the monarchy to rebuild the city and they have made a gracious donation to help vanquish the rebels.

Our forces are parading in the streets of the old capital of the Inca Empire. The looting of the area has provided a nice benefit for the crown and the control of the Amerigan region shows that the war will soon be over

The victory in Yucatan and Lusitania can't hide the fact that the war is harsh. Maybe we could try to ask a deal with the Spanish to secure the revolution in the Northern territories? We could cede them the Granadan territories allowing us to lick our wounds and later save them
All of Colombia will be free or none will
Rebel representatives have approached us to discuss a peace. They are ready to relinquish all Granadan territories if we accept the independence of their Federation
We won't be satisfied with only Granada. Onwards to Mexico!

After a long and bloody war, Mexican representatives have agreed on peace with the Spanish crown. Gran Colombia is recognized as an independent nation but all the territories dependent of the old vice-royalty of Granada along with Andagoya will be ceded to Spain. Already, crowds are gathering in Nova Lisboa and San Salvador to blame the Mexican government and the so-proclaimed president Federico de las Casas for the defeat. What will happen to the Federation?
At least Central America will be free...

The treaty of Cartagena has left us with many possibilities in Ameriga. We could maintain the old order but at the cost of increased rebellions or allow home-rule. In the latter we have to decide how to divide the area. Keeping a strong Granada could be needed against the belligerent Federation in the North but it could also be dangerous, should it rebel...
Keep them under our direct administration
Reestablish a Granadan vice-royalty to govern these territories

With the signature of the peace of Cartagena, the hold of Mexico over the Federation has loosened. Both Lusitanian and Mesoamerigans are asking for a congress to be held in Mexico to decide of the future of the federation. However many generals fear the outcome of this session and partisans of the war hero Tomás Villa want him to take command. Such a move would however only increase the various separatist movements...
Call a Congress in two months, we stand true to democratic ideas
We can't afford division while the king holds Andagoya!
The various representatives from all the Federation have arrived in Mexico City to decide of their future.
It is the end of the congress: what have they chosen?
The Congress of Mexico: United Gran Colombia
Despite the apparent ditrust toward the government the Federation will continue to live. With the inclusion of Mesoamerigan and Lusitanian in our government we can prepare the liberation of Granada!
Now we have to save Granadans...
The Congress of Mexico: End of the Federation

The Lusitanian and Mesoamerigan have voted the end of Gran Colombia. The distrust, the fear accumulated against the Mexican government has shown itself and it is too late to maintain Gran Colombia as it is.
It is the end of the Federation...
The Congress of Mexico: Division of Mexico
How did we fall so low?

Maintaining Order in Gran Colombia has been hard since the accession of Tomás Villa to Presidency. Liberals are criticizing 'the extraordinary measures' took by Tomás Villa and some already think that Spanish domination would be softer than the one imposed by the Mexican miltary. To help fight the secessionist movements in Lusitania and Mesoameriga, Tomás Villa has met in Veracruz with Inacio Madeira and José Morazan. The first is a Lusitanian war hero who has led the recapture of Nova Lisboa in the last moments of the war and thus acquired a prestigious figure in Lusitania. The second is the symbol of assimilation of the Native populations, his family indeed originates from Mayan caciques who then became great figures in San Salvador. A leader of the independence war, he is revered by both Mayan and Mesoamerigan populations. Along with these two prominent figures, Tomás Villa has designed a plan which divides the country into three spheres of influence until the Federation is ready to fight once more the Spanish.
It is not like we have another choice
Lusitania is a fine place to rule...

Tension have erupted in Tejas since the Veracruz Plan. Madeira has always refused to accept Mexican claims on the territories that belonged to the vice-royalty of Lusitania. But Tomás Villa recently said a small garrison near Monclova in a move to anger Madeira. He reacted and destroyed the fort, killing the Mexican soldiers. Now it is war against Mexico for the independence of Lusitania!
It is time to end Tomás Villa's rule! Lusitania shall be free!
Mexican forces have been killed in a fort located in Lusitanian territory! Madeira has refused to condemn the attack and has declared the independence of Lusitania, free from Mexico!
Morazan has refused to take action against Madeira! Furthermore he wants us to acknowledge the independence of the Mesoamerigans or he'll go to war against Mexico...
Morazan too? He will be crushed as well!
Leave him be, Madeira is more dangerous
With the ongoing war, no one can say that we represent the Federation...
We will reforge Gran Colombia by iron and blood!
Taking advantage of the war, nationalists have declared Purepacha free!
The Tarascans will learn how we treat the rebels in Mexico!
Taking advantage of the war, nationalists have declared Oaxaca free!
The liberal opposition has taken the control of the Western provinces and is determined to take Mexico!
We are different from Tomás Villa.
With the downfall of the Federation, our former Spanish overlords are trying to recover control over their shattered empire. Anyway we must decide the future of $COUNTRY$.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ rejected our ultimatum! Diplomacy has failed, but they will submit one way or the other!

Clearly fearing our might, $FROMCOUNTRY$ decided to satisfy our demands. Our former subjects are ready to rejoin the Empire and the Spanish flag is already hoisted in the streets of $FROMCOUNTRY_CAPITAL$

Profiting from the conflicts that erupted since the Colombian War, Plantagenia has taken rightful Lusitanian lands. With their lands reincorporated in the Empire, we are in the position to ask Plantagenia to relinquish their claims and give back the lands
Ask them to give Lusitania back or we will go to war for it
With the downfall of Lusitania,the Spanish are trying to recover control over the areas we seized from their old vice-royalty. We have now the choice of giving up the land or fight for it...
$FROMCOUNTRY$ rejected our ultimatum! Diplomacy has failed, but they will submit one way or the other!
Clearly fearing our might, $FROMCOUNTRY$ decided to satisfy our demands. People in Nova Lisboa rejoice to be reunited with their brethren!
Now that we control all the former lands of our Empire, we must decide how we will rule the lands. We could establish the old-vice-royalties or keep the territory under close surveillance
Keeping them under our surveillance is the best thing to do

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Spanish war is over. Representatives from Spain have been forced to sign an humiliating treaty that makes them free all their Colombian and Caribbean holdings. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has affirmed itself as a World Power and Europeans powers now begin to pay more attention to affairs on the other side of the Atlantic...
We have no other choice but to sign it...
We have no other choice but to sign it...
We have no other choice but to sign it...

The Spanish population has lost confidence in the monarchy. The defeat and the loss of Gran Colombia has allowed Republicans to gain influence in the Spanish society. Seeing the decay of the state and the monarchy, radicals have overthrown the King and proclaimed the Republic! Many wonder how the country will evolve...
The Republic will stop our decay!
Following the defeat in Colombia, a group of generals have forced the King to abdicate. These men have taken the power for themselves, promising to end the decay of the Spanish state.
Following their defeat in Colombia, the clique of generals that controlled Spain has been ousted and the Republic proclaimed!
The Republic will stop our decay!

The defeat in the Colombian War has shaken the very foundations of the Spanish state. The previous government has been overthrown by the vanguard party who has proclaimed the birth of the Spanish proletarian dictatorship
Despite the defeat in Colombia the current regime is still supported by the Spanish people and democracy will endure!
The Regime will endure with the will of the people!
The success of independendists has led to the dismantlement of the Federation.

Tomás Villa, one of the heroes of Colombian independence was killed while going to his estate manor after leaving the capital in the morning. The men responsible for his death have not been found and rumors accuse either the President de las Casas for eliminating one of his close advisors and possible rivals in Mexico or his oppponents. But the death of the Mexican tetrach, which had stood by Federico de las Casas when he dissolved the Andagoyan Congress, will surely be a blow to the power of the President of Gran Colombia and his followers.
The arrest and execution of Juan Manuel Santos

Juan Manuel Santos, hero of the independence of San Salvador and former Tetrarch was arrested in Mexico for treason. Documents were found in his office in the capital that showed a connection between him and the Spanish to reverse the Republic and eliminate Federico de las Casas. Thankfully governemental forces discovered the conspiracy before he could do harm to the state. A military tribunal sentenced him and his followers to death, which was quickly executed. The opposition that still dare to challenge the governement sees this act as a purge of elements disloyal to the current regime.
The escape of Manuel Luis de Madeira

Conspiracies continue to be uncovered in Gran Colombia as the former Lusitanian Tetrarch Luis de Madeira was found guilty of treason and conspiracy with foreign powers to destabilize the state. A series of correspondency with Spanish officials were found by the Military and an arrest warrant issued. Nevertheless, de Madeira was informed by rebellious elements and managed to flee the country on a boat in Veracruz. A known opponent of Federico de las Casas, his exile will surely last.
The island of Kuba which gained its independence recently decided to join our grand country!

The dictatorship created by Federico de las Casas and continued by his protégé and son in law Fermín Ramírez, has managed to add the island of Kuba to the Colombian state, fulfilling one of the pledges made by de las Casas before the battle of Habana. It is for many the sign that the current dictatorship is fit for Gran Colombia.
Gran Colombia is more united than ever!

The Castle of Chapultepec is the official residence of the Imperial family. Located on a hill on the outskirts of the capital, it has become the center of the court life and culture, with many improvements done over the years to accomodate the Imperial Family. Many pictures of this residence have been taken over the years, with many shown throughout the country and beyond to show the might of the Monarchy.
Our glorious emperor needs his own castle!

Sire! Ambassadors from all corners of Your Empire have managed to conclude an agreement and created The Second Imperial Constitution! They have proclaimed You the sole legitimate ruler of the Colombian Empire. Nothing can stop us now!
The Congress of Mexico - Partial Success

Sire! Ambassadors from all corners of Your Empire have managed to conclude an agreement and created The Second Federal Constitution! They have proclaimed Gran Colombia legitimate country but they do not accept your imperialistic rule. They demand your abdication and free elections where you can candidate for the position of the Confederal Proconsul.
For the good of my country

Sire! Ambassadors from all corners of Your Empire have not managed to conclude an agreement and create The Second Constitution! They have proclaimed Gran Colombia and Your rule illegitimate and they demand your abdication and abolition of this 'reactionary abomination' of Yours.
The Integration of the people of Colombia is merely beginning
Nationalism of the various provinces is disappearing
The territories of Angola have been under our rule for so long, that the local population starts to show nationalistic sentiments.
Another territory of ours was proclaimed undisputedly ours.
Another territory of ours was proclaimed undisputedly ours.
Another territory of ours was proclaimed undisputedly ours.

In $YEAR$ the Great Powers of Europe decided to grant the unsettled areas near the equator to the Grand Duchy of Savoy to prevent the dominance of any of them. As a counter-payment the Savoyard East Indian Trading Company had to be dissolved.

A letter has arrived from our Viceroy in Athesia. It seems that the $FROMCOUNTRY$ has offered to purchase the peninsula from us. They have a great deal of money set aside for the purchase and our current financial and political situation makes us more inclined to accept.
Venice has agreed to our offer for Athesia! Not only have they agreed to the sale of the Athesian peninsula but they have also included the island chains of Eleuthera and Lucaya as well!
Despite their situation Venice has refused our offer to sell Athesia. We can either accept this or issue them an ultimatum
We will consult with Parliament on what to do

It seems that $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not taking no for an answer. Now they have massed their soldiers at the Athesia border and there are rumors that their ships are planning for a long voyage. Perhaps now is the time to accept their demands?
They can take it from our cold dead hands!
Venice has reversed its prior decision and agreed to turn over Athesia! Venice bowing down to our show of force truly shows how far we've come as a great power!
They should have accepted the first time
Once again Venice has refused to hand over Athesia. They believe we won't follow through with our promise of war but let us show them how wrong they were.
Then we'll take it from them!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has offered us a great sum of cash for the island of Cuba. While the island has served us well for centuries the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have presented a great deal of money. What shall we do?
Spain has decided to accept our offer for Cuba. This is a great day for our nation as we begin to dominate the region.

Unfortunately Spain has refused our offer. Unlike with the Venetians a war with Spain would result in a severe drain of our finances making war for Cuba unwise. This setback will not keep us from continuing our rise as a great power, however.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been expanding across the Caribbean and has now set its eyes on our colonial islands. The islands in recent years have become a rather financial drain on our economy but we also do not want to just bow down to a minor power.

Our brethern in England have finally revolted against the King of Paris, creating their own state in the North of the Island. Many young Beornian officers want us to help the fragile English state in their war against the Anglois but it will be a costly and risky endeavour. Moreover the English revolutionaries don't share the same values as our state and could endanger the fabric of our society if they were to corrupt the young officers of the Royal Army.
Liberals or not we will help the English.
Our prayers are with them, but that will be all.

The Liberpool people have welcomed with great joy a Beornian squadron that has entered the port full of weapons, men and supplies to help the fight against the Anglois oppressors. The leader of this expedition, Arthur Wellesley, has pledged the Beornian volunteers to our cause, with the unofficial support of the Beornian Monarchy. Despite their strange behaviours and dialect, these men will surely prove to be a great boon to our forces!

The English revolution has prevailed, with the Dual-Monarchy forced to accept the independence of the English state. Many of the volunteers we sent to England have come back to Camelot, bringing with them the finest English experts to help us in military and industrial matters. Sadly these officers are also quite prone to criticize the Monarchy and the conservatives and they could prove to be a hinder in future years.
The end of the English Revolution

The English Revolution could not prevail in the end against the forces of the Dual-Monarchy and most of our volunteers did not come back from old England. But some have, and with them have brought back knowledge we could use in the military. The Dual-Monarchy has also denounced our intervention in the war, but they already did not have good relations with us before.
Some of our men came back that is the most important
Our domination of the Caribbean is almost complete. Now that we own the islands of Ayiti and Righavn all that remains is Eendrachtsland.
Scandinavia has refused our offer. While we are saddened by their decision we have gained much in the Caribbean to be thankful for as well.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to us offering to buy Eendrachtsland. While the island is largely useless to us it would showcase our power by refusing.
Burgundy has accepted our offer! We are now the only major power left in the Caribbean!
Burgundy has refused our offer. We find it no to be no loss however as we already retain a large control of the Caribbean.
We have received a proposition from $FROMCOUNTRY$ about the islands in South Atlantic. They are ready to buy them for a really good price
The Scandinavians have sold us the Falklands. Long live $COUNTRY$!
The Scandinavians have declined our offer....
Now we control the islands we can finally say that the Falklands are $COUNTRY_ADJ$!
South of the Falklands lies the island of South Georgia. A frozen rock some say but at least it's our useless rock in the Atlantic!

A dry spell in one of our colonies has caused friction between colonial officials and locals. The lion's share of the reservoired water in the area has been diverted to colonial factories and plantations, leaving many local smallholders with insufficient water for irrigation. As the days turn into weeks, tensions continue to rise. Diverting more water to local farms is an option, but might be viewed internationally as a sign of weakness.
Divert more water to local farms
The rain will fall, sooner or later.
We best save even more water, should the situation persist.

And it seems to me a travesty that traders long established be allowed these special and, indeed, unfair, prerogatives with regards to the reaping of our common colonial harvest. Paid for, I might add, from the national treasury. Are these benefits to be reaped solely by profiteers and first-comers?'\n\nA debate in parliament concerning the status of traders and trading in our colonies has exploded into a regular fist-fight, as an MP sympathetic to one of our colonial companies lunged at a vocal supporter of free trade, when the latter presented the above accusations to the chamber. This might be a good time to reconsider our colonial trading charters
We should open the colony up to free competition between any and all traders
A liberal upper house ensures free trade
A conservative upper house ensures colonial order

A colonial charter company has approached us with a request to incorporate a new colonial factory in one of our colonies. While the factory would help local production efficiency, it is also clear that the plans call for the appropriation of several thousand acres worth of land belonging to natives. We will have to weigh the pros of production against the cons of disposessed, angry natives.
Naturally, a new factory can only be a good thing
Brutally force people off their land? Not a very $COUNTRY_ADJ$ thing to do!

... and I argue that this present resurgence of native unrest in the colony is due only to the continued, repeated and wanton mismanagment that our own officials have imposed on the locals. For if the purpose of our presence in our far flung colonies is to uplift and educate, our failure is all the worse when we accomplish the exact opposite.'\n\nNative militancy is rising in one of our colonies, and reports are reaching $CAPITAL$ that the reason for this surge in violence is several incidents of colonial mismanagment. We can seek to redress the problem by finding scapegoats in the Colonial Office, but happy bureaucrats might be more important than happy natives in some god-forsaken colony.
We must seek an effective, honest and diligent administration
Very concerning... but oh, my, it's almost teatime. Cricket later, anyone?

From the Congo Basin to the deepest fathoms of the Bengal, from the jungles of India to the coasts of Java, scientific taxonomy is making new advances daily. As the light of civilization spreads to even the darkest corners of the earth, the Creator's secrets are, little by little, being unraveled. Turn over any old rock in the colonies, and you will find yet another spectacular piece of miraculous fauna looking back at you, with at least one of its fifteen eyes.'\n\nNew species of exotic fauna are being discovered in the colonies, and a suggestion has been proposed to establish a Colonial Musem of Natural History.
The idea is certainly interesting, but it might be expensive.
Let us see these creatures in their natural habitat instead.

The riches of the colonies flow to our nation's coffers, but it is not only in monetary terms that our nation benefits from its possessions in the New Worlds. The single biggest gain from our colonial presence lies in the continually expanding venues and fields in which our technological advances can be applied, tried and tested.'\n\nCertain well-off philantropists in $COUNTRY$ have decided to fund a colonial exposition to celebrate our colonies, our missionaries, and our Empire. The question is how we should advertise the exposition. A celebration of our technological prowess, or a grand salute to Empire?
A rousing cheer for the Empire!
Long live the captains of industry and technology!

Here, in these far flung places, forgotten, it seems, by both God and Civilization, barbaric native practices, foreign to the mind of any civilized man, still persist, along with widespread illiteracy, unsanitary living conditions and the sheer ignorance of unenlightened minds.'\n\nThe Colonial Office has published a report on the social conditions in the colonies, and it is not exactly sunny reading. Many of the people in the colonies still live under the conditions of a European Dark Age, or worse, and the Colonial Office strongly suggests that something be done about it.
We need to enact a more comprehensive education policy
I believe the resources could be better spent elsewhere

Grievous discontent still persists in the colony, despite several attempts by local governors at mediation between local powerholders and the Central Government. The recommendation of the Colonial Office must be that we either take steps to make accomodations with the natives, or that we seek to undermine their authority by enforcing a greater measure of direct rule by the colonial Governor.'\n\nNatives in one of our colonies are dissatisfied with our rule, and we need to make a decision on how to deal with the discontent.
We make no concessions to threats and violence
We must seek to negotiate an equitable settlement

Things have gone from bad to worse in $PROVINCENAME$, where the Colonial Police, while in pursuit of two locals suspected of murdering a colonial official, have happened to disturb a shrine of some importance to local religiosity. Natives in the area are infuriated over the perceived lack of respect for their religion.
Who gives a hoot about their religion anyway?

A colonial regiment in one of our states threatens to spring into open rebellion, following dissatisfaction over being led by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ commanders. According to military reports, the native recruits have had a hard time adapting to the strict military discipline of a modern army, but a minority report from the Colonial Office speaks of several instances of pugilism and poor behavior from our officers.
Lazy natives need to learn to adapt!

It is unclear if there was, perhaps, something in the air that year. Some theorized that it might have been due to unusual solar activity, others maintained it was nothing but a series of unfortunate coincidences -- a convergence of catastrophes, if you will -- but, whatever had caused it, $YEAR$ saw a wave of unrest spreading through the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies like wildfire through a dry brushland.'\n\nA wave of unrest shakes our colonies, and we must decide on how to handle it. Concessions to the natives will come at the price of a serious loss of international face, but can we handle not giving them?
We must remain calm. This situation will pass.
We shall make whatever concessions necessary to preserve the calm

Tensions in $PROVINCENAME$, $STATENAME$, have been running high for quite some time, but lately there seems to have been a change in the wind. Things seem calmer in the area, for some reason, and many militants are returning to useful occupations. It might be that we are perceived as too strong to resist, but it might also just be that the anger has burned itself out.

The high militancy in $PROVINCENAME$, $STATENAME$, has erupted into a statewide emergency, as violent fighting and looting breaks out on the streets. The situation threathens to turn into a massacre unless something is done soon. Colonial Police are standing by, ready to intervene and attempt to restore order, but are holding back pending detailed instructions from the Governor.

And it is therefore the strongest possible recommendation of the Colonial Office that the colony in question be reorganized and reincorporated to prevent the further slide into bueraucratic mismanagement that it has experienced over the past few years, lest wanton spending of public resources, corruption and inefficiencies should all become its bywords.'\n\nOne of our colonies has, due to the lack of an efficient administration, descended into a state of widespread mismanagment. The Colonial Office suggests a reincorporation of the colony to get rid of the problems, but that might be impopular with the locals.
Leave it be. Hopefully the situation will resolve itself.
Reincorporate the colony and take steps to prevent this in the future

While anti-$COUNTRY_ADJ$ sentiments have been festering in the colony for some time, it is only very recently that the simmering discontent has erupted into open violence. During the past few months alone, three colonial officials have been killed in the colony, and it is becoming increasingly clear that something must be done about the situation, lest it spin out of control.'\n\nThe calm in one of our colonies has proved deceptive, as native unrest and displeasure with colonial rule has flashed into a state of near open rebellion in a matter of days. The calm before the storm is decidedly over.
This is something, therefore it must be done!

Lions, Elephants, Giraffes, Buffalo, Panthers and Rhinoceros, the magic and attraction of Africa certainly lies to no small an extent in its many and varied flora and fauna. Big Game hunting has become a major attraction in $PROVINCENAME$, bringing in tourists and tax revenue to all of $STATENAME$. A proposal has surfaced that we invite foreign dignitaries to partake in the $PROVINCENAME$ hunting. While this will certainly boost our international prestige, the locals might not be too happy about tourists trampling around in their plantations.
Let us leave the lion sleeping in its jungle
Hunting is just a part of the circle of life

Heia Safari! There is much to see in the $PROVINCENAME$ wilds, and what better way is there to see it than on a safari? Put on your pith helmet and saddle up, because tonight we ride 'til the sun sets, or rises, depending on the heat. $PROVINCENAME$ has become quite a little magnet for wealthy Europeans wanting to experience the beauty and magic of Africa first hand, and modern steamers bring them in like never before. The local fauna has, indeed, been gifted with a new species of wildlife lately: The European Safari-goer.
This will reflect beautifully on us!
Let us invite that ambassador... what was his name?

Land! Liberty! Labour!'\n\nThe Colonial Office has suggested we organize a recruitment drive to get more of our people to migrate to the colonies, so as to establish a more permanent $COUNTRY_ADJ$ prescense in them. The Office has found a colony which it deems suitable for such a drive, and the proposal is really only awaiting our signature.
I believe we must focus on the homefront first

I was born under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. All my life, I have dressed in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clothes, been taught and spoken the language of $COUNTRY$. It should not surprise anyone that I am willing to die for my country.'\n\nA tradition of support for $COUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule has taken hold in one of our colonies, and several natives have expressed support for ideas, that have floated about the Colonial Office for some time, of setting up native military regiments to help maintain order in our Colonies.
My loyal subjects, you serve your country best at home!
A fantastic idea that we should spare no effort in implementing

Me say, load the Banana Boat all night long. Day de light and I wanna go home.'
- The Banana Boat Song

With the expansion of our colonial ventures, goods previously unkown to the general public are increasingly being shipped overseas to be enjoyed back home. A banana boat has just docked in one of our harbors, and our citizens marvel at the sweetness and strange looks of this amazing new fruit, previously unknown to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ public, as it is being unloaded by the crateload. People are, quite literally, going bananas.

So, you see, if $CAPITAL$ could, perhaps, be able to lend us a hand in this little venture of ours, we would be very, very pleased.'\n\nThe government has been approached by several leading members of the country's industrialist elite, who believe that they have found a new possibly profitable racket to dip their fingers in. The proposal concerns one of our colonies, where several acres of viable farmland could potentially be exploited more efficiently under new and industrialized forms of agriculture. Naturally, this proposal would require the expropriation by the state of said land, to then be sold at a fair market price to the interestes of capital. Mere technicalities, am I right?
Get out of my hair you profiteering scumbags
The customer is always rig... I mean... the government shall duly consider this

And what I can not fathom is why our government insists on paying thousands, if not millions, of pounds, yearly, to maintain imperialistic projects overseas that serve only as strains on the national budget. We were not invited to the colonies, and, frankly, I find our presence in them to be rude.'\n\nAn anti-colonial malaise has taken hold in $COUNTRY$, where more and more of our people are beginning to question our colonial ambitions. The colonies are increasingly being seen more as burdens than as boons, and this situation is beginning to hamper our ability to motivate them before the general public.
The colonies are of vital importance to the nation
We must undertake a national campaign in favor of them

And when we consider the injustices, wrought by representatives of $COUNTRY$ in the colonies, we will not be surprised to find that '$COUNTRY_ADJ$', in those many places, far beyond our country's shores, has become a byword for theft, larceny and murder. Our message here today is loud and clear: $COUNTRY$! Quit the colonies!'\n\nAn Anti-Colonial League has been formed by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ radicals. Ostensibly dominated by intellectuals arguing the cause of colonial independence, reports from our Secret Police make it evident that the League is intimately connected with the Socialist Internationale.

With the competition for colonies constantly increasing, as European nations scramble for Africa and the World, $COUNTRY$ has done well for itself. One $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colony has, in the past few years, become internationally recognized as the model of a well managed European colony, and the attention that this colony has garnered for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial policy, in the parliaments and courts of Europe, is proving a wonderful boon for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ research and international prestige.

And while I fully respect my colleague from the loyal opposition, I still cannot help but to question his motives in again and again bringing up the subject of the expenses of the Colonial Office. The colonies are a cornerstone of government policy, and worth paying for.'\n\nThe colonies are making headlines in $COUNTRY$ again, following a fierce debate in the Upper House. Members of the opposition have argued in favor of a reduction of the budget alotted to the Colonial Office, and both they and majority MPs have conducted major offensives in the Upper House, to try and convince swing-voters and aisle-crossers to come out in support of their respective policies.

A slowly unraveling corruption scandal in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonial Office shakes $CAPITAL$, as a major newspaper publishes reports detailing an extensive network of bribes and favors, designed to give certain private interests preferential treatment with regards to colonial trade and exploitation. Critics of government policy point to the relatively low wages and poor funds alotted to colonial officials as determining reasons for the scandal, while the prevailing mood in government circles seems to be that a culture of corruption within the private sector is to blame for the poor state of the Colonial Office.
The government must accept responsibility for its own shortcomings
The office is in the pocket of Big Industry, and Big Industry is to blame!

The growth of our colonies has turned $CAPITAL$ into the constantly expanding cultural and economic nave of an Empire. Every day, with every passing hour, people from every conceivable corner, of the world we have made ours, arrive in our capital: To court our ministers, to trade with merchants, engineers and industrialists, and to experience any one of the multitude of fates that $CAPITAL$ affords its visitors. Standing at $CAPITAL$ Central, one can see all around oneself a small panorama of the world, hear spoken any and all of the varying tongues and languages of the world and smell both the scents and the odors of far away lands. In the annals of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Empire, the years around $YEAR$ will always be remembered as the golden age of $CAPITAL$.

While the discovery of new lands has always meant the discovery of new diseases and malaises, one of our colonies has recently begun to develop a reputation of being a particularly disease-ridden place. From malaria to colds both common and uncommon, it seems that travelers to and from the colony always catch or bring that little something unsavory extra. According to reports published by a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ doctor established in the colony, a concerted government effort at draining local swamps and marshes, as well as at improving local sanitation, could help the colony, but, of course, such efforts are not free.
Naturally we must aid the colony, and help strive for its betterment

One of our colonies is reporting astounding successes in the development of local commercial ventures and businesses to the Colonial Office. According to the local governor, the primary reason seems to be an ambitious land reform, undertaken in tandem with $COUNTRY_ADJ$ capitalists and industrialists. The colony is reportedly becoming more attractive to immigrants, and the report reflects well on our industrialists as well.
Cover up the report, lest the capitalists get uppity!

An archeological excavation in one of our colonies has yielded fantastic results in the form of several artifacts, tentatively dated to the late paleolithic. The discovery promises to give us new insights in the ancient life and development of the area, and The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ National Archeological society is hailing the discoveries as a great breakthrough for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archeology. The artifacts obviously need to be put in a museum, but where should we put them? The Archeological society strongly argues in favor of The $CAPITAL$ Museum of History, while others have hinted that it might be better to just put them in a local museum.
Just display the baubles somewhere locally
This will teach future generations about the common heritage of mankind

A situation has presented itself in one of our colonies, where several prominent $CAPITAL$ capitalists have controlling interests in local trade. One of their ventures, a small, local machine shop, run by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ specialists, works on western industrial standards well into the small hours of the morning. The sound from the machine shop is preventing anyone and everyone in the immediate vicinity of the shop from getting much sleep at night, and the issue has become a symbol for many, broader, pent up frustrations with our colonial rule.
If the shop needs to operate at those hours, who are we to have opinions about that?
I suppose we could drop by the Chamber of Commerce and have a chat with the boys...

Despite the death of the 'Father of the Revolution', Jacinto de Gravina in 1830, his followers lead by Federico de las Casas and Juan Manuel Santos continued fighting the Spanish colonial government and eventually banished the Spanish from the New World. But the de Gravina's dream of united Gran Colombia soon deteriorated into disputes over the distribution of powers. The self-declared provisional president, de las Casas, called representatives of all important factions to Andagoya, in one last desperate try to safe the unity of the newborn republic. Will he succeed?
We shall wait for the result, as everyone in Gran Colombia

The Congress that opened to decide the future of Gran Colombia is divided into three great tendencies: de las Casas and the united Colombians want the current situation to endure and Spaniards to take over the New-World, Granadino separatists want to leave the Federation thinking Mexico has taken too much power and finally the Federalistas want prefer a loose association of smaller sister republics and an end to Mexican hegemony over Lusitanians and Salvadoreños.
De las Casas and the Colombians take the stage.
The Granadino separatists secure the first debates.
The Federalistas critics convince the assembly.

Tragedy has mercilessly stricken Andagoya - first a great fire has devastated a section of the city, and now fighting between Salvadoreños and Granadinos has broken out in the streets. The refusal of a nearby federal army unit, composed largely of Granadino recruits, to risk their lives in a firefighting mission in a city far north of their homeland has incensed the Salvadoreño locals, who now demand retribution. Our government must take stance on this unfortunate series of events, even at the risk of antagonising one of the feuding parties. Punishing the Granadino leaders will turn public opinion in Granada against the central government, while condemning the Salvadoreños would put in jeopardy the very idea of interregional cooperation and solidarity.
The Granadinos are to blame here obviously.

The Catholic Church has issued a decalration listing a series of conditions that must be met in order for the continued support of the clergy for the interim government. Among the demands stand out the imperative of maintaining the inviolability of church land and the perpetuation of the fueros, the rights of the clergy to maintain special ecclesiastical courts independent of the state. Accepting the Church's demands would ensure their loyalty in the upcoming trials that the Republic will face, though at the cost of hampering national progress and regeneration. Antagonising the priests, nevertheless, will surely mean that the clergy will start to see a collection of independent and weak republics as less likely to infringe on their privileges than a united Gran Colombia.
Church privilege has no place in the future of Gran Colombia.
Bend the knee to the Clergy.

Now that the war is over and the Spanish have been expelled from the continent many are starting to question the role the Army should have in the Republic.
