The current Tetrarchy of generals still opreates under wartime exceptional measures that place it outside of civilian control and, though so far it has not interfered with the drafting of the Constitution, some fear that any attempts to curtail their privileges and rein in their independence will lead to a Coup d'Etat. Appeasing the Tetrarchy, however, carries its own set of risks and is surely to be seen as unacceptable to the Salvadoreños and Granadinos, who fear Mexican imperialism as much as they detested Spanish colonialism.
The Army was fundamental in liberating the New World and shall keep certain priviliges
Our new state should avoid giving too much power to the military

Although the native people have been freed from the previous colonial system of encomienda and castas they remain a disempowered underclass struggling with social and economic change brought about by the new century. The Independence of Gran Colombia brought freedom only to the criollos, who hoard the wealth and political power in the state. Gran Colombia was founded as an Hispanic country and the government would lose legitimacy if privileges were given to the 'Indios'. Yet the provinces populated by natives are falling into a worrysome spiral of violence as the Caciques lose their grip on an ever-more desperate and radicalised peasantry, setting the conditions for a potentially explosive situation that might only be defused through deep and thorough reform of the municipal system and the enfranchisment of the natives.
We are Gran Colombia, a Hispanic country!
We could maybe grant them some concessions.

Slavery is a widespread pratice throughout Gran Colombia, with Afro-Latinos representing the second ethnic group in the Federation, and is vital for the Haciendas held by powerful landowners which posses great influence in the Congress. It seems nevertheless that the war against Spain was akin to opening Pandora's Box and the slaves, having scented freedom in the revolutionary currents that carried Gran Colombia to Independence, will not go back to the Haciendas contently. Liberals in the Congress deplore the hypocrisy of maintaining such a wicked institution alive, and warn of the potential violent consequences of acquiescing to the wishes of the landowners.
We should not anger the local Hacendados.
We will abolish this inhumane practise!

After much deliberation, common ground was found and a new Constitution has been drafted, promising both liberty and unity to all citizens of Gran Colombia. It seems like the republic will endure, with the consent of its people!
Failure of the Congress of Andagoya

Mutual distrust and resistance within the member states has foiled the attempt at crafting a common constitution. The representatives of Quito, Arequipa, Santandera, Castilla and Essequibo have reaffirmed their independence and stormed out of the Congress. We can accept the result and solidify our regime north of the Andagoya Isthmus, or reject it and throw ourselves at the arms of the Tetrarchy, establishing a dictatorship capable of forcibly unifying Gran Colombia.
This is Treason! Democracy has failed us!
Separatists triumph in the Congress of Andagoya

After days of debates, the representatives of the various provinces have been drawn together by their common desire for full sovereignty. Talks of a common constitution and state have collapsed. We can accept this, or establish a Dictatorship and enforce our rule.
This is Treason! Democracy has failed us!
With our newly gained independence we have to choose our form of government. The conference in our capital has just began.
With our newly gained independence we have to choose our form of government. The conference in our capital has just began.
With our newly gained independence we had to choose our form of government. The results are now clear

During the congress here in the Andagoya City, the ambassadors of Mesoamerigan nations secretly decided that they will oppose the federationists and they came to found an union of their own. Meet United Mesoameriga

During the congress here in the Andagoya City, the ambassadors of Mesoamerigan nations secretly decided that they will oppose the federationists but their tries to unite themselves ended as a disaster - like everything in this congress.
With the fate of Gran Colombia decided, the emissaries from the southern states met and tried to form a new unified country. They succeeded and the Federation of Granada is the result.
Let they have what they want

With the fate of Gran Colombia decided, the emissaries from the southern states met and tried to form a new unified country. They failed but Castilla and Santandera claimed that they are the true heirs of the Viceroyalty of New Granada and shall rule it entirely. Quito and Arequipa formed an union to oppose their imperialistic tries. The mess is far from over.
Let they have what they want

With the fate of Gran Colombia decided, the emissaries from the southern states met and tried to form a new unified country. They failed but Castilla and Santandera claimed that they are the true heirs of the Viceroyalty of New Granada and shall rule it entirely. The mess is far from over.
Let they have what they want

With the fate of Gran Colombia decided, the emissaries from the southern states met and tried to form a new unified country. They failed and the ascending states are now free to oppress each other. The mess is far from over.
Let they have what they want
Beginning of the Council of Italy.
Italian representatives have gathered in Florence to discuss unification.
We will await the will of the Italian people

The Revolutionary Republic of Etruria has called for a council of Italian states to further the cause of Italian unification. Should we support the cause of Italian unification or maintain the status quo?
There has not been enough support for Italian unification and the Council of Italy has failed. Only foreign intervention or a strong Italian state can give hope for Italian unification now.

The Council of Italy has led to the enlargement of the Etrurian republic but it was not sufficient to really create an Italian state. It seems though that Italian unification might be done in a few years.

There has been enough support for Italian unification for the Council of Italy to be declared a success, but we need to be wary of how the Great Powers of Europe will react to the Unification of Italy. Perhaps now any Italian state that has refused to support unification will reconsider and join us.
With the Etrurian Republic in control of the former Emilian duchies we appear stronger in the current negotiations!
With the Etrurian Republic in control of the former duchy of Ferrara we appear stronger in the current negotiations!
With the success of the Council of Italy, the new Republic of Italy has asked us to reconsider joining a united Italy. A refusal is likely to lead to war with Italy.
With the creation of the Republic of Italy, we should consider our diplomatic policy towards the new state.

The new Republic of Italy is a dangerous threat to us and could cause us to loss or Italian holdings and enter a period of decline. We can't let this happen. We must dismantle this new Italian state and put an end to the threat that they present.
Italy has been formed in the middle of the Council of Italy event series.

The debates on the future of Italy have been divided since the start between Etrurians and Monarchists. Lately the monarchist orators have been better than their Etrurian counterparts and have thus gained some influence in the Council.

The debates on the future of Italy have been divided since the start between Etrurians and Monarchists. Lately the Etrurian orators have been better than their Monarchist counterparts and have thus gained some influence in the Council.

The Pope, being the head of the Church command a wide respect amongst the faithful in Italy -and abroad. So when he declared that the idea of Italian unification was a noble idea worth of being pursued helped the cause of the Etrurians. Of course his critics on secularism, liberalism and his secular power were left out of the newspapers...

The Pope, the head of the Catholic Church has issued an encyclical against the 'sins' of Etruria and calling for the good Christians to denounce their behaviour and their ideas. Religion is an important societal component and his actions have left the Etrurians weakened.
Etruria is respected as a Great Power in Europe and thus appear as the natural leader of the Risorgimento.
We are the only chance Italy has!
Etruria is far from being respected amongst the European powers and it has thus been hard for them to appear as the obvious leader of the Italians.

Since their conquest of Provence the Dual-Monarchy has been interested in creating an Italian state favorable to their interests. Recently we have heard that some members of the Council would have changed their stance following 'gifts' from Paris, thus hampering our progess toward Italian unity.
The King of Aragon has attacked us wanting to destroy the Italian Republic
We will win in the end

The Trustee System, or 'Trusty System', was a corrections system originated in the U.S. state of Mississippi, but also employed in Alabama, Texas, Louisiana and others, under which prison convicts with a record of good behavior (often equated with obedience) were allowed to police other prison inmates in a strict, pseudo-military hierarchy of power, with some inmates, deemed especially trustworthy, even being allowed to carry firearms. For profit convict labor was a corner stone of the system. The trustee system was first employed on the Parchman Farm prison in Mississippi, and was, as the 19th century turned into the 20th, much lauded as a profitable and modern corrections system. Reports of widespread inmate abuses would end the system in the 1970s, but, in $YEAR$, it was all the rage in certain $COUNTRY_ADJ$ states.
The whip cracks out of love!

The idea of isolating offenders and breachers of the public peace from society in general is probaby as old as time itself. Many classical systems of justice included banishment from the realm as a last resort type of punishment, reserved for serious crimes and offences, and such punishment was not seldom considered worse than a death penalty. With the growth of the European colonial empires during the 18th and 19th centuries, these ideas recieved a modern incarnation in the form of the penal colony, with renowned (or infamous) examples being the British colony at Botany Bay and the French 'Devil's Island' in French Guiana. Since $COUNTRY$ occupies several territories that could be well suited for such a purpose, perhaps we ourselves should consider establishing such institutions?
No one escapes from Azazel's Atoll!
I think there are more humane solutions to consider
Since we no longer hold any territories suitable for the purpose, our Penal Colony system has been abolished.
Oh well, it had to be so

Two dirty day-rooms, and three offensive night-rooms: That for men eight feet square: one of the women's, nine by eight, the other four and a half feet square: the straw, worn to dust, swarmed with vermin: no court: no water accessible to prisoners. The petty offenders were in irons: at my last visit, eight were women.'
- John Howard

A penal reform league has formed in $COUNTRY$, protesting the miserable conditions in our country's prisons and correctional facilities and institutions. The League argues for single ceiling accomodation policies in prisons, along with several other ideas aiming to improve the cramped living conditions.
The prisons are dirty for a reason, sweetie.
Certain reforms are arguably in order
We must first secure a majority in the upper house

$COUNTRY$ is in a state of collective shock, as news broke today of a foul murder committed in one of our states. A young girl working as a prostitute in the state was found brutally battered by a client, and rumor has it that the police are covering up the identity of the murderer, who, it has been claimed, belongs to a rich banking family of some local renown. Police, however, maintain that they are still investigating the matter, but that no perpetrator has yet been located. The affair is on everyone's lips, and the debate has even reached parliament, where liberal MPs demand answers from the government regarding the matter.
Demand that police produce a perpetrator
Let us not throw allegations wildly about.

Up and down the roads they march, in single narrow defile, carrying with them, wherever they go, the iron chains of unfree men. These people are not slaves, but convicts, and they have been sentenced by courts and magistrates of justice and peace, to work and spill their sweat under the burning sun. They are a common sight in $COUNTRY$, for there are many men like them. Forced labor is, and has long been, one of the most common forms of punishment available to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ courts. Hard work, it has been said, will improve the moral understanding of these cretins, and, therefore, work they do.
We need to consider more humane forms of punishment

A state-wide manhunt has been called in one of our states, as police report that a convicted murderer has escaped from a local prison facility. While unsettling in itself, the news has also brought our nation's prison system to the public spot-light, fueling a national debate on the issues of crime & punishment. Liberals argue that the escape merely serves as further indictment of the delapidated and tragic state of our nation's prison system, while conservatives point to the natural constraints on the national budget, and argue that we should not spend the better part of our money on what is arguably the worst part of our citizenry.

And then we have this little fellow. Started out with the proverbial pins and needles and pretty soon he was on to robbing banks. He'll be spending the rest of his life here, so we keep him in chains most of the time. I suspect it will drive him insane in a few years, if it hasn't already.'\n\nImprisonment for life, without the possibilit of parole, is not an uncommon punishment in $COUNTRY$, however, in certain liberal circles there have been arguments on the nature of crime and punishment lately, with the opinion being advanced that a human being in chains is incapable of being swayed by the angels of his better nature, while kept under miserable conditions. There is a growing movement for a liberalization of the prison laws.
I say we stick with the old ways

As the 19th century dawned on Europe, the practice of jailing people who defaulted on their debts was still norm. In England, infamous examples of such institutions - Debtor's Prisons - include London's Fleet Prison. In these institutions debtors where not seldom expected to pay for both board and room, and sometimes even special 'Jailor's Fees', to effectively pay their jailors for their upkeep. Often times, these practices only served to further complicate the debtor's financial situation, as it for natural reasons is hard to earn money from inside a prison wall. The system was gradually abandoned in most European countries throughout the 19th century, and London's Fleet Prison was torn down in 1846. A wrongly jailed $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocrat is now drawing public attention to these institutions, calling for their abolishment.
I am not convinced. People need to learn lessons in life

A debate in the $CAPITAL$ Reform Club tonight, regarding the death penalty, has seen new arguments advanced from the opponents of the punishment. Focusing in on the irrevocability of the punishment, in tandem with the ever present risk of wrongful sentencing, liberals have joined together to form a Citizen's committe to abolish the sentence. The debate has been caused by the much publicized recent execution of an elderly gentleman convicted of murdering his wife, despite the fact that the man was clearly in the advanced stages of age related dementia. The newly founded committee calls upon members of parliament to speak out against what they consider to be the most horrendous of injustices, and have sought an audience with the cabinet to explain their position.
I shall certainly be happy to meet with them
I do not have time for the foppish drivel of bleeding-heart liberals!
Dangerous ideas are afloat in $COUNTRY$, with the first stirrings of resistance against our nation's ruler being reported. Such talk is kept quiet, if there is truth to it at all.
It shall not amount to much.
Work with these people to solve their issues.
Good. We need no interference in $STATENAME$.
Let the world think what it likes.

The ongoing Ottoman Civil war present us with an interesting choice right now. We have asserted our independence from the Empire recently and we have become a beacon of hope for the Slav populations living under the Muslim yoke. A proposition was made recently to enter a war against the Empire to free Serbia before Hungary or another vulture takes the territory for itself. Or we could just wait for the Empire to be in an even worse situation and take the territory for ourselves .
We will free Serbia from the Ottomans!
It is not the right time...
The Sultan has conceded us the vilayet of Serbia. We will now look carefully the actions of our Slavic brothers...
Our brothers need to be protected
The end of the Personal Union

Serbia has been ruled by our king since its liberation near the end of the Ottoman Civil War but has enjoyed a relative autonomy in its internal affairs. The young king Tomislav II who was crowned recently has decided to bring this matter to its end and has reclaimed the unification of the crown of Tomislav and Stefan.
The Illyrian king has issued a declaration in which he asks for a closer union of the Croats and the Serb. But can we really trust him?
The Union of the Croats and the Serbs
Serbia is now an integral part of our nation and its people is supporting our rule!
Belgrade and the entire Serbian provinces have revolted and want to dethrone Tomislav II and put a Serb noble on the throne!

Before the Civil War, Montenegro was divided in various principalites. The Metropolitan finally achieved unification around him and went on expelling the powerful Simic family which ruled Kotor. The heir to the war hero Peter Simic, Joseph Simic is an idealistic panslavist and he has many times confessed that his father wanted Montenegro to join the Illyian kingdom. We could let him act and enter Montenegro with followers to see if we could not force the Metropolitan to bow before us.

The Illyrian have allowed the claimant to the dukedom of Montenegro, Jospeh Simic to sneak into Kotor where he actually tries to convince people to join our heretic neighbour. Should we take action against him, it is likely the Croat will advance into our country so we must try to find someone to back our independence.
The Metropolitan will step down and accept the claim of Simic...
Contact Venice we need help to defend ourselves...
Contact Aragon we need help to defend ourselves...
Contact Italy we need help to defend ourselves...
Our agent, the duke of Kotor has taken power in Montenegro and has asked to join our kingdom!
That was a good idea to send him
The Illyrians threaten the rule of the Metropolitan who has asked us to protect him. How should we react?
It is not in our interest
The Metropolitan has been swift to act against Simic. He expelled him and has found an ally to protect him in case we decide to invade his country...
We will let them alone... for now
We will take Montenegro by force then. Nothing stops the Yugoslavs!

The Metropolitan tried to find someone to protect him after the expulsion of Simic but $FROMCOUNTRY$ refused to protect him. We can now easily override their defences and annex Montenegro into our glorious kingdom!
We will take Montenegro by force then. Nothing stops the Yugoslavs!

During the Ottoman Civil War, Hungary attacked the Empire and took Belgrade while we were liberating Serbia. It has been a long time since their campaign of 'protection' of the Serbs and we have a duty to ask them to give Belgrade to the crown of Stefan

The Illyian King has issued a declaration in which he demands us to relinquish the Serbian lands we captured during the Civil War. The Serbs have been restless around their old capital and holding unto them will harm relations with our allies.
Like we would give up Belgrade
Hungary has refused to give back Belgrade to Serbia. It is our duty to fight and free Serbia from the horrid Magyar!
We have no other choices then!

To ensure the peace between our nations, Dahomey has been paying us tribute ever since the 18th century. It has become tradition at this point, but Dahomey has just rejected it. The tribute was the only thing keeping us from attacking them, now we let's show them why they paid it in the first place!
We have managed to keep our independence and are no longer obligated to pay tribute to the Oyo Empire. This is a great day for our nation. Let the flag of the elephant fly in the winds!
It is a dark day for our nation, we tried to break free and we failed. This was not the day of the flag of the elephant...

The Dahomey Amazons were originally established as a group of female elephant hunters in the 17th century by King Houegbadja, in the early 18th century his son, King Agaja, made them into the bodyguards of the king, armed with muskets. According to tradition, Agaja also developed them into a militia that helped win a war against the Kingdom of Savi. What their job in the army always has been is just to hold banners to make the army seem bigger than it actually is, however some suggest that we might make even better use of them if they were turned into an actual female corp that'd fight.
Summon the daughters of every family for military training!
Keep them ceremonial and let them help the economy when we're at peace

The idea of an absolute monarch being able to rule better than a feudal one is spreading throughout the kingdom, although not widespread it continues to be more and more popular. They are taking the European states and some of our neighbors as proof of absolutism being better, seeing as many of them seem to be more successful. Maybe we can capitalize on this and abolish the stubborn tribes of our Kingdom?
We must implement these ideas immediately
We can't break this age old tradition

The market for slavery is doing worse and worse everyday, people don't want to buy new ones and instead try to sell their old ones. Some of the reasons for this are that slaves have demanded more and more rights under the years and you now have the responsability of taking care of your slaves well being aswell as many slave revolts in the Kingdom resulting in several owners killed. The advisers are trying to come up with ideas with how we can fix this problem, but so far the only options we seem to have are either loosening the restrictions on owning a slave and encouraging slavery amongst the farms or just completely abolish slavery as many consider it unethical aswell as it not being very benefitial for the economy.
I suppose it's a bit outdated

The culture in Dahomey has always been very distinct from elsewhere in Africa. Much of the arts are subsidized by the royal family and the artists aren't of any specific class, but instead can be created by anyone from a lord to a peasant. One of the many things that make our country so great is the Royal Palaces of Abomey which are several palaces spread over a large complex, every palace contains stone carvings depicting the many accomplishments of the king and every king had his own palace. There are two unique aspects of art in Dahomey, firstly it's the assembling of different components, using many different materials, and secondly it's the borrowing of culture from neighboring people. Some say our focus should lie in developing our own culture, but many are also intrigued by the cultures of the outside world. We could either focus on and subsidize our own local culture and develop it or we could embrace some of the western ideas in hopes of becoming more like them or we could embrace some of our islamic neighbors' traditions and learn from them instead.
Embrace our own great and beautiful culture
Embrace some of the western beliefs
Integrate some of the islamic culture into our society

While there's no doubt that our country is great and beautiful it is no lie that we are behind many other countries in the region, especially the European nations on the coast. We must combat this by developing our own country into something it couldn't even imagine a few generations ago. One of the biggest reasons the Europeans, and some of our neighbors, are so ahead is their academia, their's are much larger than ours. To be able to transform into a developed country we must increase it, however we're not completely sure of what the best way of doing do would be. Some say educating the people is the best way, just look at the literacy rate in Europe, while some say that we should just further educate what we have and refine it into an elite.
We must educate our people, it is a human right!
We should focus on further educating our already intelligent

Recently we've recieved several reports of of raidings from the Ewe chiefs, and all of them are claiming that the raiders are Akans. They are telling us that the raiders are coming on a weekly basis, stealing food and loot. Confronting some of the leaders of the Akan people they told us that they were former soldiers who pillaged for food and then claimed that they couldn't do anything about it.
Helping A Home or A Helping Hand?

Our nation has developed into something so magnificent, all of Africa adores it. Our great handling of diplomacy, economy and military has led us to this beautiful moment. The only question left is, where do we go now? People in the capital have talked about a great metropolis that might aswell be the capital of Africa, others have mentioned that we should help the other peoples of Africa reach the same greatness as us by embracing them into our society.
Our capital will be the envy of Africa!
We should embrace and help our minorities.
The lands of the Yoruba people are under our control and administration. The the benevolent rulers wer are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Ibo people are under our control and administration. The the benevolent rulers wer are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Ibibio people are under our control and administration. The the benevolent rulers wer are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Kru people are under our control and administration. The the benevolent rulers wer are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Mossi people are under our control and administration. The the benevolent rulers wer are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
Dangerous ideas are afloat in $COUNTRY$, with the first stirrings of resistance against our nation's ruler being reported. Such talk is kept quiet, if there is truth to it at all.
It shall not amount to much.

These are the headlines in the revolutionary newspaper being secretly printed in $PROVINCENAME$. Nobody seems to know who is behind it, and so far inquiries have turned up nothing. It seems the agitators are better organized than we thought.
Find those responsible and shut down this tripe!
Thousands of people flooded into $CAPITAL$'s central square today, demanding a democratic constitution and universal suffrage. Breaking up the crowd will lead to violence, with more to surely come.
Our secret police have reported evidence of armed revolutionaries organizing in $COUNTRYNAME$. Should we make an investigation?
Chasing them will only rouse more anger.
Yes! Increase efforts to track them down.
Our secret police have found the revolutionaries' hideout and arrested all activists.

An unknown assailant made an assasination attempt on $COUNTRY$'s president, but, thanks to his bodyguards, the president remained unharmed. Unfortunately, the attacker was slain and could not be questioned for information. Police have redoubled their search for the conspirators responsible.

Today is a grim day for $COUNTRY$. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ president has been shot dead this night in $CAPITAL$. He was the victim of an ambush plotted by radical liberals. The country has been thrown into mourning, though even now there is word that factions in $COUNTRY$ are maneuvering to either find a successor to take the president's place or overthrow the dictatorship once and for all.

With the death of $COUNTRY$'s president, the dictatorship has come to an end. Pro-democracy forces have succeeded in taking control of $CAPITAL$, and are already promising widespread reforms as well as a new constitution.

The death of the president has not succeeded in causing $COUNTRY$'s dictatorship to crumble. His new successor greeted a crowd in $CAPITAL$, waving from the balcony of the presidential palace. Already the new president's supporters are searching out revolutionary hideouts, determined to prevent the same fate from befalling $COUNTRY$'s new leader.
All shall be right in $COUNTRY$ once more.
After years of dictatorship $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens finally enjoy freedom.

One of the most common killers in the 19th century was tuberculosis, an infectious disease in humans that usually targets the lungs. Known today to be caused by various strains of mycobacteria, the historical explanations for tuberculosis range from vampirism to imbalances in the 'cardinal fluids'. Known since ancient times, and first described as a contagious disease by Avicenna in 1020, typical symptoms of the disease include chronic cough, fever, and the expulsion of blood-tinged phlegm. In the 19th century, the disease was sometimes romanticized, as several famous authors and poets of the era were known sufferers.

Despite economic and technological advances in the Western World, one of the oldest killers known to man, hunger, was still claiming victims in Europe and the Americas well into the 20th century. Primarily so, of course, among the already poor. Famine has struck one of our states, and we need to react.
Sorry, I gave at the office.

Most commonly transmitted through the ingestion of contaminated food or water, exasparated by combinations of poor hygiene, cramped living and lacklustre public sanitation, Typhoid fever was one of the major killers of the 19th century. In Chicago alone, 174 deaths per 100,000 was, in 1891, caused by typhoid fever. The disease, which generally starts of as a mild fever, will over the course of a few weeks manifest itself in internal bleedings and delirium, potentially causing death. While improvements in sanitary conditions eventually came to more or less eradicate the disease in the developed world, at least one $COUNTRY_ADJ$ state was nevertheless hit hard in $YEAR$.

The 'Spanish' Flu was an influenza pandemic that killed somewhere between 50-100 million people worldwide between the years 1918 to 1920. Due to increased trade, colonial contacts, commerce and other myriads of global connections that had all increasingly made the world a smaller place throughout the 19th century, the Spanish flu was able to spread quickly across the world in a mere few years. Further aggrevated by the on-going first world war, and the cramped living conditions in the trenches, the Spanish flu is one of the first and most terrifying examples of a truly global pandemic. And... come to think of it... haven't you been feeling a bit feverish, lately?
Fight the disease with every avaliable means

Smallpox, a highly contagious disease caused by the Variola virus, killed approximately 400,000 Europeans per year at the end of the 18th century. Successful vaccination programs undertaken in the 19th and 20th centuries would eventually lead to the disease being classified as eradicated by the WHO in 1979, but that might be a small comfort to the people in that state of yours who, in $YEAR$, suffered hard from an outbreak of, exactly that: Smallpox.
Do whatever we can. Every life is precious!
Weak and unable to resist, you say?
For a long time we have coveted the Alpine passes held by the Duke of Savoy. The Dual-Monarchy faces open rebellion and is thus less inclined to protect the Duke.
Burgundy asks us to relinquish our Alpine lands to integrate them into 'the Duchy of Geneva'. With the Dual-Monarchy facing harsh unrest we should not count too much on their protection
We will not risk a war against Burgundy...
We will not surrender our ancestral lands!
The duke of Savoy has refused, meaning that only war will resolve the problem of the Alpes.

Ever since the Treaty of Rome in 1498, the Dual Monarchy has had to walk a fine line in not favouring one of its ethnic groups over the others. Recent censi have shown that the English and French represent around one-fifth of the population. What is more threatening to either group is not the other but rather a growing group calling themselves Anglois. These groups have created the dilemma for the monarchy in who to favor. There are those in power that believe that it is best to pick a side while others believe that the Anglois ideology of blending the best customs of English and French is the way of the future.
We are kings of France AND England
The Death of King Henri X

Tragedy has struck the Dual Monarchy as His Majesty King Henri X has passed with no heir. Due to traditional laws within the Dual Monarchy, the Estates-General has been called to select their choice for the next ruler of the Kingdom. The Estates have narrowed the selection between Elisabeth, Duchess of Anjou, Edouard, the Duke of York, and Henri, the Duke of Gascony.
Who will succeed on the throne?

Despite some opposition votes the Estates-General has declared that Elisabeth will be the next Queen of the Dual Monarchy. Being the daughter of the King's brother gave her the strongest claim to the throne but her pro-Anglois ties has led to some opposition from those in France and England. Both Edouard and Henri have respected the Estates decision and pledged their support to Elisabeth in the future of the Dual Monarchy

It took the Estates-General some rounds of voting but they have settled on Edouard, the Duke of York, as the next King of the Dual Monarchy. England has received the news with great joy while France is worried of potential retribution by the new king for past injustices. Elisabeth and Henri have renounced the throne but Henri vows that he will participate in the Parliament of Lords in preventing bias legislation by the King from being passed.

To the shock of many Henri, the Duke of Gascony, has been elected the next King of the Dual Monarchy. His election as King has been recieved with joy in the southern regions of the country but outrage has broken out in England. Elisabeth and Edouard has both renounced the throne but Edouard expressed his great displeasure with the results.
England is now free but what form of government shall it take?
We will crown a noble king of England

The Anglois will surely not let us go so easily and we are at a disadvantage. We need to contact a Great Power to counter the threat from Paris: Scandinavia has a good navy and shares a border in Scotland

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have revolted against the Dual-Monarchy and are asking to protect them from the Anglois. Such a move will lead to war against Paris but it is a golden opportunity to weaken the Plantagenets!
It is not in our interest...
The English will face our might!
The English will be taught the true power of the Dual-Monarchy!

After the questions of the last years, the monarchy has affirmed its French character. Rooted in Paris, the monarchy has gained the support of the French population and of its leaders. This French orientation has allowed them to suppress any rebellion in the South but in the same time has alienated them a great part of the English population...

The radicalization of the English society has increased over the past few months. The French turnout of Henri X has alienated him many Englishmen, who were eager to support the monarchy have turned to the liberal hydra. Yesterday the repression of a student manifestation in Cambridge has launched a spiral of violence all over England. It has culminated in the creation of the English Republic which is decided to push the French out of England. Apart from some loyalists bastion in Wales and Londres, the revolutionaries are already in control of most the island.

The king of the Dual-Monarchy has organised a great ceremony throughout the cities of France to honour his ancestor Louis XI king of France later sanctified as Saint Louis. He has put the accent on the treaty of Paris who settled peace between the Plantagenets and the Capetians. In a speech pronounced in the capital by Henri X affirming the French character of the monarchy who always has never forgotten its French roots. While praised on the continent, the speech has been criticized by many in England.

To further enhance his presence, Henri X decided to travel amongst France. He first visited Normandie where he praised his ancestor Guillaume who embarked to conquer England. He then turned to Brittany, a land attached to the Plantegenian monarchs. His travel led him then to La Rochelle. There he met several of the Young French leaders who spontaneously rallied to him and praised his signs in favour of France. He then travelled south passing through Gascony, Toulouse. He then made a stop in Vichy to remember the last great battle against the Valois before returning to the capital. Many people are acclaiming the king for this action that has strengthened the hold of the monarchy in France.
Les Plantagenets sont veritablement les rois des Français!

Lately a wave of contests have emerged in England towards the French turn-around of Henri X. The English people have been indeed absent from the speeches of Henri and many are looking to alternatives. A certain John Tolsmith, professor in Cambridge, lately published a monumental history of England before the Norman Conquest. His book has become incredibly popular amongst the English students who have created an association to valorise their English inheritance called the sons of Harold, in reference to Harold Godwinson, the last Anglo-Saxon king. While this may only be a cultural association, many of its members are prone to radical ideas and it is said that the slogan of Freiheit, Gleicheit, Brüderlichkeit are murmured in these circles
Spread of the Sons of Harold
The sons of Harold have implemented themselves in this province and are already spreading their ideas...

A dispute has emerged in the Sorbonne between two scholars to determine if English can be considered as a true language worthy of being spoken in the high spheres such as the government. While it can be seen as just a philological debate, we could influence the result in one way or the other.
Some noises made by peasants aren't a language!
English is as good as French
Do not take part in philological debates

Sadly our prime minister has died in office. It falls upon the monarch to choose a new prime minister. Three candidates have the favour of the Parliament: the duke of Richelieu, known for his inclination for the Young French, the duke of Rohan, the Breton moderate and lastly the duke of Devonshire, well-known in the island.

The English have organised a festival in Stratford upon Avon to honour a play-writer called William Shakespeare. Rediscovered by the sons of Harold, this unknown author has written many tragicomedies in English, which criticize heavily the Parisian Monarchy while praising English historical figures like his life of Alfred the Great in 4 plays. This festival could become a centre of protestation especially if they represent Henry VI
Let them have their festival, what could possibly happen?
Watch it and place it under heavy guard
The death of the Prince of Wales

While visiting England, the Prince of Wales and his entourage were attacked by radicals in the city of Liverpool. It resulted in the death of Henry, the heir of the Dual-Monarchy, his pregnant wife and his son. The attack made with an artisanal weaponry, that many call 'the Infernal Machine', was imagined by students affiliated to the Sons of Harold. While Tolsmith and his associates denied any implication in the organisation of the attack and vigorously condemned it, the King and the Parisian government are persuaded of the contrary and are determined in their grief to shut down the the organisation.

Despite the troubles of the past years the monarchy has asserted its English roots. With London and Paris weighing the same in political matters the monarchy has gained the support of the English population!

The English backlash of Henry X has alienated the Southern French lands. The local Occitans have always been more rebellious because of their protestant roots and also because of their support for the Valois kings. The Revolt launched in Toulouse by the Sons of St-Louis has gained the control of most Occitania! Now their provisional government will decide upon whether to host the Valois King as their rightful King or declare the Republic.
The Occitan state must now choose what form of government it shall be: will they welcome the Valois pretender or proclaim a free Republic?
We welcome the true kings of France!
The rebellious Occitan have acknowledged the Valois as the true Kings of France and pledged their loyalty to the reconquest of the throne.
The usurpers will be driven out!
Provence has taken control of our rebellious provinces and has pledged to not stop until Paris! We can't let them do this and must put an end to the War for the French Throne!
It is the last time the Valois deny our rights!
Occitania has affirmed as an independent Republic! We can't let them do such a thing!
It is the last time the Occitan rebel!
Creation of the Sons of St-Louis

A french nationalist organisation has been created yesterday in La Rochelle by a certain Francois Guizot, a university historian. The aim of this association is to strengthen the conscience of the French and Provencal people and make them aware of their distinctness from the British. The name has been taken from Louis XI, a King who was later canonized and who he is seen as a fatherly figure of French history. It is particularly popular amongst the French students and many fear they might be spreading revolutionary ideals...
Spread of the Sons of St-Louis
The sons of St-Louis have implemented themselves in this province and are already spreading their ideas...

To further enhance his presence, Henri X decided to travel amongst England. He first landed near Hastings where he praised his ancestor Guillaume who there managed to win the English crown. He then went to Londres where he visited the locals of the East Indian Company on the boards of the Tamise. His travel led him then to Cambridge and Ofxord. There he met several of the Young English leaders who spontaneously rallied to him and praised his signs in favour of England. He then travelled west and north passing through Wales and Livreport. He then made a stop in York to praise Richard Plantagenet, duke of York, one of the heroes of the early Dual-Monarchy. Many people are acclaiming the king for this action that has strengthened the hold of the monarchy in England.
The Plantegenets are truly the Kings of England!

A new school has appeared in arts. The Romanticists defy the laws established by the classical school of Paris and coming back to the roots of Baroque. It is especially successful in England. Tolsmith and Lord Byron are publishing poems taking their roots in the old Saxon mythology, Scnery is writing plays who are inspired by Shakespeare... This school has however little sucess amongst the literary critics of the capital who accuse them of recklessly crossing laws that were fixed by wise Elders.

Reconciling both French and English will not be an easy task, Henri X knows it very well. The two groups may not like each other but they hate Paris even more, so an alliance of both needs to be prevented. However one must not charge too much against one group unless one wants a local revolution to happen...
We will endure as we always have

Tensions in our English territories have reached a boiling point as all our attempts to placate the nationalists have failed. It all started with a Garrison in Liverpool declaring the authority of the Monarchy in Paris to be void - and like a wildfire, rebellion spread all over Northern England, coalescing into a self-proclaimed Provisional English Republic. All attempts at a peaceful resolution of this conflict have failed, and now we can only resort to violence.
English will be taught how to behave!
Despite the peril we managed to win against the revolutionaries, a fact that has strengthened our hold on all our territories
The English nationalists have secured their independence. We can't succeed in our current policy with them being independent
It is but a flesh wound!
The Southern parts of our kingdom have been secured! Despite the rebellion we can continue our policy of accepting both French and English!
The South has escaped from our power. With our mainland territories threatened we can't surely make our rule accepted in both England and France.
It is but a flesh wound!

The Midi - the region of the Midday Sun, is certainly one of our most picturesque Crown Lands. Its inhabitants, the Provençal, however, have always felt stranged, being alien to not only the Anglois elite in Paris but also the French. Moreover, the Valois Dynasty, while still retaining its ancient claim to the French throne, has acquired an increasingly Provençal character after being territorially reduced over the centuries to just Provence proper, and thus has become a source of agitation for our Provençal subjects. As our Monarchy is cracking at the steams due to the centripetal forces of English and French Nationalism, the Provençal have finally decided to hedge their bets and throw their lot with the Valois King. With outright revolution facing us from the mouth of the Loire to the Còsta d'Azur, we must prepare for the inevitable conflict.

Tensions have been growing for decades in the Dual-Monarchy which could hardly handle the demands of both continentals and islanders. Now, Revolters have swarmed the streets of the great cities of the Dual-Monarchy in a scale not seen since the First German Revolution! The nationalist rebels are decided to end the monarchy in blood if necessary and with it the very idea of the Anglois dream.

The Plantagenet throne has endured! Despite the threat of radicals, nationalists and foreign power, all its people stands ready to serve their country! The coming decades will surely be Anglois for who can stand against the combined force of the Dual-Monarchy of France and England?

The King has to choose an historical figure to honor in the coming months. Several proposals have emerged: Alfred the Great, the old Saxon king is admired by many across the Channel, Louis XI the Holy is seen as a benevolent figure here on the continent, Edouard IV was the first Plantagenet born in Paris and thus is seen as both a rallying figure for the Anglois but also a usurper for the French and a traitor for the English. No matter who the King chooses to honour it will not please everyone.
St-Louis is worthy of our recognition
Alfred the Great is worthy of our recognition
Edouard IV is worthy of our recognition

Liberals and Nationalists from both sides of the Channel have formed societies aimed at spreading their ideas. If we allow them, the Sons of Harold and Saint Louis will surely provoke problems in our territories but banishing them will provoke an even bigger reaction...
These organisations must be watched closely
'Histoire de la France depuis ses origines'

The historian Pierre Guizot has published a new book upon the history of France. The book has received a warm response from French scholars for its exhaustivity. But its portrayal of English and early Plantagenets is quite troublesome and his idea of 'a distinct spirit existing since the Gauls' War' only amuses the French nationalists
And he calls his book historic?

An anthology of English poetry has been published in Cambridge by the Sons of Harold. Regrouping old and new poets alike, this book has become widely applaused in England but many scholars from Paris consider it a complete waste of time...
A truly wonderful piece of art!
As I said before, English is not fit for poetry...
Henry X is becoming unfit to travel outside of Paris. He now has to delegate this duty to his son Henry, Dauphin of France and Prince of Wales
It has been a long time since a Royal went in North of England...
The Anglois heartlands are more safe

Paris is bursting with cultural creation. Theatres attract the crowds with 3 great pieces having a huge success. First the adaptation of Alfred the Great, the main work of the English author Shakespeare which combines epic and comic, in a way that pleases the Romanticists. Another troup is playing 'Le Malade Imaginaire' of Moliere, a French comic author that travelled the roads of Southern France. Eventually another adaptation of 'Joan the Mad', the tragedy of Racine is still very loved by the court. If one of the Royals would attend one of these spectacles it would surely be seen as a symbol.
I heard that Shakespeare author was quite entertaining...
A Moliere comedy will be best!
'Joan the Mad' from Racine will make us remember our glorious history.

The Rotal Academy was founded in the XVIIth century to host the greatest literary minds of the whole kingdom and it has since evolved to also codify the official language from the monarchy. One of the Immortals' siege has been liberated and we have to nominate someone. Tolsmith despite being a Saxon is recognized as one of the greatest philologists from the kingdom. In Occitania the poet Jasmin has achieved in seducing the minds of the court. But the grammarian Morel could be nominated to show our will of uniformisation
I guess Tolsmith could give us another perspective...
The Occitan poet Jasmin will remind us from the sunny Midi!
Nominate the proud Anglois grammarian Morel

Radicals in the Kingdom are preparing for the 55th anniversary of the First German Revolution. Some advisors have talked about allowing them to do so to better control them but if we do so then it will cost us our relations with the Bohemian court... Forbidding them to commemorate and organizing great ceremonies remembering the prowess of our armies during the ensuing wars would certainly be a good symbol of unity.
If it can please these liberals...
We won't associate with these monsters!
The ongoing 'Springtime of Nations' threaten our efforts of integration!
The Revolution will not anihilate our efforts!
Rebellions have stopped in the kingdom, showing our resilience!
We won't be stopped by this!
For 20 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds
For 25 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds
The little Provencal state is no more. Our armies have taken control of what was the biggest thorn on our borders. With the Valois gone, the Anglois state prevails!
The Hundred Years war is over!
The duchy of Bourgogne is now completely in our control, a fact that has weakened the French movement!

Calais has been retaken by our brave forces! We now control the closest coast from Britain and proposals of building a link between the continent be it by bridge or tunnel flourish and show our unity!
One day maybe both of our lands will be linked!
With Scotland closely placed in our Sphere of Influence, we can now control more efficiently the English movement!
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible!
With separatists having taken control of some of our core territories, the Anglois dream is fading!
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible!
Our Northern Border allows the worse English elements to find support, weapons or shelter in Scotland. Unless we take control of Scotland, directly or indirectly, the situation could worsen.
Scotland should be in our sphere to avoid further problems!
With separatists having taken control of some of our core territories, the Anglois dream is fading!
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible!
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible!

Tolon is a nest of problems for our state. The kings in-France publish propaganda serving them and give them to agents who easily cross the border. Ending the Provencal state seems the only way to stop this state of affairs.
We must put an end to the Valois problem...
For 30 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds
For 30 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds

Yesterday the Dauphin was killed by French nationalists while visiting the city of Orleans! The explosion also took the lives of his wife, his son and 70 other people. Full of grief the King has enacted several decrees restraining liberties with the assent of the Parliament. The line of succession that was clear is now disputed and the folly of Henry X due to his loss does not ease the situation...
A sad day for the dual-kingdoms...

Yesterday the Dauphin was killed by English nationalists while visiting the city of Livreport! The explosion also took the lives of his wife, his son and 63 other people. Full of grief the King has enacted several decrees restraining liberties with the assent of the Parliament. The line of succession that was clear is now disputed and the folly of Henry X due to his loss does not ease the situation...
A sad day for the dual-kingdoms...
Who will succeed on the throne?

Henri X has died yesterday in Paris at the venerable age of 76. The man who pushed for more centralization of the various demesnes of the Monarchy had reigned for nearly 30 years. He is succeeded by his only son, the Dauphin Henri of Wales who will continue the efforts of his father in uniting closer both England and France.

The Great Revolt is over: where the Plantagenets ruled, 4 new nations have arisen. The king has been executed by radicals in Paris and the members from the Royal Family who have survived, escaped to their New World haven of Plantagenia. The overseas territories have been snatched by the other Colonialist Powers and the 4 Sisters Republics of Ireland, England, France and Occitania have pledged to defend each other against the threat of the Counter-revolution. The Anglois dream of multiculturalism is dead and it seems that nationalism may threaten the old European order...

Our claims to rule over both France and England have been shaterred by $FROMCOUNTRY$ which is now the new Power to be reckoned in the British Islands. At least we still control France, and this where our new destiny lies...
The utter end of an era

A major crash on the $CAPITAL$ stock market has devolved into something much worse entirely, following massive bank runs triggered by plummeting saver's confidence in the banking sector. As people scramble to secure their life savings, more and more banks and credit institutions fail, triggering domino effects affecting the entire $COUNTRY_ADJ$ financial sector. The ripples from the crash soon spread to other sectors of private industry, as loans are defaulted and savings vanish seemingly into thin air. Widespread unemployment, caused by entire sectors of industry failing almost overnight, soon follow. With the intertwining of the economies of the western world, the crisis quickly spreads to other countries, and the effects of the crash now reverberate around the world, in what will be known to posterity as: The $YEAR$ Great Depression.

$COUNTRY$ has suffered through the Great Depression, but this year there are signs the country may be recovering at last. While the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ stock markets are still in flux, with investors terrified and banks barely able to remain solvent, conditions overall appear to be improving.

As there are no laws prohibiting or regulating private banking practices in $COUNTRY$, several private institutions are issuing their own currencies. While some argue that the hard earned savings of the common man are far too important to be left to the private sector, the case is rather the opposite in one of our states, where the plethora of banking institutions available allows people the freedom of choice to save their money in banks, and thus currencies, which they actually know and trust.
There is always the chance that these systems will fail, and then what?
As long as they are happy, I have no objections.

A newly formed railway company in one of our states has issued shares in the company to help finance the burgeoning firm, and are now seeking buyers and investors in the state. The CEO of the company has approached local politicians, asking them if they could, perhaps, lend a bit of a hand in the marketing of these shares to the general public, arguing that an extension of the railway networks in the state can only be beneficial and should be promoted. Some feel that this might infringe on the principles of official neutrality with regards to private ventures, while other see only opportunities.
Of course we must aid and help promote this beautiful private initiative
I think that the government that governs the least governs the best

Selling Greenwood & Burns at 9.76, buying at 9.5! Atman & Sons 8.12, selling, selling!'\n\nLocal businessmen in one of our provinces have formed a joint venture company to establish a local stock exchange primarily aimed at the commodities trade. The venture will doubtlessly increase local productive efforts!

A bank run has ensued in one of our states today, following news that a local bank has been issuing currency to a value far exceeding its liquid assets. The situation has been raised to the national level and parliament, where opponents of free banking use the case to argue against the system of free banking as such, calling on the government to move toward a tighter regulation of the banking sector, which is opposed by powerful interests within industrialist circles and the free trade lobby.
The institution of free banking is a fundamental pillar of free trade
We must not let the whims of profiteers dictate the national economic policy

One of the major companies in one of our states has gone bankrupt recently, following a long period of running at a deficit. Local politicians have petitioned the government to step in in support of the company, claiming that the downturn is only temporary, and that the company can get back on its feet if allowed some time to reconstruct and consolidate. While we could support the business, vocal members of parliament have lambasted the idea, calling it an absurd abridgment of the fundamental freedoms of trade and government non-interventionism.
We will not spend government money in support of a private company
Naturally we must aid the company through this tough time

$COUNTRY$ is abuzz with news of an alleged railroad trust, exposed by an anti-trust commission set up in one of our states. Local capitalists protest the allegations as absurd, claiming that no malicious coordination of prices, or price fixing has occurred. Many among the working classes are irate about the affair, feeling strongly that they are being squeezed hard by capitalist tycoons trying to make a profit out of their hardship. Breaking up the trust will set local railroad building back several years, but not doing it might anger broad strata of our population.
We must protect our workers at any cost, and this cornered market must be opened.
The freedom of trade shall not be abridged in any way.

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ markets have shown increasing strength as of late, and there are signs that industrial investments are prospering. Economists in $CAPITAL$ are predicting that $COUNTRY$ could see a boom in the years to come.
A recent string of very public failures in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ industrial sector have led to a cooling of the economy, with bullish conditions ending earlier than was previously forecast.

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economy has been sluggish as of late, with investors becoming reticent to commit to new projects. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have responded by tightening their belts, making do with less... and while austerity serves its purpose, it also has the possibility of sending us further into economic decline.
It seems there are harder times ahead.
Early signs are that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economy is doing better than forecast, and the recession is coming to a close earlier than was thought possible.

Our country's economy has been booming of late, following a long period of relatively low unemployment and a well fed populace. High savings and a productive population, combined with advances in the field of economic instruments and the establishment of investment banks, means that we now are better poised than ever before to develop our national industries, and bring our country's economy to new heights.

A bleak day today for $COUNTRY$, as $CAPITAL$'s financial district reels from the shock of a burst speculation bubble. Real estate prices have been soaring for the past year and a half, and while some analysts have warned for quite some time that the prices have been artificially high due to the effects of inflationary over consumption, the matadors of the bull market have left any such warnings unheeded. In government circles, cries for increased bank and currency regulations are being heard, calling for an end to what is referred to as 'the failures of dog-eat-dog capitalism'.
Bankers are breathing a sigh of relief as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ stock market shows signs of early recovery.

A fledgling stock and bond market has been introduced to $COUNTRY$, particularly in $CAPITAL$ where a frenzy of speculative trading has already begun. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economists are optimistic about the effect this will have on private investment, though some have expressed worry that what goes up... may also come down. For now we enjoy prosperity, but what will tomorrow bring?
What a marvellous way to make some money!
Our glorious proletarian dictatorship has done away with the corrupt fat cats in the stock market. They shall dictate to our government no more!
The fall of $COUNTRY$'s hated communist dicatorship has led to a return of investment and capital markets.
What a marvellous way to make some money!

The intensive election campaign has reached the boiling point in $STATE$, where a fierce trade policy debate pits the friends of free trade against the pals of protectionism in a rough rumble-and-tumble to determine the future of our nation's traders. Free-traders argue that goods must be allowed to freely cross all borders, while protectionists argue that our nation's fragile industries need protection from dangerous foreign competition threatening to undo them. Which path will $COUNTRY$ tread, as it decides on: Free trade, or Protectionism? We report, you decide.
Our trade must be protected from destructive foreign competition
Some protective measures are in order to safe-guard our industry
Let the debate take its own course, and let the chips fall where they may!
It is imperative that our merchants be allowed to travel freely
Freedom and liberty of trade shall not perish from this Earth!

The election debates in $STATE$ have been going on for a few days now, and the issue that seems to be becoming the determining one for the outcome of the election is, perhaps unsurprisingly, the economy. Several theories are being advanced, but the voters want a clear statement on government policy. How will the government make sure that every $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen has a chicken in his pot, during the coming term in office?

The morality and virtue of our people has started to decline!' The statement caused much stir among the debaters of toleration and religious plurality, on the campaign trail in $STATE$. Many have begun questioning the country's view on religion, and there is no doubt that these issues will play their part in the coming election.
Religion is not a political issue!
Let the people have their faith.
There is one faith and one faith only!

Two debaters are arguing heatedly in the qualmy air of the town hall The audience sits dumbfounded as words like 'aliens', 'minorities', and 'ethnic and cultural groups' are thrown between the two. One argues that immigrants are to adopt the dominant culture of their new homeland, while his opponent believes that immigrants should retain their cultural heritage, and that $COUNTRY$ will be strengthened by the influx of a fresh perspective..
We need to limit their citizenship.
War Policy Debated in Local Election

Opponents and proponents of the military and the armed forces are taking sides for the coming election. While militarists argue that increased tension in the world, and arms races between several of the Great Powers, are reason enough to maintain a strong $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military. Others are less convinced, and see the military expenses as excesses on part of the government.
We are patriots and we are going to fight for our country!
We need to maintain constant vigilance in foreign affairs
War between countries is never good.
War is a fundamental evil that must be avoided

Smuggling has become a problem since $STATE$ raised a local Sales & Transfer tariff on several important trade goods, and the issue has become a point of contention in the coming election. Several arguments are being put forth on the issue.
Lower the tariffs on those goods and raise it on some others.
Leave the tariffs as they were.
Lower the tariffs just a bit.
We need to lower the tariffs altogether.

New foreign, products have begun to out compete several items of $STATE$ produce, and some citizens report increasing difficulties in competing with imported goods on the market. The issue has been raised by local politicians in debates for the upcoming election.
Free trade ensures our long term competitive edge
Essentially, free trade is to be preferred
Free trade is our best guarantor of prosperity
Local markets should, in some instances, be protected
Local markets must always be shielded from foreign competition

Merchants from $STATE$ are arguing with the minister of finance, who has entertained plans of a nationalization of certain private industries. The heated discussion have reach your ears and you try to cool both sides down.
I see no reason to monopolize it.
You both have great arguments, but we will not monopolize that.
Let do and let pass, the world goes on by itself. No monopoly.
Great idea, but let me take a look at this first.
That is a great idea. We will do that.

The production quota is too high. We will never be able to reach the demand.' The other farmers stand behind him, waiting. Their weathered faces show the same concern and determination as their speaker.
Nonsense. The production quota will remain the same.
You have nothing to worry about.
We will deal with it if the production quota becomes a problem.

A debate has flared up in the local $STATE$ election about whether the state should interfere or not in the local economy. Proponents of State capitalism are arguing that a more direct system of government investment and reinvestment could aid in the long term development of local industry.
It takes some time, but it will work.
We might want to rethink this.
We must oppose government intervention in the economy

Local $STATE$ administration has come under criticism for several instances of government subsidies directed at supporting local industry.  Opponents argue that 'the country's economic planners cannot detect consumer preferences, shortages, and surpluses with sufficient accuracy and therefore cannot efficiently co-ordinate production', and creeping statism has begun to worry the residents of $STATE$.
The economic planners knows what they are doing.
We will have a look at it.
It's probably nothing, but we'll have a look at it.

Some of the Faithful in $STATE$ feel that the state has failed in giving them due recognition for their hard work since the last election. For years, they argue, they have assisted the local community in many ways: caring for the sick, taking care of the orphans and helping the needy. They feel that they deserve some form of support so they can continue to help people, and the issue has become a topic of much discussion in the local election campaign.
Maybe we could do something to help.
Religious policy debated in local election

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ religious policy has become a subject of much debate in the local $STATE$ elections. Many argue that the state needs to maintain a watchful policy of secularization, but this threatens to upset long established religious privileges, and is opposed by many of the local faithful.
Secularization ensures state neutrality in issues of morality
Some measure of secularization is essential
Faith must be represented in politics.

Religion has become an issue in the upcoming electoral debates, as a local religious leader in $STATE$ protests the freedom of religious conversions, arguing that the size of his flock is diminishing, and that this change is fundamentally harmful to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ moral fabric.
Try to keep an open mind.
While objectionable, we can not consider more than limited accommodation
We will do what we can, this won't be tolerated.

The renovation of a local church, using public money, has become a hot topic in the local election of $STATE$. Supporters of the project argue that some government support for religion will help preserve not only faith among the people, and thus a local vanguard against the forces of revolution, while opponents argue that the state must not intervene in matters of private religiosity.
Of course the church must be renovated!
Some funds could be considered on grounds of cultural importance
This issue must fundamentally be left to popular sovereignty
We must oppose such plans on grounds of principle.

The current inflow of immigrants has created a demand for more jobs. Advocates of immigrant rights demand that newly naturalized citizens be accorded the same rights as residents by birth. The situation has become a topic of debate in the local election.
They have no right to demand anything.
Why should they have the same rights?.
We'll see what we can do.
Won't be easy, but we'll do everything we can.
Residential Policies debated in local elections

Certain residents of $STATE$ feel that the state discriminates against them on account of their origin, and this has become a bone of some contention in the local election, as liberals argue that immigrants and aliens should have their rights respected. Opponents and, indeed, public opinion, seems to be of the mind that $COUNTRY_ADJ$ is not something that one can simply become overnight, and that the process of naturalization takes years, if not generations.
Limited citizenship until a proven and loyal subject
Limited citizenship, but with certain exceptions
Limited citizenship should be the guiding principle
You see, I have this dream of mine...

Immigration has become a major issue in the local $STATE$ elections, as liberals argue the need to extend the voting franchise to all members of our society, including immigrants. Others, perhaps afraid to see old privileges dislodged, are not as convinced. As the election draws nearer, the debate rages in $STATE$.
We must constantly strive to extend freedom!
Full citizenship, with only minor qualifications, is the way forward
Full citizenship is, sadly, not an option

The debate in $STATE$ in the preludes to the coming election mostly concerns the military and defense policies of $COUNTRY$. The state has long been a bastion of hawkish sentiments with regards to foreign policy, and this year does not seem to be an exception. It is clear that jingoistic policies will be favored in voter turnouts, but a turn in the debate could perhaps reduce the impact.
We do need a strong military.
There is no need for increased defense spending
We were actually thinking about cutbacks...
Mama says a pistol is the Devil's right hand.
Military & Defense Debate in Local Election

Your generals have begun to complain about the bad food the soldiers are getting and command that more money should be spent on feeding them. The generals argue that the poor diet reduces soldiers' fighting spirit and want to raise it through better food. These issues have become topics of importance to the many military families in $STATE$.
They need better food in order to fight well.
We will see how much we can spend on their food.
This is not something we should prioritize.
Maybe we should cut back on other things, such as soldiers...

A major report that most of the soldiers' weapons are nearly worn out and want someone to go over them to see if they need to be scrapped. To provide soldiers with new weapons would cost more than the current budget for the military can cope with.
We could perhaps do something about that.
We need to upgrade their weapons.
All They're Saying is 'Give Peace a Chance!'

Pacifist sentiments have been floating about $STATE$ for some time, but in this coming election it seems that whoever can capitalize on the pacifist sentiments in the area will come out a clear winner come election day. The only question still in the air is to which extent pacifist sympathies will hold up through the pre-election debates.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
The military needs guns, not idle gossip
Perhaps violence is the answer after all.
In the Emperors name! We have to crush this rebellious scum!
In the Emperors name! We have to crush these muslim upstarts!
In the Emperors name! We have to crush these unruly rebels!
The Ethiopians have laid eyes on our land! They claim it is the the ancient Kingdom of Nubia and belongs under Coptic rule. We must defend ourselves!
The Fall of the Adal Sultanate
With our homelands lost the Garen dynasty feels emboldened to reaffirm control over their Sultanate.
Maybe it is time for us to go...

The Scottish nationalist leaders have been banned from Edinburgh and have found shelter in our glorious republic. Walter Scott Jr, the leader of the Young Scotland movement has asked the Parliament to give him weapons and officers to train inusrgents against the Nordic invaders. The Conservatives saw this as a waste of time and money but a Revolution on our Border could benefit us...
Scotland is only a source of problems for England...
Walter Scott and his fellow men have come back to Scotland and started an open insurrection!
The Scottish Republic has been proclaimed but they are under the threat of Scandinavia.
Scotland will be free from the Northmen!
Scotland has risen to break the chains of oppression and it is our duty to help them!
We will join the fight for Freedom!
We have other matters to attend...
Our armies are ready to march on Scotland and fight the revolutionaries. But will Scandinavia call to its allies?
The Stuarts will reconquer their throne with the help of their allies!

Our focus on France has not only alienated the English but also the Irish. The Gaels while subdued and integrated since the XVIth century have called for autonomy, and some outright independence since the German Wars. Our inability to crush the English rebels has fueled the Irish nationalists agenda. Prominent leaders have apparently met in Dublin to create a secret society called the Irish Brotherhood whose aim is to secure the independence of the Emerald island. We should watch them carefully since they have already try to contact our rivals in Europe to secure their help and weapons...

Our focus on France has not only alienated the English but also the Irish. The Gaels while subdued and integrated since the XVIth century have called for autonomy, and some outright independence since the German Wars. A new political organisation has been created in Dublin, the Irish Confederation whose goal is to obtain Home-Rule from Paris, a position which has gained traction from the general population for the past few-years.

The Successes of the Irish Confederation has led to a near monopoly of the party over all Irish elections for the past few years. The Irish problem, as it has been called by many, can not be stopped peacefully. Either we accept the creation of the Dominion but then lose direct control over the Ireland or we refuse and risk the Confédérés to advocate violent actions to overthrow our government...
Home-rule is the solution to Irish demands.
Ireland has been a part of the realm for hundreds of years and will stay so.

The members from the Irish Republican Brotherhood have contacted our government to try and secure our help against the Anglois government. They say that the time is ripe for an insurrection and that we just need to provide them with weapons and ammunition to help in their fight, helping in weakening our rival in Paris. However if our involvement was revealed and the Rising unsuccessful it would give a casus belli to the Anglois...
Smuggle weapons and money to the insurgents!
We can't commit to such a thing...

The Irish Brotherhood has launched a general uprising in Ireland, equipped with $FROM_ADJ$ weapons and ammunition. Their control over the island is quite complete and the Irish flag is now hoisted from Cork to Belfast.
We have regrouped and are now ready to try and take back the Emerald Island!
The Irish will be taught the true power of the Dual-Monarchy!
Let the Gaels on their own...

Yesterday our police forces have captured a foreign ship hailing our flag while being $FROM_ADJ$ full of ammunition and weapons destined to the Irish Brotherhood who planned to launch an uprising for quite some years. This insult can not be tolerated and a war could be declared in a few hours...
They want war, they'll get it!
They aren't worth such a thing!
Following the seizure of our ship helping the Irish Insurgents, $FROM$ declared war on us!
It wasn't supposed to end like this!

With the success of the English Revolution in the south the ideas of independence have spread in Scotland. The most important of the nationalist group, called 'Young Scotland' is led by the son of the famous Scottish writer Walter Scott. Walter Scott Jr has used the legacy of his father to improve his standing amongst the crowds and he is clearly an important agitator. We could ban him and his closest followers or let him act, with the risk of open Scottish rebellion...
Banish Scott and his supporters, we don't need such agitators.
Well let them agitate, it's not like an independent Scotland is possible.

Etruria is the last remaining republic born during the German Revolution. The revolutionaries expelled the Valois-Medici and created sister republics all throughout the peninsula but were forced to negotiate peace and leave the Reaction take over the new Republics. Italy is now as divided as before the Revolution and Etruria is no longer perceived as the hegemon of Italy.
