The Council is unable to reach a majority decision

The Greek representatives have decided to give the power to the current leader Konstantinos Zimisces, who will be crowned king of the Hellenes. An assembly will be called, and political liberties are guaranteed, but the king retains much of the power.
Long Live Konstantinos Zimisces, king of the Hellens!

The Greek representatives have chosen to unite with Macedonia. But it will be at the coast of many political reforms asked by the liberals. Moreover Zimisces seems to be ready to launch a coup to claim power. What will happen?
We will call the king of Macedonia to be crowned!
Zimisces seizes the power for himself

The Supporters of the Macedonian king have succeeded during the council of Athens. But they are saying that in exchange of the crown, the monarch will have to rescind its power and give a democratic assembly to the people and stop the multicultural policy started in Macedonia. That's the cost for allying the liberals to the idea. But we could enter Greece by force and take Athens to force them to bow to our conditions.
We will not accept the crown of the gutter! We will have Greece by conquest!
We are a Greek state now!

The king of Macedonia has refused the reforms of the liberals and is determined to take Greece under its conditions. To face him, the assembly has elected Zimisces king of the Greeks and hope that he can force him out.
We will crush the Macedonians! All hail Zimisces!
Zimisces has seized the power despite the choice of our king in the council. We must march on Athens and take what is ours from this upstart general!
We will take what is ours!
We have taken the city of Athens and captured Zimisces. He has been promptly executed and the Greek government has proclaimed the end of the war!

Since the union of Greece and Macedonia, Zimisces has been plotting against the new monarch hoping to seize power in its place. Large tracts of Greece have risen in favor of Zimisces. We must crush him!
Macedonia is utterly vainquished and the king has already fled to Aragon. Long live Zimisces!
The Council of Delphi has led to the establishment of a new Hellen Democracy. Let us hope that the Republic will bring us to glory!
Long Live the new Hellen Republic!
Zimisces has been plotting since the establishment of the Republic to gain power. Today he has entered Athens and asked the military to help him end the political squabbles.
Zimisces plot fails and the Republic lives on!
Zimisces succeeds in his plot and he is proclaimed king of Hellas
Council of Delphi: Zimisces Coup d'Etat
Seeing that no majority emerged from the Council, Zimisces took action and seized power. He must now face both the anger of the Macedonians and the democrats!
Long Live Konstantinos Zimisces, king of the Hellens!

Greece has been beaten by Venice who now occupies once again the cradle of Western Civilization. We have an opportunity to proclaim Macedonia the true heir of Alexander by supporting the Greek Cause and thus gaining the support of the oppressed populations of Hellas...
Venice is powerful and Greece is not our primary interest.
The traitorous Macedonians have launched a campaign to end our state!
The time of Philip and Alexander is over!

Our intervention in Greece some years allowed us to secure mainland Greece, greatly enhancing our position among the Mediterranean powers. The Turkish Civil War is not yet over and the islands of the Aegean seem ripe for the conquest. The delicescent state of the Sultanate allows us such actions without actions from other powers and we have the support of some local Greek nationalist cells to help us. The most daring of our strateges have suggested that we could try to seize the port of Izmir which is populated by many Greek but such an action would certainly mean an Ottoman reaction
Our Greek holdings are enough to manage

The Republic of Venice has decided to complete what they began years ago by seizing the islands of the Aegean we still controlled. It is now a 'fait accompli' and trying to reclaim them would bring on us the wrath of their allies...
We have enough problems as it stands, leave them be!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to attack us after our takeover.

The Republic of Venice, fostered by our current state has taken over the Aegean islands and even the port of Izmir! We can't let those pesky merchants have a march in the heart of Anatolia but we must be ready to face them and their allies...
We have enough problems as it stands, leave them be!
Our hold on Izmir has allowed the local Greek movement to rise and the city is now seen as an integral part of a possible Greek state.
Smyrna, Izmir, it's all the same for me!
The opening of the Biennale of Venice

Following the great Restoration of the city of Venice it was decided that an international art exposition would be organized in the newly built Giardini. The exposition was such a success and attracted artists from all over the world that it was decided that it should be renewed every two years.
The Most Serene Republic of Venice

The Republic of Venice has endured as an oligarchic institution since its beginnings and the government is now incredibly complicated to form with many offices separated to avoid concentration of power. As a result there has not been tyranny in the Republic but it is also a static institution that has a hard time evolving with the current times. The Doges for example are now only an honorific post with little power, despite being the Head of State from their election to their death. An election requires a lot of draws to designate the candidates and the votes needed a significant majority to work. This prestige position is currently held by the former admiral Silvestro Dandolo.

Silvestro Dandolo died yesterday in the Palace of the Doges at the honorable age of 81. He was a major actor in the Venetian intervention in Greece, even going to Athens after the truce to ciment Venetian hold on Greece. He was less active during the recent years because of his old age but he managed to make acceptable some reforms of the Doge's election.
Election of the 122th Doge of Venice

The election of the Doge has seen the internecine conflict about the Greek Question erupt in open day, with three men being plausible candidates. Daniele Manin, not related to the 120th Doge, is a Nationalist jurist advocating for a re-focusing of La Serenissima's energies towards the Italian Peninsula. Opposing him is Antonio Salviati, a reformist candidate known for his taste in art and literature, and also a known philhellen in favour of building closer ties between the Stato da Màr and Stato da Terra. Outside those two polarized figures is Giovanni Battista Giuseppe Albrizzi, son of the poetess Isabella Albrizzi, an enterpreneur known for his interest in industry and in maintaining the status quo. The election will be seen as a sign toward the crowds of the Republic, one way or the other.
Antonio Salviati is the new Doge
Giovanni Battista Giuseppe Albrizzi seems the best choice.
Daniele Manin, the 122th Doge of Venice has died yesterday in his office. A known Nationalist, Manin was known as the Doge of the people, often hailed for his support of reform of the Republic.

Antonio Salviati, the 122th Doge of Venice has died yesterday in the Giardini where an art exposition was held. A known sponsor of the arts, he funded several artists throughout his office, not taking part in politics, and often acting as an eccentric character.

Giovanni Albrizzi, the 122th Doge of Venice has died yesterday in the Palace of the Doges.  A close friend of the Venetian oligarchy and a known captain of industry he was not particularly not loved by the lower classes but his death marks the end of a new era for the Republic with the first open Doge election of the Republic.
The election of the 123th Doge of Venice

This election is historic because of the reforms underwent in the previous years. The Doge will be elected by the whole electorate after the process of selection has been made. Three candidates have arisen. The Conservatives support Pietro Bertolini, an important official in the Stato da Mar and colonial governor. The Liberals have supported Alessandro Guicciolli, a reknown diplomat who has gone through the various capitals of Europe to represent the Republic. Meanwhile the Socialists support the eccentric Filipo Grimani, a devout Christian supporting the Socialists in their efforts of establishing a juster society. Let the people cast their vote!
Filipo Bertolini is the new Doge
Pietro Grimani seems the best choice.
The Abolishment of the Doge office
The changes in our government have made this office moot and void and we ahve thus decided to end it.
Gone is this relic of the past!
The 1500th Anniversary of the founding of Venice

The 25th March is the traditional date of the founding of our city. Fleeing Gothic and Huns invaders, Roman citizens poured in the laguna, hoping to find a shelter against the invaders. Now the City still stands independent a millenia and a half after its foundation, a true proof of Venetian prowess and spirit!
Our Republic is truly the Most Serene of all!

With Constantinople once again the capital of the Hellen state, the Patriarchate of Constantinople has regained its power with the Patriarch of Greece being nominated as the new Ecumenical Patriarch. The magnificent Hagia Sophia has been reconsecrated as an Orthodox Church and will now host again the most important religious ceremonies.

Conflicting Greek and Turkish nationalism have provoked hatred among the common people of Thrace. With the Enosis complete the Orthodox citizens backlashed against their Turkish neighbours, forcing them to leave their homes in violent pogroms. Many Turkish died and the state let it do, even encouraging Greeks from the rest of the country to come here.

Following Greek independence from Venice the Orthodox Church, which had played a great role in the independence process began a great revival movement, often at the expanse of the state which didn't look at it in a good way. Wandering monks taught common people to read the Bible, seminaries were opened to instruct priests in the ways of the faith and new synods were held. Overall it helped improve literacy but the Church became more powerful, often opposing the new Enlightenment ideas that Venice had helped spread in the country.
The Holy Church should not intervene in those matters!

Because of Greek dominance over the Balkans and its supports in the government we have agreed to sign a treaty that recognizes Greek claims over East Macedonia. In exchange, much of the Bulgarian people living in Greece will be sent to our country while we will send the Greeks in our country to Greece.
It is our time to respect the Treaty by 'helping' Bulgarian in our country to find their way home

The black smoke pouring out from the pit, in long, drawn out billows, reeks of coal and fire, and the intensity of the smell almost drowns out an undertone of burnt flesh. A hurried commotion breaks out as the survivors of a The Great Explosion of $YEAR$ scurry to save what is left of the coal mine. The seams in the coalfield lie, sleeping for centuries, embedded in pockets of methane. A carelessly lit lantern, a spark from a pick striking rock, and a sea of hellfire.

The general findings of our commission are, therefore, these: Working conditions in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ coal fields fail to reach even the basest modicums of decency with regards to safety. The mines rely heavily on child labour for several of the more dangerous and filthy jobs -- the youngest employee being a boy a mere nine years of age -- lighting is poor and ventilation scant, in an environment that is pitch black with coal dust. Furthermore...'\n\nThe Mines & Fields Commission of $YEAR$ has submitted its final report on working conditions in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ coal fields, and the verdict is harsh.
Oppose reform on grounds of principle.

The coal laden tub must have weighed heavily on her body, fragile and worn from many years of ardous labour in the coal pits, for her feet could no longer carry her. There, in the dark, where the shafts go countless fathoms deep, she slipped and fell.'\n\nAnother young girl has lost her life in a coal mining accident in one of our provinces, and the particular tragedy of the case has recieved national attention.

One of our munitions factories has experienced a severe shortfall in production over the past three months, which has gone unreported for fear of causing alarm among investors and local industrial magnates. By covering the factory's losses with materials from the national stockpile, we could be perceived as saving local jobs.

Locals in one of our provinces are complaining about certain emissions coming from the local fertilizer factory. While the place might smell like roses to the provincial budget, the balance certainly hasn't been adding up for local noses lately. We could support an ordinance to modifiy the work process, but doing so might anger local captains of industry.
Crops do not grow themselves, sadly.
We should consider some local restrictions.

The central Tea Weighing Station in one of our tea-producing provinces has been held up by armed thugs. Some locals speculate that harsh times in the province might have provoked local farmers, tired of seeing local distributors and retailers eating away at their profits, to rob the station. Whatever the cause may be, we need to address the situation.

While the war rages, every can that rolls off the production line from '$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Canned Food & Preservatives Ltd.' is as important as a cannonball or a rifle. The food is reportedly excellent, and very popular among our soldiers. So popular, in fact, that the General Staff has commissioned another massive order from the factory.

The Quartermaster General reports the discovery of a forgotten cache of canned foodstuffs in an army stockpile. The content of the cans is still, despite being several years old, apparently quite edible. What should we do with the 15 tonnes of canned food?
Distribute the food among the poor
The government will cover all losses
Sadly, there is little to be done

The cocoons shrivel and die, and what little thread there is on them fails to coagulate properly, and unravels at the slightest breeze. Something is awry in the silk fields, and even our best chemists have not been able to find a cure for the disease that plagues our farms. Local silk farmers are outraged, and call upon the government to act.
There is nothing we can do.

A chemist of no small renown has invented a cure for the disease that has been plaguing our silk farms in $PROVINCENAME$, and, even better, with government support the cure could be exported to all our provinces, should more of them be affected by this nasty illness.

The cotton produced in one of our farming provinces is of the highest possible quality and strength. So strong, in fact, is the cotton, that the white balls harvested there have begun building quite a reputation for themselves as being some of the best available in the world. The reputation has built for quite some time, and local farmers have begun taking pride in the fact that, in the world of cotton, $COUNTRY$ is a byword for quality.

Not by speeches and votes of the majority, are the great questions of the time decided, but by iron and blood.'
-Otto von Bismarck

A new, rich lode of iron ore has been discovered in the one of our mines. While the ore is rich, it is also located on a perilous depth that is just beyond the reach of our present mining technology. We could attempt to extract the ore, but doing so will carry with it a cost in lives and blood.

The wool district in one of our provinces has become a hub of activity lately, as more and more little cottage weaveries are springing up across the province. While the locals have always been known as a thrifty kind, the ready access to some of the world's best wool might also explain this flurry of activity.

The wharfs, quays, and drydocks in one of our coastal provinces are abuzz with the rings of hammers and the songs of saws, as the local factory struggles to keep up with new orders for clipper ships that are pouring in from all over the world. Efficient work processes and managment, combined with excellent craftsmanship and seamanship, have led them to produce more and better ships than during any year previous! Perhaps this is the time to rest on the laurels, but, then again, the future is always an uncertainty.

Tragedy struck one of our provinces today, when a steam boiler exploded during a routine test in the machine shop contracted to build it for the local steamer factory. Seven workers were killed in the explosion, and several thousands of pounds worth of equipment were destroyed. Local officials are investigating the working conditions in the shop, and hopefully these accidents can be avoided in the future, but, for now, $COUNTRY$ mourns her dead.
Work overtime to replace the boilers

One of our provinces has been making quite a name for itself in the cement industry over the past few years. What started out as smalltime production in a familiy business has now grown to an industry big enough to support the entire region, and the name 'Standard $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Cement' is becoming a household name. Cement recipes from the province are being admired and imitated across the world!

Several workers were killed today at one of our provincial dyeworks, when an industrial sized tub of hot dye accidentaly spilled out over the workshop floor, and the unsuspecting workers. Locals are upset about the incident, claiming that the poor safety regulations in the hot and dangerous workplace are to blame for the accident, and are urging the government to take action. As rescue workers left the scene, several workshop employees were left in anguish.
They shall not have dyed in vain!
We shall all dye sooner or later.

A fuel cistern at one of our refineries exploded today for reasons yet unknown, and the lives of seven workers were claimed in the ensuing conflagration, along with thousands of dollars worth in company property. The refinery owner has washed his hands of any responsibility for the accident, claiming instead that government safety inspections have been lacking.
Naturally the government will seek to aid

One of our refineries has been doing rather well lately, with production exceeding expected quotas by several thousand gallons. Due to storage problems, the refinery owner has approached the government with a deal to buy the fuel at a steep discount. We could either buy the fuel ourselves, or turn him down and wait for him to float the cheap fuel on the market. The local impact of cheap fuel should make the locals fairly happy, but we could probably use the fuel ourselves.

Another tragic day for our labourers today, as an accident was reported as having claimed several lives in one of our iron mines. Several workers have been reported injured, and some are still missing. A faulty support beam in the mine collapsed to cause the accident, reports from provincial inspectors say. The incident is bound to raise at least a local debate on working conditions in our mines.
The interests of industry will prevail
Our workers must be kept safe and sound
The Old Man and The Sea

A fisherman off the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ coast has brought in an enormous catch today. His trawler is practically teeming with the riches of the richest of oceans as he anchors in the harbor, and fairly soon other fishermen are able to repeat his example. The fishing is unusually good this year, it seems.

The tea harvest is unusually large this year, and nowhere is it larger than in one of our farming provinces. Everywhere one ventures in the area, sacks and sacks again stand lined up, brimming with freshly picked leaves of wonderfully smelling tea. This harvest will probably set us straight for years if we're capable of leveraging it right. Should we let the farmers keep an extra portion of the harvest, let our merchants sell it for profit, or should we stockpile it for later use?

A local radiostation in one of our provinces is facing a shortage of radio components for their transmitters, and have been forced to cease brodcasts until the situation is resolved. Local authorities have suggested lending some of the government's radio components to the station, as it fears that the local populace will be alarmed by a lack of news from the front.

More and more social, religious and educational institutions in $COUNTRY$, primarily from the educated middle classes, are coming to see the influence of alchohol on our society as a moral and social wrong. Pointing at the effects and costs in terms of broken homes, windows and spirits, they urge temperance, with some even going so far as to support calls for outright prohibition. Brewery owners in one of our provinces are concerned by the development, and wish to see their future privilige to sell and manufacture alchohol guaranteed.
Sadly we cannot make any guarantees.

A fire at an explosives warehouse has caused a massive blast that some say could be heard all the way to $CAPITAL$. The devestation is massive, and hundreds of lives in the vicinity are reported lost. As the fire spreads through the city, the fire department needs to prioritize: The fire threatens to spread to affluent neighborhoods, as well as to poorer areas. Where to send our assistance?
We make no distinctions of class.

Mayhaps this chair, madame? Made from the finest Brazilian Mahogany, inlaid with delicate Nubian patterns of Kenyan ivory. Observe the rich marbling on the leather. You won't find another one like it in all of $COUNTRY$!'\n\nRising standards of living in one of our provinces have caused an upswing in the demand for better and more elegant furniture. As people's homes are beautified, it only makes sense that the offices of government are, likewise, upgraded to better conform to modern standards.
No wasteful fiscal policies on my watch

Disaster has struck one of our luxury clothes factories, where several shipments have been cancelled over the past few weeks. The reason for the cancellations seems to be that the clothes, quite simply, aren't selling all that well, and no wonder, the cut is wrong, and the buttons look almost clownishly large. Strange, they seemed so nice last season.
We can still wear them, though...
Insist that government officials wear them
The designer's head on a plate!

Water has seeped into one of our factory warehouses, damaging several shipping crates' worth of clothing. The clothing has been infected by a pungent smelling mold of some kind, and while it doesn't look so bad, the fiber in the cloth reeks of cellar and stale water. We might be able to salvage the clothes, but there is some doubt as to whether anyone would want to use them.
Give them to the poor and replace them
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
Our resources would be better used for other purposes.
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
The World's Fair for this decade is being organized. Shall we make a bid to host?
We have been selected to host the World's Fair!
We were not selected to host the World's Fair. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ event organizers are outraged.
Oh well. We shall attend, anyway.
Send our apologies, but don't bother with a delegation.
We must prepare for the coming World's Fair.
It must be magnificent! No expenses to be spared
Be prudent, but provide a true spectacle
Do it on a shoestring, no-one need know.
One of the organisers of the World's Fair has been somewhat creative in the accounting...
Construction Halted at The World's Fair!
Unavoidable material shortages have held up construction at the World's Fair.
The venue is complete, and the World's Fair may begin!
Our Delegation has gone to the World's Fair in $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ delegation was outshone by other nations at the World's Fair!
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ delegation made a respectable showing at the World's Fair.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ delegation stood above all others at the World's Fair!
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ delegation did well, but we were outshone at our own fair by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ delegation.
Months after the dust has settled, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ World's Fair is considered to have been a resounding success.
Everyone involved should give themselves a pat on the back!
Months after the dust has settled, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ World's Fair is considered to have been forgettable but by no means a disaster.
We'll have to do better next time.
Months after the dust has settled the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ World's Fair is considered to have been terrible. A blight on our reputation.
Shall we host a Regional Trade Fair?

A delegation representing the leading commercial and manufacturing interests in our nation have proposed holding a Regional Trade Fair in our capital. Holding such an event would provide an excellent opportunity to showcase our economic capabilities and technological expertise to our neighbors, could significantly help our exports by popularizing our goods, and promote good will with our neighbors. Should we provide support for this idea?
The Regional Trade Fair Is Opened

Our neighbors have come to our capital to celebrate this Trade Fair, with national pavilions from other nations and several different buildings and marvels highlighting our economic and cultural prowess to the visitors.
A great spectacle for our region to enjoy!
Shall we host a Colonial Exposition?

A delegation representing the leading commercial and manufacturing interests in our empire have proposed holding a Colonial Exposition in our capital. Holding such an event would provide an excellent opportunity to showcase the economic and cultural wealth of our colonies, could significantly help our exports by popularizing the goods produced in our empire, and further strengthen the support for our empire among our citizens at home. Should we provide support for this idea?

Our empire and the world has come to our capital to celebrate this colonial exposition, with pavilions from our various colonies and several different buildings and marvels highlighting the importance of our economic and cultural mission to the visitors, from both home and abroad.
A grand display of the power and wealth of our empire!

The administration of the Pacific Islands has become incredibly difficult. We have been approached by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government regarding the possibility of selling any of our remaining holdings in the Caroline and Mariana Islands. The amount offered is not much, but then again the islands are not worth much - indeed, they cost us far more than they provide. There is the additional notion that, should we disagree, $FROMCOUNTRY$ might attempt to take them by force.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has agreed to the treaty. Any of their remaining holdings in the Carolinas and Marianas are ours.
Infuriatingly, the Spanish have responded by saying they will not surrender their remaining Pacific holdings to us.
Then we must consider the use of force.

Our failure to end the Nanjing Regency has not gone unnoticed. Dutch and more largely Burgundian traders have tried for years to establish a foothold in China to develop their trade, even fighting with the Spanish for their enclave of Macao. One of the first acts of the Zheng Kings of Tungning had been to expel the Dutch from Taiwan which they dubbed 'Formosa'. Now the V.O.C. from its base of Batavia has secured the island of Hong-Kong on the peninsula of Kowloon. We could use our remaining forces to expel them but we would then face the wrath of the Burgundian Kingdom.....
We will not give an inch of our territory to the V.O.C!

Dutch traders have tried for decades to get a foothold in China to trade like the Spanish enclave of Macao. Sensing an opportunity following the failure of the Ming pretender to retake Nanjing the V.O.C sent ships to secure the island of Hong-Kong in the Pearl Delta, intending to use it to bolster its influence in the East after the loss of their Japanese trading posts. But despite what they thought the Army and Navy of the State of Tungning have responded and expelled the Burgundians from the island. The Anvers government must now intervene by either condemning the V.O.C intentions or by siding with its traders and declare war on the Ming.
Hong-Kong will make a fine outpost in China.
The V.O.C has gone too far!

Following the meddling of Dutch traders in China, the V.O.C and the Kingdom of Burgundy have acquired a port in the Pearl Delta with the island of Hong Kong. With this outpost in the South of China, the Burgundians will challenge more effectively the Spanish enclave of Macao. Already a colonial governor has been nominated to take care of the Crown Colony of Port-Anne whcih will surely become the Jewel of South China!
We didn't seek it but it's welcome anyway!

Interest in China has spiked following the seizure of Hong-Kong by Burgundy and the Scandinavian traders have found a perfect site to establish our own Treaty Port. Kwangchowan - meaning 'Guangzhou Bay' - is situated in Guangdong Province on the east side of the Leizhou Peninsula, north of Hainan. The bay of Kwangchowan and the villages and cities in it could provide a good source of income. Right now the cities are commercially unimportant but strategically located and our government could always use another base in the Far East. We have proposed to the Taiping to pay for the use of the bay but should they refuse we could always seize it by force!
We can afford the cost of this enterprise.
Scandinavia does not need this port.

Since the capture of Hong-Kong by the Burgundians the European courts have become more interested in China, seeking concessions after concessions. We have received an offer from the Scandinavians who want to lease the port of Kwangchowan in the south. While the area and the port are not really useful at the moment it would still be seen as a blow to our power to cede it to the Scandinavians, but can we really afford a war with the Europeans?
Better to gain a bit of money from it...
Chinese soil is not up for sale!

Following negotiations between the Scandinavian and Taiping government the area of Kwangchowan has been leased to Scandinavia for a century, with exclusive economic rights in the Taiping prefectures adjoining the bay. The port strategically located between Indochina and the Pearl Delta may rise one day to rival Macao and Hong Kong for the trade in the area, at least that is the ambition of the Scandinavian authorities. Time will tell but at least the Northern Cross has been hailed in Alexandershavn.

Negotiations between the Scandinavian diplomats and the Taiping courts have not succeeded, the Chinese state refusing to lease the port of Kwangchowan. It is a blow for the Scandinavian government which is likely to try and take the port nevertheless to not lose face in Europe.
The Scandinavian military will end this problem.
It is not worth the trouble.

The capture of Hong Kong by our Burgundian rivals has ignited an interest for the Chinese area in the higher spheres of the government. A naval base in China could be used to counter the growing Japanese influence as an example and the constant state of war between the various pretenders could also be used to our advantage.
We don't need such a thing.

European interests in China have peaked since the capture of Hong Kong, with daring European traders trying to get rights and privileges in our ports. The government of Paris has thus asked to lease us the port of Shanghai located near the estuary of the Yangzi, to develop trade in the area and the city itself.
Lease it, we can't afford a conflict with them.

The city of Shanghai is strategically located near the estuary of the Yangzi River, and its favorable port has hosted trade ships for centuries. Now $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has accepted to cede the port as a concession to $THISCOUNTRY$, which has also obtained special rights and privileges in trading in the area. This new European concession is not viewed favorably by the Empire of Japan nor by the powers that hold the ports of the Pearls Delta but the might of $THISCOUNTRY$ has forbidden them to make any comment.
Shanghai will become the Pearl of the Orient!

The negotiations over the acquisition of the city of Shanghai by $THISCOUNTRY$ have ended with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government refusing the Protocol elaborated by Anglois officials. The arsenals and the armies are being prepared in Jiangsu but can they resist the power of one of the Great Powers of the World?
Let us sail to China then!
We can't afford a war at this moment.

We have received word that the Anglois government wants to acquire a port in China like Burgundy did with Hong Kong. From the intelligence we gathered they seem to be interested in the port of Shanghai in Jiangsu, a trade city that lie near the estuary of the Yangzi river. Many officials in our government and our Navy talk about the danger it could pose to our Empire and to our trade interests on the Chinese coast. We could guarantee the independence of the Jiangsu government against Anglois officials or we could propose an arrangement with the Anglois where we split the sovereignty on the ports of Shanghai and Jiaxing. But the Anglois Navy is a force to be reckoned with and it could be wiser to let them do as they please...
We will protect the owners of Shanghai!
I'm sure we can agree to share ports together.
It is better to let them do what they want there.

The Japanese goverment has informed us that they protect the sovereignty and integrity of the Jiangsu government and will oppose any attempts on our part to acquire the Shanghai port. It would be a blow to our international prestige but a war against Japan will mobilize more ressources than a small conflict with a Chinese minor so we should consider the option of accepting the Japan ultimatum...
It is not worth the trouble
Following the end of negotiations because of Japanese involvement, the Anglois goverment decided to go to war for the port of Shanghai.

Following our diplomatic show of force the Anglois goverment agreed to abandon any ambitions they had on the port of Shanghai. It is a tremendous success for Japanese diplomacy and it shows how far we have come in terms of power!

Following tense and protracted negotiations between Anglois and Japanese diplomats, the Japanese government made clear its terms - Shanghai or war. Facing nationalistic unrest at home, the Dual Monarchy has had no choice but to back down and accept the Japanese humiliation.
War adverted - the tense staredown between Japan and the Dual Monarchy has ended with the Anglois giving up all claims on Shanghai
Humiliation for the Dual Monarchy! Japanese ultimatum over Shanghai accepted

The Japanese government has heard about our intention to obtain a port in the Far-East and they have approached us to secure ports for both our powers. The ports of Shanghai and Jiaxing would be made international ports with increased sovereignty for our powers. The protocol has been written by Kyoto as to make the Japanese concession more important in Shanghai but in exchange ours in Jiaxing would be dominant. Anyway with such a treaty we would not have to worry about a war in foreign waters since the Chinese state would not dare to oppose our combined might.
We never asked for the advice of the Japanese. Declare war on Jiangsu.

The Anglois and Japanese imperialists have allied to plunder our riches! They reclaim that we cede the ports of Shanghai and Jiaxing to their combined international condominion. If we were to refuse their so called 'Protocol' we would have to face the navies and soldiers of two great powers...
Sign it, although we won't forget about it

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has ceded to the Japanese and Anglois government the sovereignty over the ports of Shanghai and Jiaxing. Both powers will get concessions in both cities that will serve to develop international trade in China. Although both powers officialy share the two cities it is widely accepted that Shanghai will be administered primarily by Japan while Jiaxing will be by Paris. The Chinese public is outraged by the weakness of the Jiangsu government who was not able to resist imperialism. Under Japanese and international guidance, Shanghai will surely grow to become a great city of the world!
Hail our Flag over the Pearl of the East!
The owners of Shanghai agreed to our treeaty and we know own the port of Jiaxing along with concessions in the neighbouring city of Shanghai.
Our empire now spans over the Far East!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused our demands, we should go to war to acquire a port!
We will take it by force
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused our demands, we should go to war to acquire a port!
We will take it by force
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refused our Protocol proposal and declared war upon the owners of Shanghai alone. We may do the same as to acquire it before them.
It may be too risky to attack...
Our military occupation is being scaled back and our newly aquired territories will now be administrated together with the rest of our colonial holdings.
We are being given control over the newly acquired lands.

The Treaty of Selon was signed by Burgundy, Spain, England-France and Scandinavia in the 18th Century, guaranteeing peaceful and trade-oriented development of European power projection in the Far East. This treaty, basically enforced by Spain guarding her trade monopoly, has only stayed relevant due to Spanish efforts. With the Iberian monarchy's status toppled, nothing stands between European Imperialists and Asian riches now...
Let crisis be unlocked from now on, like in Vanilla.
Now that Imperial rule has been restored, we must endeavour to spread control over lands that neighbour our own but which are rightfully part of our Empire.
All preparations are ready for the country to abolish serfdom.

After recent military defeats we have been forced to concede our territories in the coast of Azak, meaning we no longer share a border with our vassals, the Adygey, that have always had a rebelious streak. The local chieftains have now declared that Xacitarxan authority is void, have disarmed the few garrisons we still had in the area and claim that no more tribute will be paid.
We are powerless to stop this.

Genoa was once given the name La Superba, in reference to the astounding wealth and power of its maritime empire. However, fortunes have turned and now the mainland territories in Ligura have been lost and only a weak government-in-exile remains in the colonial territories in the Bight of Biafra. With ever diminishing support, the Genovese patricians now must face the most difficult decision in the history of La Superba - dissolve the republic and bow down to the new masters, or carry on the Genovese legacy in Africa.
We shall accept our European overlords.
Indomitable Genoa shall live on in Africa.

After our conquest of Liguria we gained control of the illustrious city of Genoa, but the Genovese government stubbornly decided to continue functioning in exile in Africa. Now, with increasing economic hardship and mounting difficulties of maintaining a colonial administration without a metropolis, the Genovese have finally agreed to peacefully submit themselves to us.
We have gained a foothold in Africa.

Spain has almost achieved its long sought dream since medieval times, a unified Iberian state spanning from the Algrave to Perpinyà. Only one piece is missing from the puzzle, the Basque, who have fallen into foreign domination. It is our duty to free our Basque brothers and finally unite the Iberian Peninsula under one banner.
Spain Proposes Confederation into the Iberian Union

The venerable Crown of Aragon, once master of the western Mediterranean and a bulwark against Ottoman expansionism, is no more. The Italian crownlands in the Miezzojuorno are gone and the Aragonese state is reduced to its Catalan core. It is in this context that Spain presents its offer of confederation into an Iberian Union - such a thing would allow Catalan culture to remain relevant in the Mediterranean, but it would mean an end to our long-fought for and zealously-guarded independence.
The Catalans will have a brighter future within Spain.
Catalonia will never submit to Castillian imperialism.
The Catalan diplomats have returned a stern-worded and clear response to our proposal to from an Iberian Confederation - Catalan independence is inviolable and they shall never accept the union.
There shall be Catalan autonomy no more.
The Catalans will be incorporated into the Confederation by force.

Normandie, the heart of the Anglois nation, is nowadays a relatively backwards region of our realm with a mostly agrarian economy. However, recent prospections have revealed the existence of ferriferous basins which, with new technologies, could be exploited to boost our metallurgic industry.
We shall not pass over this opportunity.

Some would say the beggining of the XIXth Century was Burgundy's finest hour, emerging victorious from the Great German War and becoming Europe's prime industrial power. Recent technological advances have now made possible the explotation of vast iron ore deposits in the Lorraine Basin, allowing us to further consolidate our position as leaders of the industralised world.
We shall not pass over this opportunity.

Ever since its inception Vinland has been the least populated of the major Arcadian colonies, leading the settlers having a much more equal relation to the so called Skraeling natives. However, recent technological advances have made it possible to exploit the large ferriferous basin around Øverlægsnasjøn, an area which is inhabited by Algonquin and Sioux tribes. The opening of mines in the area is likely to incur anger from the Skraelings, but it is of upmost necessity if we want to compete with the other industrialised Arcadian nations.
We shall not pass over this opportunity.

Ever since independence from the metropolis, the Belgian Confederacy has been the most industralised Arcadian nation, owing to its extensive and accessible coal and iron deposits. For years attempts had been made to exploit iron veins in Blegny in Flandre Supériure to further cement our industrial lead, but prospections had deemed it to be unprofitalbe. Recent technological advances however, now make it possible to exploit these resources and extract high-quality iron ore.
We shall not pass over this opportunity.

The tradition of decentralisation in the Qingqiu Federation has long stimmed expansion eastward. However, with the endless turmoil in the southern border in the former Spanish viceroyalties, and in the east where the worrysome concept of pan-Arcadianism is rising, the need to establish strong settlements in Yicheng as an outpost for further expansion has become apparent. Recent reports speak of extensive iron deposits in the area, the exploitation of which would surely attract the settlers we need.
We shall not pass over this opportunity.

The presence of extensive deposits of iron ore on the province of Cytère have been known since the early days of Anglois colonisation. However, their exploitation has been hampered by the lack of proper forge technology to process the ore - until now, with the advent of charcoal-fueled Aragonese Forges which use an ingenious method to clean the curde iron of slag. We must capitalise on this opportunity and encourage Iron mining in the region.
We shall not pass over this opportunity.

The Kingdom of Kongo has always had a special relationship with the European powers. Centuries ago, when the first contact with explorers and traders from these northern lands was made, a large share of our nobility willingly converted to their Christian religion. While they mainly used this to exert power on our lands and never really saw us as equals, they did show us far more respect than most of our heathen neighbours. Nevertheless, we can feel that times are changing quickly now. The European trading ships are no longer all made from wood and the weapons they carry seem increasingly strange. Perhaps we should use our friendly relationships to have some of our children educated in these modern ways? This would, of course, not be taken well by most of our peoples.
We must go with the times if we want to survive.
We cannot send our dear children away!

After many years, our beloved children have finally returned to us. While sadly many are now estranged from their parents they are all still very happy to finally be reunited. But they also have learned many things from many different fields of science and a lot of them are enthusiastic to teach their families and neighbours about the things they have seen and read about.
Rejoice! They will bring our country into a new age!

They were our brothers and neighbours for centuries and now it seems that they seem to have understood that we have a shared root and a shared destiny. While they may have been initially dispirited with our domination over them, they are now happy to be part of our nation to work for a greater goal.

The lands to our south have always been a bit more fertile than ours. Their people always a bit more prosperous. And their rulers more powerful. But now rumors have reached us that speak of some folly committed by their leadership. Their warriors are demoralised, and we could seize this opportunity to take their rich lands for ourselves.
We can not exploit their grief.

Our history with the Kingdom of Loango has been mostly peaceful. While they were once subservient to us, their autonomy has been tolerated as long as they paid their respects and cooperated. But now it seems they think we are weak because we have sent our children away. We have heard reports of warriors encroaching on our territory...

The Nubian desert is inhospitable, but historically it has been controlled by the Nubian dynasties that once dominated Egypt. Now that we control the outpost of Khartoum on the Nile, we can finally project power in the area and firmly claim the area as ours

The Sultane of Maghreb has for centuries been a bulwark against Christian expansionism in North Africa, being intermittently at war with the Castilians and Catalans since the XVI Century. The last decades, however, have seen the Sultanate enter a phase of terminal decline as the Iberians now control the totality of the former Maghrebi coast and the impoverished state is unable to fund an army capable of resisting European aggression. With a mind towards turning the tables, the Shaykh-ul Islam is now advising the Caliph to proclaim a fatwa with a very clear intent - to expell the infidels from North Africa.
We cannot afford confrontation with the European powers.
Despite our best efforts we have been humiliated. Our will for Jihad has been broken and the legitimacy of the Caliphate has come under serious doubts.
We will crush our enemies who haven't seen the light! Unfortunately with our military occupied the remaining infidels in our land might get the courage to rebel against our rule...
We have succeeded in our conquest of the infidel lands!
The faith in our divine mandate has been shaken up. We must return to somewhat more secular ways.

Iron mining is on the rise in $PROVINCENAME$, leading to a good part of the population abandoning previous economical activities in favor of prospecting and extracting iron. Meanwhile, in other parts of $COUNTRY$, new sources of income are discovered or explored.
This will surely bring us prosperity.

Prospectors in $PROVINCENAME$ struck coal today while looking for precious metals. While not exactly what they were looking for, several $COUNTRY_ADJ$ companies already expressed interested in the commercial exploration of the newfound vein.

Burgundy is robbing all other countries of the conditions of their fertility. Already, in her eagerness for bones, she has turned up the battlefields of Mainz and Magdeburg. Already from the catacombs of Sicily she has carried away the skeletons of many successive generations. Like a vampire she hangs upon the neck of Europe, nay, of the entire world, and sucks the heartblood from nations without a thought of justice towards them, without a shadow of lasting advantage for herself.\nAs the competition for phosphates and sulfurs for fertilizer production heats up, several $COUNTRY_ADJ$ geologists report finding a new source of the desired product in $PROVINCENAME$.
We have a bright future ahead of us.

The conquest of Madjaristan marks the end of the long period of disintegration that began with the Civil War between Mustafa IV and Suleiman II. It has taken many years of war without quarter during which our people have suffered great pain and indignity, but the House of Osman now finds itself at its zenith with undisputed mastery over southeastern Europe. The question still remains, however, on how to best administer the newly-reconquered territories in Madjaristan - with the Ottoman court being divided on Magyar autonomy. Some argue for direct control to maintain an iron grip on our military frontiers, whereas others seek rapprochement with the Magyar nobility to avoid widespread brigandism. The first option would surely solidify and coalesce European opposition against us, whereas the latter would anger the military elites and threaten our recently-gained internal peace.
We shall give the Magyars autonomy
We shall hold Madjaristan at all costs

The gloomy nature of these lands
Is always harsh and wild,
The angry river roars,
Storms often rage,
And the clouds are often dismal...

The seemingly endless stretches of taiga, tundra and steppe east of the Urals have captivated Russian imagination for centuries, a truly untouched vastness that in spite of its harsh climate has allured settlers looking for a new life in the remote frontiers. As Russian population moves East, so do the bureaucratic structures of the imperiia, with administration being handled by the chartered Russian Trans-Siberian Company.

Ever since Kiel was incorporated into the Elbian Confederation the government in Praha has encouraged Elbian-Scandinavian merchants to establish trade links with the rich African Kingdoms of the Gold Coast. A growing Elbian community has established itself in the European quarters of Accre, Fredensborg, causing friction with the local Ashanti chieftains who see their economic supremacy threatened. As tensions rised the merchant community hired Bohemian mercenaries for protection, making eventual armed conflict a matter of time. Reports now arrive in Kiel of a massacre of the merchant community, with the wildest of rumours even speaking of the skull of the former leader of the mercenary band being used as a drinking cup by the Ashanti King. It is now clear that if we want to protect our interests in the area, we need to establish direct control over the Gold Coast.
We shall send an Ultimatum to the Ashanti.
We won't be distracted by the folly of colonial adventures.

The European presence in Accre has been a corrupting influence for our Kingdom. Although expelled in 1817, since then European merchants have been reestablishing themselves in the area, their presence tolerated due to the profitability of their trade. Nevertheless tensions between the local chieftains and the Elbian merchants have violently erupted, with the European quarters of Accre being sacked and the merchants killed or enslaved. The Elbian Confederation now sends us an ultimatum, demanding the cession of the port of Accre as well as the entirety of our coastal possessions.
We won't give up without a fight.
We can't afford war with a Western power.

After the massacre the European merchant community in Fredensborg, the Elbians have sent an Ultimatum with demands for concessions not only in the port of Fredensborg itself but also all along the Gold Coast as well as trading privileges for Bohemian citizens. The Ashanti King's refusal to cede any further sovereignty over its territory to European colonisers now leaves little doubt that armed conflict is imminent.

After the massacre the European merchant community in Fredensborg, the Elbians have sent an Ultimatum with demands for concessions not only in the port of Fredensborg itself but also all along the Gold Coast as well as trading privileges for Bohemian citizens. The Ashanti King's refusal leaves little doubt that armed conflict is imminent.

After the massacre the European merchant community in Fredensborg, the Elbians have sent an Ultimatum with demands for concessions not only in the port of Fredensborg itself but also all along the Gold Coast as well as trading privileges for Bohemian citizens.
War between the Elbian Confederation and Ashanti breaks out as the Ashanti King refuses Ultimatum for the Gold Coast.
Ashanti transgression shall not go unpunished.
We can't afford a distraction in Africa right now.
Secession Crisis in the Elbian Confederation

The Elbian Confederation was born in the wake of the 1840s liberal revolutions, with the founding principles being the rejection of absolutist rule and the equality between Bohemian and Elbian subjects. This fragile understanding has all but been broken as the Confederation has slid into authoritarianism and the erstwhile federation of equals is now a dictatorship ruled with an iron fist from Praha. Representatives from the different Elbian states have gathered and after much deliberation, have come to the conclusion that the Confederation is dead and the only possible path is secession. All over the cities north of the Sudety barricades are already being built as the country braces for Civil War.
The Confederation shall be reunited, by force if necessary.
If the Elbians want to go, they can go.

Months of tension and intermittent skirmishes have followed the proclamation of independence by the League of Berlin, both sides staring at each other with hostility but not daring to strike the first blow. All attempts at reconciliation have failed and war now looms on the horizon as the respective armies of the Confederation and the League stock up supplies and drill for the upcoming conflict.

Months of tension and intermittent skirmishes have followed the proclamation of independence by the League of Berlin, both sides staring at each other with hostility but not daring to strike the first blow. All attempts at reconciliation have failed and war now looms on the horizon as the respective armies of the Confederation and the League stock up supplies and drill for the upcoming conflict.

All attempts at reconciliation have failed and Civil War now looms on the horizon as the respective armies of the Elbian Confederation and the League of Berlin stock up supplies and drill for the upcoming conflict.
Civil War befalls on the Elbian Confederation as the League of Berlin declares independence.
Union shall be enforced by the sword.
The Dissolution of the Elbian Confederation

The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians have proven to be nothing but folly as the League of Berlin finally and decisively asserts its independence from Praha. As a border is drawn north of the old duchies of Bohemia and Silesia, the government of the rump Elbian Confederation acknowledges the turning of the tide and declares the dissolution of the confederation, giving up all pretenses of German domination.

The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians have proven to be nothing but folly as the League of Berlin finally and decisively asserts its independence from Praha. As a border is drawn north of the old duchies of Bohemia and Silesia, the government of the rump Elbian Confederation acknowledges the turning of the tide and declares the dissolution of the confederation, giving up all pretenses of German domination.

The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians end as the League of Berlin finally and decisively asserts its independence from Praha. The government of the rump Elbian Confederation declares the Confederation to be defunct, giving up all pretenses of German domination.
The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians end as the League of Berlin finally and decisively asserts its independence from Praha.
Ameriga Proposes Integration into the Federation

Equinoxie has always has always swam against the current, unwavering in its strife for freedom. It was that desire for freedom, unshackled from the wicked institution of Slavery, that led to the proclamation of the Equinoxian republic and the secession from the Amazonian Federation. Since then times have changed, and now Equinoxie finds itself close to another, more democratic Federation - the Amerigan Federation, whose ideals match ours. Negotiations now begin between both nations as the Amerigan diplomats propose that the Equinoxian Republic into the Amerigan Federation.
Accept the proposal - united we stand!
Equinoxia shall shine with its own light.

Our diplomatic mission to the Equinoxian Republic has been rebuked. In a stern-woreded letter, the Equinoxean ambassador to the Federation has stated clearly that Equinoxie won't surrender its sovereignty, won through fire and blood, at any price.
We will stop at nothing to fulfill the Amerigan dream.
No blood will be shed between brothers.

Novgorod and Muscovy had been sworn enemies ever since the Russian principalities threw off the Mongol yoke, existing in a state of permanent rivalry. Over the past centuries, the power of the once wealthy Republic of Novogorod waned as fur trade became less and less profitable and Baltic trade fell increasingly into the monopoly of Scandinavia. Muscovy, once the underdog, has finally solved the Russian question and imposed it's overlordship over all Russians - now it's only a matter of time until the old, decadent structures of the Feudal Republic are torn down and rebuilt in the name of a united Russia.
The centuries-long struggle is finally over.
Prague Proposes Integration into the Elbian Confederation

Courland has managed to maintain its independence over the centuries by keeping a precarious balance between Kopenhavn and Warszawa. The definite decline of the Polish state has brought us increasingly under dependence of Scandinavia, with our foreing policy and export market being tightly controlled by Scandinavian agents. With the end of our autonomy now looming on the horizon, diplomats from Prague have proposed that our state should be brought into the protection of the Elbian Confederation. Although such a move would end the threat of a Scandinavian takeover, it would mean breaking with a tradition of centuries of defiant Courlandish independence.
Accept the proposal - united we stand!
We will not submit to the Bohemians.

Our diplomatic mission to the Duchy of Kurland has returned empty-handed. The intransigent Elbian nobility in Mitau have made it crystal-clear that they will not give up an inch of their power nor privileges, leaving force as our only option should we decide to push regardless for annexation into the Confederation.
No blood will be shed between brothers.
Prague Proposes Integration into the Elbian Confederation

After centuries of being a no-man's land between the callous powers in Kopenhavn and Warszawa, the Elbian people have risen up and brought peace to the region with the establishment of an independent Livonian state. This indpendence, nevertheless, is looking increasingly brittle as unrest from the largely Latvian and Estonian rural population surges and the predatory powers in Russia and Poland become increasingly beligerent. In light of this conundrum diplomats from Prague have presented a proposal - incorporation into the Elbian Confederation, in exchange for protection against the threats that cloud our future.
Accept the proposal - united we stand!
We will not submit to the Bohemians.

Our diplomatic mission to Livonia has returned empty-handed. The intransigent Elbian nobility in Riga have made it crystal-clear that they will not give up an inch of their power nor privileges, leaving force as our only option should we decide to push regardless for annexation into the Confederation.
No blood will be shed between brothers.
Prague Proposes Integration into the Elbian Confederation

Once the masters of the Baltic, the past centuries saw the Elbians east of Pomerania steadily lose their independence to the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and the Scandinavian Empire. The recent establishment of a pan-Baltic Elbian state gives ground for hope, although its prolonged existence seems increasingly threatened by Polish revanchism and Russian expansionism. In this context Bohemian diplomats have proposed the integration of our state within the Elbian Confederation - such a move would mean protection from the outside threats that loom on the horizon, although it would come at the cost of our hard-won independence.
Accept the proposal - united we stand!
We will not submit to the Bohemians.

Our diplomatic mission to Riga has returned empty-handed. The intransigent Elbian nobility have made it crystal-clear that they will not give up an inch of their power nor privileges, leaving force as our only option should we decide to push regardless for annexation into the Confederation.
No blood will be shed between brothers.
Elbian Agitation in the Livonian Provinces

Ever since the Northern Crusades and the subjugation of the Baltic pagans by the Düütsche Orden, the Elbians have dominated the upper echelons of Livonian society, with the cities of Mitau and Riga becoming the economic centres of the region and acquiring a strong German character. Alhtough vassalised by us after the Livonian wars, the Baltic Elbian nobility have remained loyal subjects over the centuries and have enjoyed ample autonomy. Nevertheless, with the advent of nationalism and the creation of the Elbian Confederation, increasingly larger segments of the Baltic Elbian society now advocate for the creation of an independent Livonian state, and plead to the German powers abroad for intervention.
We can expect trouble in the coming months.

Although the Elbian Confederation was created to strengthen the bonds between Elbians and Bohemians and contain the currents of nationalism, which threatened to break a centuries-old brotherhood, this corrupting force is on the rise again in the northern provinces of the Federation as news of Elbian repression in Livonia reach our shores. The Elbian population in the Baltic, long-oppressed by foreign conquerors, is now starting to organise resistance. Comitees for Baltic Friendship and Cooperation are opening throughout the northern components of the confederation, and the voices for intervention in Livonia are gaining ever-increasing traction amongst Elbian political circles. We could declare ourselves to be the protectors of the Baltic Elbians, thus appeasing our restive population, although that would certainly put us on a warpath with the current overlords of Riga.
We shall liberate our Elbian brothers.
We can't afford to disturb the delicate balance between Bohemians and Elbians in the federation.

Our recent victories in the field of battle have led not only to the establishment of an Elbian state in Livonia, but also to substantial political turmoil within the confederation. The northern Elbian states have advocated vehemently in favour of outright annexation of Livonia, whereas the states of Bohemia and Moravia refuse any further commitments to a backwater devoid of interest for Bohemians. In the end, a compromise solution has been reached - a Baltic Elbian state will be created, outside of the Elbian Confederation but under the close suppervision of Praha.
Freundschaft, Frohsinn, Tugend, Wissen - soll man nie bei den Balten missen.

The thorny question of the Baltic Elbians has proven to be the final tipping point needed to tear the fragile Confederation asunder. Tensions between Bohemians and Eblians, kept in check by a complex system of balance of power, have become irreconciliable with the incorporation of millions of non-Bohemian citizens from the Baltic. Fearing that Bohemia might become nothing more than an Elbian protectorate, the governor in Praha has issued an Ordinance of Secession, followed suit by the rest of the Bohemian provinces in the Confederation. As barricades are built and Elbian forces are recalled to Berlin, it becomes clear that only war can now keep the Confederation united.
The upstart revolutionaries will be crushed in due time.
We won't keep the Bohemians in the Confederation by force.

The conflict between Praha and Berlin has been brewing for months, with violent hotspots all over the border areas in Saxony and Silesia where the no clear ethnic lines between Elbians and Bohemians can be drawn. Leaders on both sides of the newly-erected border have tried to maintain an uneasy peace, unwilling to be the ones to fire the first shots to plunge the Confederation into war. The suppressed violence has proven too much for anyone contain, and as skirmishes break out all along the contested territory, it finally spills over the beleaguered Confederation.

Months of tension and intermittent skirmishes have followed the proclamation of independence by the Bohemian Republic, both sides staring at each other with hostility but not daring to strike the first blow. All attempts at reconciliation have failed and war now looms on the horizon as the respective armies of the Confederation and Bohemia-Moravia stock up supplies and drill for the upcoming conflict.

All attempts at reconciliation have failed and Civil War now looms on the horizon as the respective armies of the Elbian Confederation and the Bohemian Republic stock up supplies and drill for the upcoming conflict.
Civil War befalls on the Elbian Confederation as the Republic of Bohemia-Moravia declares independence.
The Disintegration of the Elbian Confederation

The Elbian Confederation, born out of the dream to unite Bohemian and Elbian peoples in harmony, is no more. The Bohemian Republic has asserted its independence on the field of battle, leaving a rump Confederation consisting of no more than the German and Baltic territories. Originally a political vision from Praha, the secession of the Bohemians leaves no option but to acknowledge the reality on the ground and redefine the state as an eminently Elbian nation.

The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians have proven to be nothing but folly as the Bohemian Republic finally and decisively asserts its independence. As a border is drawn north of the old duchies of Saxony and Silesia, the government of the rump Elbian Confederation acknowledges the turning of the tide and declares the dissolution of the Confederation.

The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians end as the Bohemian Republic finally and decisively asserts its independence from Berlin. The government of the rump Elbian Confederation declares the Confederation to be defunct.
The dreams of a common state shared by Elbians and Bohemians end as the Bohemian Republic finally and decisively asserts its independence from Berlin.

The newly formed Hispanic Commonwealth has made an intriguing offer to us. Because our western neighbor is now focused on the New World due to their extensive core holdings in Arcadia and Ameriga, their European interests -which often diverged from our interests in Europe- have taken a backseat. Now, it is more important to secure their European border than expand them.
A welcome proposal from our Iberian brethren.
We are good on our own.
We will crush the upstart Spanish.
The Aragonese Agree to Our Treaty

The Aragonese government has wisely agreed to the treaty. Peace shall reign on the Iberian peninsula as our two great nations march into the future together. Already, officers from both countries are traveling across the border to plan military wargames together and share tactical knowledge while class curriculums have been changed to emphasize the common brotherhood between the two great powers in Iberia. The common citizen in Madrid, Lisboa, Barcelona, or any other of the many cities in Iberia can rest easy tonight.

Unfortunately, the foolish Aragonese has rejected our offer. It is a setback to our dipomatic efforts and an embarrasment to our nation as a whole but there is nothing more to be done. If a war comes in the future, we shall let it be known we tried out best to avoid it. We will pray for peace and prepare for war.
A regrettable decision by the Aragonese.

Not only has Aragon refused our treaty, they have spat in our face, expelled our diplomats, and insulted our nation. If they insist on a war, it is a war that we will give them! We shall avenge this humiliation with our superior forces and show them the error of their ways. Very soon, there shall be Hispanic troops marching through Barcelona. Our Commonwealth has been tested and we will rise to the challenge as one nation. United, we will stand.

Under the leadership of Sanjar III the Sultanate of Sindh not only beat off Mughal incursions from the East, but also managed to greatly expand the realm Westward into the mosaic of squabbling Baloch tribes after the collapse of Timurtash power in the region. The Baloch lands were united under the fiefdom of the Khan of Kalat, who pledged alliegance to the Sultan of Sindh. In recent years Sindhi influence across the Sulayman mountains has waned, reaching its current nadir - with the Kalat Khan now defiantly refusing to send tribute to Thatta.

In the midst of the chaos created by the Ottoman Civil War and the Hungarian and Illyrian insurrections, the Pashaliks of Mosul and Baghdad, united under the leadership of Faysal Jalili, declared independence from the Sublime Porte. With no forces to spare for an expedition to the Levant, the House of Osman reluctantly recognised Jalili as Malik of Iraq. Although in the ensuing decades plans were repeatedly drawn to bring Baghdad under Turkish dominion, it is now painfully clear that the Ottoman state is too weak for such an adventure.
We must relinquish our claims, for the sake of peace.

The Timurtash Empire had come to a state of near collapse by the end of the XVIII Century - religious strife, repeated humiliations against the Ottoman Turks, Dzunghar encroachment in Transoxiana all contributing to the disintegration - and only barely managed to survive into the new century holding on to its powerbase in Khorasan. Recent setbacks, however, have seen the dynasty lose its two largest remaining power centres in Gorgan and Mashhad, leaving the Timurtash state moribund. The Salor, a rival Turkmen tribe settled along the Amu-Darya, have smelt blood and swept south to capture Marw, effectively ending Timurtash rule over the remaining territories in Margiana.
The End of the Shekhbizin Empire

From the near-collapse of the Timurtash Empire at the turn of the XIX Century and the ensuing power vacuum arose an unlikely contester for the domination of Iran - the Shekhbizins, originally a humble Lurish tribe holding hereditary military offices. Managing to marshal together fragments of the disintegrating Timurtash army, the Shekhbizins managed to eventually dominate much of southern Iran. Their glory, however, has proven to be short-lived as the Shekhbizin state is reduced to a handful of territories in Mesopotamia, away from its powerbase in Lorestan. Although the Shekhbizin monarch is kept as a figurehead, it is clear that now power resides with the local Kurdish potentates.

The Circassians are the most recent acquisition of our realm, subjugated into a tributary status after a series of brief military campaigns along the Black Sea coast. This unequal relationship obligates the Adyghe to pay us annual tribute in the form of tax revenue and military service, but comes with the assurance from the Xacitarxan Khan to stop Tatar raids into the Circassian lands. The Adyghe, however, have sensed our weakness and are now demanding an end to this humiliating status - and are ready to resort to violence to enforce their demands.
We are powerless to stop the Adyghe.
If the Adyghe want war, war they shall have.

The envoys sent to the Xacitarxan Khan have returned - or rather, their heads, along with a message from the Khan himself announcing that the Tatar Hordes are on their way to punish us for our insolence.

The Principality of Samtskhe and the Kingdom of Imereti lay in the westernmost reach of our realm, and so far have enjoyed the highest degree of autonomy of any of the divisions of our young Khanate. Resentment among the Kartvelians has simmered for years, concerning not only taxation but also the political status of eastern Gorjestan, part of the Khan's obog. With the imminent fall of the Ottoman Empire and the dangerous precedents set in Europe by the German Revolution, the moment we feared has come - $FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent envoys to demand full independence from the Shaki Khanate.
We are powerless to stop the Georgians.
If the Georgians want war, war they shall have.
The Shaki Khanate Refuses Our Overtures
The envoys sent to the Shaki Khan have returned emptyhanded. No compromise is possible - if $COUNTRY$ is to achieve independence, it will have to be won first in the field of battle.

The end of the political fragmentation and foreign domination of the Georgian people is in sight. After centuries of foreign subjugation by foreign conquerors - Mongols, Timurids, Ottoman, Timurtash, Turkoman - a Georgian state proudly stands fully sovereign, with no masters to answer to. The long period of disintegration started by the infighting of the Bagrationid nobility in the XV Century is finally coming to a close.

The venerable land of Iran is deep in turmoil - the Timurtash, Shahanshahs of Eranshahr for over two centuries, once lords of a realm streching from the Black Sea to the Amu Darya, are now reduced to a rump state in Khorasan. Elsewhere, local noble houses have risen up and are warring for the vacant Iranian throne: the Shiite Kar-Kiya, the Shekhbizin warlords, the ambitious Shaki Khan, all threatening to engulf Iran in a storm of violence. Yet, among the ruins of the Timurtash empire, Persian culture flourishes, and the conflict between the new rivaling states is proving to be fertile ground for innovations in the field of military, agriculture and infrastructure.
Men of sense and wisdom will proclaim, when I have gone, my praises and my fame.
The End of the Last of the Caucasus Khanates

The Timurtash administration of the Caucasus was handled through a mosaic of vassal Khanates swearing fealty to Isfahan. With the final defeat of the Timurtash the Khanates became subjects of the Ottoman Sultan, and although nominally the territories were organised into Elayets, the Khans retained a large degree of autonomy. With the onset of the Ottoman Civil War the weak Turkish grip on the Caucasus finally broke, shattering the region into sundry independent Khanates struggling to pick up the spoils left behind by the fallen empires. The Shaki Khan finally came on top, uniting the former Timurtash lands from Tiblisi to Tabriz. The fortunes of the Shaki Khanate have proven to be ephemeral, and with the loss of Shaki itself, the Turkoman state finds itself in need of abandoning the old system of confederated martial aristocracy. If the Turkoman are to survive as an independent people, power must be concentrated into the figure of a central autocrat.
Someone's end is someone else's beggining.
The Preseverance of the Weisuo System

The Weisuo system, introduced to China by the Yuan dynasty, consisted in the use of hereditary military households to organise the military forces of China. These households were concentrated along the frontiers and in key strategic positions in the heartlands of the Empire, where the soldiers served a dual military-agrarian purpose, being given land in an effort to make the army self-sustaining. The system endured into the Ming period, though by the end of the dynasty it had all but broken down as the hereditary positions gave rise to soldiers being more loyal to their officer-patrons rather than to the throne. The successor states of the fallen Ming have inherited the Weisuo system, preventing efficient mobilisation of the state's resources unless deep military reforms are enacted.
The Middle Kingdom shall be reunited.
The End of the Weisuo System

The military reforms introduced in recent years have allowed us to get rid of the Weisuo, an antiquated hereditary military household system to organise the army dating back to the Yuan dynasty. With the adoption of Western methods of conscription and reserve organisation, we should now be able to efficiently mobilise the resources of the Middle Kingdom.
When the flood recedes, the rock is there.

The Island of Qeshm, sitting astride the strategic exit-point from the Persian Gulf to the Indian Ocean, has been traditionally the key to dominating maritime trade with Iranshahr and has been hotly contested over the centuries by competing powers. Nominally governed by the Hormuz Shahs, this mercantile centre has come gone through intermitent domination by mainland Iranian polities, Omani Sheikdoms and the faraway Imperial powers of Spain and Burgundy. After the fall of the Timurtash Empire the island was seized by the upstart Shekhbizin Shahs, who now have a tenuous hold over the entire northern shore of the Persian Gulf. We could offer the Shekhbizin a lease of Qeshm in exchange for a fixed percentage of the trade revenue - a scant deal, but one which we could push through with force, if necessary.
We will propose an Agreement with the Shekhbizin Shah.
We won't risk conflict for a barren rock.

Qeshm, the cornestone of trade between the Persian Gulf, the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean, has traditionally been a prized possession for any polity based in Fars. The island came recently under Shekhbizin domination after a short campaign which ousted the Hormuz Shahs, the erstwhile Timurtash vassals in the region, from power. Although Shekhbizin power extends for much of southern Iran, our position is far from secure, with rivals to our north and east and our traditional enemies, the Ottoman Empire, tottering but still capable of going down fighting. The rapacious imperialists from $FROMCOUNTRY$ are well aware of this fact - and are now demanding that we cede Qeshm as a trade post in exchange for a minuscule percentage of the trade taxes.
We have no choice - we will lease Qeshm to stay in $FROMCOUNTRY$'s good graces.
Unacceptable - bowing down to $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ humiliating demands would ruin our legitimacy.

The Shekhbizin Embassy has returned with a letter from the Shah himself. Although adorned with highly-sophisticated language and politeness, the message is clear - the Shekhbizin Shah will not tolerate any threat to the territorial integrity of his realm, and is confident in his ability to swat any expedition we might send to take Qeshm by force.
We shall take these Oriental Despots down a peg.
Qeshm is not worth spilling a single drop of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ blood.
