They have pacified regions beyond the territory of the Emirates, but they remain without proper governance and will descend back into chaos once the militia inevitably moves on to their next target. Their leaders have approached us to take control over the newly liberated territories and ensure that they permanently remain in peace. Accepting this proposal will cement our positions as the hegemon over the petty Kurdish feudal states, but it will surely put us in direct opposition to the powers that will come to rule Constantinople once the Civil War is resolved. Furthermore, the militia are known to be ruthless plunderers and they are bound to cause our realm trouble should we sponsor their campaigns.
We agree to their offer of course.
We will have no business with brigands.
Another region has been liberated by the Kuren Kurdistana Azad and ready to be incorporated into our growing realm!
We welcome our brothers and sisters.
The Kurdish insurgents have occupied yet another territory and the traitorous Emir has added it into his ever-growing realm.
We ought to act and end this insubordination!
Another region has been liberated by the Kuren Kurdistana Azad and ready to be incorporated into our growing realm!
We welcome our brothers and sisters.
A local militia comprised out of mainly Assyrian and Nestorian Christians has managed to take over the regional capital of Mosul and is now offering control over it to the Emirate of Soran.
What do they hope to gain from this?

With concerns we have watched the Christian tribes and inhabitants of Upper Mesopotamia take control of the city of Mosul, the last bastion of Ottoman authority in Jazira. Ottoman retaliation from Syria will not wait for long and the Christians have come to us and made us an interesting offer: we are to put them under our protection and claim Mosul as our own. Surely this expansion of our realm would benefit us greatly and taking control over the Christian militants at our border would limit the threat of violent clashes with them. Nevertheless, we would have to deal with Ottoman attempts to reclaim the city, prompting some to consider it wise to work out a peaceful solution with Constantinople instead. And while we have been the most tolerant of the Kurdish realms when it comes to the Christians and their rites, we would be best advised to watch their influence within our realm or it might be us that will be dethroned in the years to come.
The risks are just too high. They are on their own.

The Ottoman Civil War is over and the Kurdish Emirates still remain independent. For the first time in recent history, we can enjoy peace beyond the limits of the Ottoman or Persian Empires. This favourable situation has largely been the doing of the Kuren Kurdistana Azad, the peasant militia gathered from most of the ravaged Kurdistan. Now that the fighting has died down, their purpose remains questionable, but all signs point towards their continued operation. Too much fame did their leaders gain, too profitable were their campaigns beyond our borders. But now that peace has been established, their attention has turned inside the territory of our realm, where they start to harass the seated peasantry. Wherever we like it or not, the militia has become a lasting presence in our lands and we will have to deal with whatever this may entail.
Let us hope that they behave.

In our attempts to mediate between the farmers and the militia, we have largely put an end to the plundering and sacking of farms that would not supply them with their produce. However, the situation has not been resolved entirely and the tensions remain. This morning some of their representatives at the court have come and made demands so that they would be able to keep their men under control and continue their integration into the standing force of the Emirate. They ask for money and valuables, everything to ensure the continued existence of the militia and prevent them from returning to their villages, or worse, start raiding them again. They try to frame this as a lucrative offer, but we know that it is nothing less than a threat to the peace we have so carefully created. Do we agree to their demands?
They can get their money elsewhere. Point them to the Christian villages.
They will see not a single coin!

With increased western presence in our realm, we have managed to make important advancements in the organisation of our standing military force. But as much of our force is comprised out of members of the KKA, many of them loyal to their veteran officers, there has been growing resentment for this progress. We have received demands from officers in the army demanding the return to the traditional ways of organising the army. The Emir should recognise the officers proposed by the militia and halt his attempts to force them to undergo western training. Furthermore, the introduced harsh drilling ought to stop.  In return, they have offered their support in asserting hegemony over the other Kuridsh Emirates, which have taken increasingly hostile stances towards the KKA. Abandoning our progress in modernising the army will be a harsh blow, but it may be the only way to keep the loyalty of a large part of our fighting force.
We will postpone attempts to reform the army. For now.
Those who stand in the way of progress will fall.

Our past dealings with the Kuren Kurdistana Azad have included many ludicrous demands made by their leadership. Until now we have acquiesced in the name of peace, but none of their demands has been as offensive as the one brought to us this day. The war hero and current leader of the KKA, a lowborn named Kumar Farsi, has sent envoys asking for the hand of the Emir's daughter. In return he would offer his services to the Emirate and finalise the union of the militia with the army. While Kumar is a man of great deeds and a folkhero across all Kurdistan, he is still lowborn and has a history of brigandry. Allowing his entry into the Emir's family will hurt our legitimacy in the eyes of the traditionalist parts of our people. However, this promised final union of army and militia might finally bring strengthen us enough to end this humiliation once and for all.
Arrange the preparations for the marriage.
How dare they even propose this?!

Eastern Anatolia has throughout its history always been a place of money cultures. Nowadays the Kurds may be the predominant and most numerous people here, but they are joined by the Christian Armenians and Assyrians, who constitute regional majorities. These people have always caused issues for the Emirates and have often refused to recognise their reign in favour for the Ottoman Empire, who has put the Christian minorities under its protection, at least until the Civil War. Nowadays large parts of our territories are still inhabited by Christians and mainly the Assyrian tribes prove to be hindersome in our path to independence. Voices in the court have proposed that we ought to subject them properly to our rule...and eradicate those who choose to resist. How are we to resolve the Assyrian Question?
They will have to accept our predominance or perish in their defiance.
We shall not force the Christians into submission through violence.
I am afraid there is no future for them in this land.

With great anger we have taken notice of the mistreatment of our Christian brothers and sisters in the Kurdish Emirates. Kurdish soldiers have come into their lands and enact brutal crimes on the population. Many have come to us already and asked us for support in these times, for there might yet be worse to come. It is time to act and defend them from the tyrants that seek to eradicate them!
Too long have we watched and done nothing!
It is very regretful, but we cannot afford such a conflict right now.

The time has come to enforce our rule in the entirety of our realm! Those who dared to stand in our way has been swept aside and now nobody is there to hinder us. We have already noticed large parts of the Christian populations flee southwards.

The time has come to enforce our rule in the entirety of our realm! Those who dared to stand in our way has been swept aside and now nobody is there to hinder us. Those who survived the massacres have left for the southern borders. Those that remain, weep in terror.

With the continued massacres against the Christians in the Kurdish Emirates, many have come to our lands to seek refuge and a new home. Thousands have already arrived at our doorstep and many more are to come. It is our moral obligation to give them a new home after all the hardship they have endured, but many in our nation do not share that sentiment. Especially our Muslim subjects fear that increased Christian presence in our land will tip the balance of power in the state and eventually lead to acts of revenge akin to what happened in the Emirates. While we will never let it come this far, we can understand their worries and must quickly make a decision on how to deal with this wave of refugees.
We welcome them with open arms.
Drive them away from the border. They must try their luck somewhere else.
Dealing with the Kuren Kurdistana Azad

For many years we have had to endure the KKA and its outrageous demands that have humiliated the Emir and limited his authority in the army. Through continued reform of our nation, we have received the means to finally end this humiliation. However, crushing their power will not be easy. We could attempt to bribe the officers of the militia to fully devote themselves to the Emirate's army. This would gain us the support of their men, within the army and outside of it, and cripple the militia. Alternatively, we could cleanse the militia officers from our ranks through a surprise coup by soldiers loyal to the Emir. Some elements of the court instead suggest that an open confrontation of the militia would bring the Emir great prestige and restore the respect lost during the cooperation with it. Forcefully outlawing the militia is possible with our current means, but it would also render all the progress and sacrifices have made void, and we run the risk of revolt.
Stage a coup agains the KKA officers.
Crush the KKA in a show of force.

If we seek to expand the borders of our young nation, we should heed the proposals and advice of our subjects. Many elements of the mercantile class have suggested that Kurdistan ought to gain sea access, so that trade and wealth may flow without hinderance to our lands. By conquering Upper Syria, we could finally open up Kurdistan to the world. High-ranking members of the army and nationalists have suggested that we liberate the Kurds that still remain beyond the limits of our nation. By expanding our borders northwards, we would truly become a nation for all the Kurds in the Middle East. Lastly, there has been a suggestion of expansion into the fertile lands to prevent famines. By expanding southwards into Mesopotamia, we could end this problem for perpetuity and even open up the possibility to feed a much larger population than was previously possible.
Syria will grant us a window towards the Mediterranean.
The Mesopotamian plains will bring us prosperity.
Our priority should be liberating Kurds wherever they live.

The guilds are left-overs of the economic organisation within the Ottoman Empire and to this day they extract the wealth of Kurdistan to the Turkish state that we could instead use in the upcoming reconquest of our lands. We must deal with them to stop this exploitation. A simple but costly solution would be to offer them even more lucrative deals than their partners outside of Kurdistan, stopping the harmful exploitative practices of the guilds. Another option would be put the guild under direct control of the Emir by decree. The guild would continue to operate under state management and become the foundation for the coming industry of the Kurdish nation. This would very likely sour our relations with our Turkish neighbours even more. Finally, we could disband the guild outright and distribute its assets throughout the Kurdish nation, so that a market economy may develop, akin to the western nations and free from archaic control of guilds and governments.
The Ottoman guilds have no place in a modern economy.

Soran has come a long way and brought about great change in the region, being the first state in a long time that allowed for the co-existence of Muslims and Christians as equals in society. Nevertheless, this system has come under extreme stress from both sides. The Muslims fear to be replaced by the militant Christian elements in the state and the Christians fear that their welcome might only be temporary and ultimately result in their demise. Tensions have risen to a point where violence has taken the streets and militias have formed to protect their own in these trying times. It is at this point that we as the rulers of Soran have to make a decision. Shall we side with one of the factions to restore peace in the state? But must it really come this far? Are we ready to sacrifice all the things we have achieved in the past years?
We will reassert our Kurdish roots.
The Assyrians promise a better future than the Kuridsh tribals.
Assyrians and Kurds will coexist as equals.

Liberated by the Jagiellonian Duke of Nitra from the Turks in 1810, Hungary faces the burden of dealing with the legacy of three hundred years of Ottoman occupation and the tripartite division of the Kingdom: the western fringes known as Royal Hungary, under Holy Roman control, central and south-Hungary, part of the Ottoman province of Madjaristan, and Transylvania, under the rule of a local prince. Quasi-feudalism persists in Royal Hungary, where the noble lords crush the peasantry with the heavy yoke of serfdom. In former Madjaristan, the cash-corp economy of the Turkish times is sagging and the islamicised Magyars in the south, the Kunok, are increasingly restive. And in Transylvania, ethnic tensions are brewing as the Saxons and Romanians react with increasing hostility to centralising policies and even the Szekelys, historically-privileged Hungarian frontiersmen, turn against the government in Buda.

The recovery of the Crown of St Stephen has finally given the government the legitimacy and political capital to push forward a far-reaching reform program meant to unroot all the obstacles that stand in the way of the modernisation of Hungary. Several groups will be targeted. In Transylvania, the Saxons and Szekelys, who have enjoyed uninterrupted autonomy for half a millenia, will have to be dealt with. In Central-South Hungary the cattle barons will have to be forced to diversify their economic activities if the Hungarian plain is to be rescued from its current destitution. In Western Hungary the nobility, seeing themselves as the liberators of the Magyar nation, are entrenched in their medieval privileges and are agressively pushing a policy of Catholicisation - and will have to be reigned in if the peasantry is to rise from abject poverty and the loyalty of the majority-protestant population is to be kept.

The dissolution of the Székelyföld has finally opened up the possibility of non-Szekelys, including the central government, to purchase land in the region - with the consequence that the neglected copper mines in Csíkszentdomokos can now be renovated and production ramped up. It will be no light undertaking, for several technical difficulties presently hinder economical exploitation of the copper ore. On the one hand, black-powder blasting will have to be used to loosen the rock, therefore requiring the digging of extensive ventilation shafts to extract the foul fumes. On the other hand, steam pumps will be required to prevent the galleries form being waterlogged. Nevertheless, preliminary geologic surveys indicate that under Csíkszentdomokos lay the largets copper deposits in all of Transylvania.
We will renovate the infrastructure of the copper mines.
We won't disturb the local traditional economy.

The recent decree to abolish the historical rights of the Szekely people are encountering resistance in the Székelyföld, where the Szekler National Council has been founded as an opposition block to the centralising policies coming from Buda. Demonstrations have started in the neural centre of the Székelyföld, Udvarhelyszék, some demanding a return to the previous model of self-government, some going further and proclaim the right of the Szekely to self-determination. In Buda the government right now favours a policy of wait-and-see, with the hope that unrest in the Székelyföld will burn out on its own - but a group of hardliners argues that if the state is to keep on its centralisation path, a show of force is needed and the Honved needs to intervene in Udvarhelyszék.
We will have to weather the storm.

The deployment of Honved troops to the Székelyföld has ended in disaster - the soldiers sent by the central government, resenting the privileges and status of their Szekely peers, have taken advantage of the slightest provocation to open fire on the Szekely assembled in the various historical seats of the region. Reports coming back from Transylvania speak of massacres and the flight of the Szekely out of their ancestral lands to escape the wrath of the modern Hungarian army.
A black day for our nation.

In order to modernise the economy of the Alföld, the Great Hungarian Plain, state investment will have to be directed in several areas. Different groups within the Hungarian government lobby for various sectors: some push for investment into agriculture to turn Hungary from a net importer to an exporter of grain and therefore gain food security, while also promoting the revival of the long-gone wine industry. Others claim that in the era of Industrial Revolution, Hungary must make the most out of its natural resources and invest in new technology to exploit the deposits of lignite, copper and other metallurgicaly-relevant ores.
Focus on the extraction of mineral resources.
Invest in both agriculture and mining.

The conquest of Croatia has resulted in the incorporation of millions of non-Magyar subjects into the realm, making Magyars a decided minority within Hungary. A profound fear has awakened within sectors of Hungarian society, anxious about the prospect that the Magyar will loose their preeminent position within the Kingdom and become a subject people again as during the 300 year Ottoman rule, still fresh in the national consciousness. The solution, some claim, is to enact Magyarisation: replace non-Magyar teachers and officials, establish Magyar as the exclusive language of the legislature and crack down on the last remnants of cultural autonomy in Transylvania. These assimilationist policies, however, could result in the galvanisation of national opposition of the Magyars, and bring about unprecedent cooperation between the oppressed minorities.
Hungary will be a nation of nations.

Recently pamphlets have been arriving in our nation, sent by the Saxon University in Transylvania, describing the dire situation of the Siebenbürgen Germans in the face of agressive Magyarisation policies. These pamphlets have managed to make ripples, prompting a collection of concerned individuals - professors, industrialists, nationalist politicians - to create the Allgemeiner Deutscher Schutzverband, an association dedicated to the protection of the Auslandsdeutschen - the foreign German-speaking communities - and the strengthening of trade with Transylvania. Influential members of the upper and upper-middle class now demand that our government take an active stance in the unfortunate developments happening in the Transylvania and fund the ADS - although such an interference with Hungarian internal affairs would certainly earn the enemity of the government in Budapest.
The Transylvanian Saxons are not our concern.

The Allgemeiner Deutscher Schutzverband, a nationalist German association, has been operating for some time in Transylvania, spreading lies to inflame the Saxons into sedition. Although we have tolerated its activities so far, the latest brochure published has gone too far. In it, a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ professor described the supposed threat to German culture in Transylvania posed by Hungary and Magyarisation. The brochure claims that it was the Saxons who civilised Transylvania, founded its most important cities, protected Hungary throughout its history from the barbaric Asiatic hordes and ultimately freed the Magyar from Turkish oppression - yet now the Magyar have taken the role of the Turks as tyrants over the Saxons. If the spread of such drivel is to stop, our diplomats will have to pressure the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government to cut ties with the ADS, even if it may hurt our bilateral relations.

Our support of the Allgemeiner Deutscher Schutzverband has not gone unnoticed in the Hungarian parliament, where the news have attained the proportions of a true national scandal. The protest of the Hungarian ambassador hasn't taken time to arrive - claiming that the ADS is misleading public opinion in both $COUNTRY$ and Hungary and needlessly agitating the Transylvanian Saxons, who in their vast majority are supposedly voluntarily assimilating into Magyar society and leaving behind German culture. According to the ambassador, it is an imperative for the modernisation of the Hungarian state that the Magyar language be learnt by all Hungarian citizens, the Saxons being no exception. The Hungarian protests have stoked the fires of nationalism within $COUNTRY$, and many now see the ADS as an incomplete solution, and that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government should make it an official policy to ensure the rights of the Siebenbürgen Saxons.
Demand that the Magyarisation of the Saxon lands cease.
We can't interfere with Hungarian internal affairs.

The situation of the Saxons has become the dominant issue in $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ political life, achieving a momentum that has ended up dragging the government itself into the issue. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ambassador has now informed us that the current policies enacted in Transylvania are unacceptable, and that the forced assimilation of the Saxons is a violation of their historical rights granted by the Árpád Kings and a disservice to Christian civilisation, which the Saxons have striven to protect for centuries. The Hungarian parliament is practically burning with anger at this ingerence, with the majority opinion being that an attack on Hungary's linguistic policies is an attack on the Magyar nation itself.
We will stop the integration of the Saxon lands.

The Hungarian government stubbornly continues to ease up its assimilationist policy in the Siebenbürgen, claiming that the use of the Magyar language in all spheres of life is a necessity for the consolidation of the nation. In the face of such recalcitrance the radical voices within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ groups supporting the Saxons are gaining weight, postulating that the only way to end the Magyar Sprachtyrannei - tyranny of the language - is for the Königsboden, the presently abolished Saxon autonomous region, to be reinstated and given full powers over matters of education, effectively becoming a state within a state. While adopting such a position officially will certainly put us on a collition course with Hungary, it might be our only recourse to save the Saxon nation from oblivion.
The Königsboden will have to regain its lost autonomy.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has escalated the Saxon Crisis to an unforseeable degree by demanding that the Königsboden, abolished in recent years as part of our centralisation efforts, be reinstated as effectively a state within a state in Hungary. These ingerencies threaten to topple the new order so painstakingly built by the Magyar race since the Turks were kicked out of the land and sink us back into servitude. Hungary belongs to the Magyars and there can only be one Magyar state - and the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ambassador shall be duly brought up to speed on this fact.
We won't tolerate any attack on our sovereignty.

The Hungarian government has refused our request that the Saxons be returned the autonomy that they had enjoyed since the Middle Ages. It seems that Hungarian national consciousness, twisted by 300 years of partition and Turkish domination, has been infected with the disease of Germanophobia and the irrational fear of Germanisation. The refusal of the government in Buda to find a compromise solution for the Siebenbürgen Saxons leaves us with little option but to use force to defend the Deutschtum. Increasingly large segments of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ are demanding that an Ultimatum be sent to Hungary, this time not requesting autonomy but uncompromising freedom for the Transylvanian Saxons.
We can't risk war for Transylvania.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ embassy has sent us an Ultimatum detailing the timetable in which we must evacuate the territories of the former Königsboden and allow the transit of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ troops towards Transylvania to safeguard the independence of the new Saxon state. Accepting these demands not only would be a humiliation of historical proportions, but it would moreover completely derail our efforts to modernise and harmonise our nation and accelerate the centripetal tendencies of other ethnic minorities in Hungary - not least of all the Vlachs, who are the object of irredentism for the Romanian principalities.
We can't risk war for the Königsboden..

The expiry time for the Ultimatum sent to the Hungarian government has expired - with no answer being forwarded from Buda. War will now decide the ultimate fate of the Transylvanian Saxons and the preserverance of German character of the Auslandsdeutschen.
The Magyars have left us with no other option.
The Magyar Tyranny Comes to an End

The Saxon nation has been saved - the Magyars have been expelled form the ancient lands of the Königsboden and their assimilationist policies have been put to an end. The Germans, once again, shine the light of civilisation in the wild frontier of Transylvania..
The name of God is the strongest Tower.

Our centralisation policies have been bitterly resisted in Transylvania, the only Hungarian region to experience near-independence during the Ottoman period. Its political structures, including the Transylvanian Diet, were dismantled upon the reunification of Hungary in 1810, even if the privileges of the various nations were not abolished until recent years. The massacres of the rebellious Szekelys and the dissolution of the Königsboden have managed to revive the solidarity between the three nations of Transylvania, who have invoked the Unio Trio Natium - a medieval pact between Magyar nobles, Szekely freemen and Saxons to defend their common interests in Transylvania - although this time not against peasant rebellions but rather against the central government in Buda. The suspended Transylvanian Diet has reconvened for the first time since reunification and elected György Nádasdi Ungor, son of the last Transylvanian Prince, to lead the secessionist government.
Outrageous! Refuse to recognise the Diet's authority.
The Union of the Three Nations

The Transylvanian Diet, although referencing its medieval past, has been working in the past months to draft a new constitution, repurposing the old feudal chamber into a federal-level democraticaly-elected parliament where the three nations of Transylvania will manage common affairs and external policy. The constitution confirms György Nádasdi Ungor as Prince as well as the elective nature of the Principality and - most importantly - the severing of all political ties with the Hungarian government in Buda. The central government, hesitant to use the armed forces against fellow Magyars, had set the drafting of an openly secessionist constitution as a red line for military intervention. With that Rubicon crossed, there are no more restraints left to prevent Civil War from breaking out.
The Honvéd will restore order in Transylvania.
The Maelstrom of War Engulfs Transylvania

The government in Buda has stubbornly refused to negotiate a peaceful transition to Transylvanian independence, or even recognise us as partners to be negotiate with at all. The drafting of our new constitution, establishing the reborn Diet as a democraticaly-elected parliament to manage the common affairs of the Transylvanian nations within a federal political framework, has been the final straw that has unleashed Buda's wrath. As the Royal Honvéd mobilises and prepares to squash the Principality, it is clear that the Transylvanian nations - Magyars, Szekelys and Saxons alike - will have to set aside their differences and work as one to resist the invader.

The government in Buda has finally caved in and agreed to recognise us the legitimate goverment in Transylvania. Our new Constitution will now replace the 1812 Nitra Code as the legal basis for our state, establishing Transylvania as a federal state encompassing the Magyar, Szekely and Saxon nations and the Diet as the democraticaly-elected organ charged with the management of common affairs as well as foreign policy and trade. Now that a bloody conflict has been averted and our unique ways of life have been preserved, we can only look forward to a new Golden Age for Transylvania.

As the war agains the government in Buda reaches its second year and the Royal Honvéd still operates within the territory of the Principality, pessimism starts to take hold in the Transylvanian Diet, where increasingly radical propositions are being put forward to salvage the war effort. A central issue is the situation of the Vlachs - conspicuously left out of the Constitution, unrecognised as a nation and disenfranchised - who have remained indifferent in the present conflict, seeing no relevance to whether the opressive government rules from Gyulafehérvár or from Buda. Proposals for emergency amendments of the Constitution to recognise the Vlach nation are gaining traction - although such a measure would mean a reimagining of the political life of the Principality, originally concieved as a mutually beneficial pact between the traditionally privileged Magyars, Szekelys and Saxons, all of whom share a stormy past with the pauperised Vlachs.
Amend the Constitution to recognise the Vlach nation.
We won't give up our privileged position over the Vlachs.
The Guns Fall Silent in Transylvania

Crowds gather in Gyulafehérvár to celebrate a momentous event in the history of Transylvania - the Royal Honvéd has been decisively beaten on the battlefield and the government in Buda has agreed to negotiate a peace on the basis of the Independence of our Principality. As the last Royal troops evacuate Transylvanian soil the spectre of Magyarisation fades, soon to become a distant uncomfortable memory.

The revolutionary movement in Transylvania has collapsed and, although elements of the enemy army have managed to flee towards the Carpathians to pursue a guerrilla struggle, it is clear that the dreams of an independent Principality are dead in the water. The rebellion was the last desperate attempt by the privileged groups within Transylvania to hold on to their obsolescent legal codes, and now that it has been crushed nothing can stop our government from imposing our vision of a modern Magyar nation-state.
The modernisation of Magyarorszag is irresistible.

The Romanian people, in spite of representing a plurality of Transylvania, have for many years suffered under the Hungarian jackboot and have been excluded from the political life of the region. Hungarian electoral law, being heavily weighted towards tax contribution, all but leaves the Romanians, largely small agrarian landholders or herders, out of the system. Nevertheless, a recent edict from the Hungarian government has elevated the crisis in Transylvania to an unprecedent dimension - in the name of preserving the 'stronghold of Magyardom' in Transylvania, Romanian nationalist cooperatives have been banned, Romanian towns are being renamed to Magyar and Magyar is being imposed in the education curricula of Romanian students. We must act swiftly lest centuries of Romanian culture in Transylvania be crushed under the weight of the opressive Hungarian state apparatus.

Our armed forces have liberated Temisana, ending the Magyar tyranny over the oppressed Romanian population. The Magyarisation of names and surnames shall be reversed and the coercive education laws will be derogated.

Our armed forces have liberated Temesköz, ending the Vlach tyranny over the oppressed Hungarian population. The laws aimed at the Romanisation of the Magyar population will be derogated and the threat to the heart of Magyardom will be thwarted.

Our armed forces have liberated Western Transylvania, ending the Magyar tyranny over the oppressed Romanian population. The Magyarisation of names and surnames shall be reversed and the coercive education laws will be derogated.

Our armed forces have liberated Western Erdély, ending the Vlach tyranny over the oppressed Hungarian population. The laws aimed at the Romanisation of the Magyar population will be derogated and the threat to the heart of Magyardom will be thwarted.

Our armed forces have liberated Eastern Transylvania, ending the Magyar tyranny over the oppressed Romanian population. The Magyarisation of names and surnames shall be reversed and the coercive education laws will be derogated.

Our armed forces have liberated Eastern Erdély, ending the Vlach tyranny over the oppressed Hungarian population. The laws aimed at the Romanisation of the Magyar population will be derogated and the threat to the heart of Magyardom will be thwarted.

The successful centralisation of Hungary has allowed a new, radical ideology to flourish: Turanism, which postulates the exceptionality of Magyardom and its imperial mission to civilise the backward Balkans. Although there are disagreements about internal policy - whether the ethnic minorities within Hungary must be adopted as brother peoples or Magyarised - Turanists share a programme of expansion of Hungarian political and economic influence into the Balkan Peninsula as well as the strategic goal of pushing towards the Black Sea. Although rising in popularity, Turanism is nevertheless being bitterly opposed by part of the Hungarian political estabishment who fear territorial acquisitions in the Balkans might irrevocably switch the ethno-political balance of the realm towards Slavs and threaten the privileged position of the Magyar.
The Balkans will only be a burden to our nation.

Northern Serbia was conquered from the collapsing Ottoman state in what cannot be termed as anything but an opportunist move. Nevertheless, the annexed territories correspond roughly to the medieval Banate of Macsó, acquired by King Imre from the Byzantines and thereafter part of the Lands of the Crown of Saint Stephen until the Turkish conquest of Hungary. Our claims to the Banate of Macsó legitimises our occupation of Northern Serbia and its integration into Magyarorszag - to its fullest consequences, including the imposition of the Magyar language in the region and its colonisation by Magyars to secure the frontier.
We have no interest in Serbia.

Our armed forces have liberated Northern Serbia, ending the Magyar tyranny over the oppressed Slavic population. The Magyarisation of names and surnames shall be reversed and the coercive education laws will be derogated.

The expansion of Hungary into the former Serb and Montenegrin lands has brought a comparatively friendly neighbour to our northern border. Such a friendship is nevertheless not uniterested, and the increased political and economical influence of the Magyars within Albania has emboldened the Hungarian diplomats to make us an audacious proposal: cede the port city of Vlorë, which the Hungarians fervently covet to secure the transit of their fleet across the Straits of Otranto, in exchange for the cession of the Albanian-populated areas currently under Magyar administration. Although Vlorë is of great importance to our economy, the land trade would return Kosovë, the neural centre of Albanian culture during the long Ottoman reign.
We won't cede an inch of Albanian land.
The Albanians Agree to Cede Vlorë

The Albanian cabinet has agreed to our proposal to trade the port city of Vlorë and the adjacent territories around its bay in exchange for southern Kosovo, including Prizren, and the eastern provinces of the former Metropolitanate of Cetinje. With the strategic outpost of Vlorë now under our control the phantom of a blockade of the straits of Otranto fades and our grip on the Adriatic tightens. Although the Albanians have honoured their end of the deal, some elements of the Hungarian army argue that there is no reason to evacuate the Albanian-populated areas that we had agreed to transfer - should we decide to keep them, given the condition of Albania as a military pigmy only our reputation would be emperilled.
The Albanians Refuse to Cede Vlorë

The Albanian cabinet has refused our proposal to cede the port city of Vlorë, fearing that any concessions of sovereignty would only result in escalating demands that would end up prostrating Albania and turning her into a Magyar colony. Diplomacy having failed, if we want to secure the passage of our fleet through the Straits of Otranto we have no option but to invade Albania and impose our terms by force.
We must install a friendly government in Tirana.

Trouble has been brewing across the Carpathians for some time, with large sections of the Hungarian political class clamoring for a glorious conflagration to awake Magyardom from its current stupor and punish us - the Romanians, whom the Magyar both belittle and fear in equal measure. Hungarian agent provocateurs have been beating the drums of war for quite some time, spreading trumped-up claims about the rightfulness of Magyar rule over the Árpád fiefdom of Oltenia, all leading to the present situation where the Hungarian ambassador in Bucharest has presented us with an ultimatum. We are to cede the westernmost third of Wallachia up to the Olt river - or face the might of the Magyar war machine.
The Magyar threat must be confronted.
Cede Oltenia - we are too weak to resist.

Our pressure on the Bucharest regime has had undesired results - the ultimatum has been accepted, point by point, and Oltenia has now fallen under our administrative umbrella. Diplomats throughout Europe cynically celebrate the 'victory of peace' as both the Hungarian and Romanian premiers are lauded for their compromise to stabilise the always volatile Balkan Peninsula. Although we have been spured in our attempt at starting decisive military action against Romania, the cession of Oltenia will surely severely weaken them in an inevitable future conflict.

As predicted, the Romanian government has refused to accept the terms of our ultimatum demanding the cession of the Wallachian provinces west of the Olt River, giving us justification for opening armed hostilities. The war we had been agitating for so long is finally here, a war that will awake Magyardom from its current state of complacent apathy and revive its warrior spirit. Romania, the state which has antagonised us for so long and threatened to tear out the very heart of Hungary, shall be erased from the map and Romanians will be forced to assume their role as subjects to the Magyar Staatsvolk.
The Romanians have fallen into our trap.
The Collapse of the United Principalities

The Romanian Army has proven to be unable to resist the Magyar onslaught across the Carpathians and, after a serious of disastrous setbacks, has ceased to exist as an effective fighting force. The Hungarians are now free to dictate their terms for the cessation of hostilities. Although so far only preliminary drafts of the peace treaty have been presented to the Romanian provisional junta entrusted with the unenviable task of sealing a treaty with the Magyar, it seems that the Hungarian demands will be far harsher than initially thought - not only Oltenia will be seized, but Romania as a united state will be dissolved and its lands partitioned.
All that is fair must fade.

The Romanian armed forces have been routed, their administratives centres have been occupied and the will to resist of the Romanian people has been broken. Oltenia has been annexed, Moldavia has been placed under a provisional military administration and the remaining Romanian land has been awarded to the rump successor state of Wallachia. As of yet there is no consensus on what should become of Moldavia, other than it should be separated from Wallachia. The ministry of exterior affairs favours creating a vassal Kingdom in the area, which should serve as a useful buffer state with the rising powers in Eastern Europe. Within the military many argue that for the sake of national security, both sides of the Carpathians should be directly administrated by Hungary, with disagreements on wether a client state should be propped up east of the Pruth river or not. A third group proposes that in orther to placate the international community, we should offer Moldavia to a neighbouring power.
Moldavia will serve as a useful buffer state.
We will keep the entirety of Moldavia.
Offer Moldavia to a neighbour as compensation for our gains in Wallachia.

In the past few years Hungary has gone on an expansionistic rampage in the Balkan peninsula, raising concerns within the Concert of Great Powers about the consequences of the irruption of this new imperialist agent in southern Europe. The latest crisis has broken out over the Hungarian invasion of Romania and the cruel peace imposed on the Romanians, whose state has been dismembered and are now at the mercy of the Magyar's whims. Diplomatic pressure on the Hungarian government has borne its fruit, and the Hungarians are now proposing that in exchange for recognising their acquisitions in Wallachia, they would be willing to compensate us by ceding Moldavia in its entirety.
Agree to the transfer of Moldavia.
We won't be accomplices to Hungarian imperialism.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ agrees to sign deal over Moldavia

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have shown themselves receptive to our proposal to cede Moldavia, currently under Hungarian military occupation, in exchange for recognition of our acquisitions elsewhere in the former Romanian lands and our domination of the lower Danube. Although we'd be giving valuable land on the far side of the Carpathians to a potential rival, letting Moldavia go might be the only way to placate the international community after our relentless drive to become the uncontested masters of the Balkan Peninsula has raised alarms in chanceries all over Europe.
We'd rather keep Moldavia for ourselves.

Our proposal to cede Moldavia to a neighbouring in exchange for recognition of our subjugation of Wallachia has been met with, to say the least, a lukewarm reception. Through our reckless expansion in the Serbian lands, our backroom deals in Albania and finally our prostration of the Romanians we have acquired a nefarious reputation among the international community. The Concert of Powers no longer trusts the word of a Hungarian diplomat, all of our credibility having been spent in broken promises of stopping our imperalist projects in the Balkans. There is nothing left to do but decide ourselves what the fate of Moldavia should be.
Moldavia will serve as a useful buffer state.
We will keep the entirety of Moldavia.

Our colonial ventures in Serbia have generated widespread revulsion among the other Slavic elements of our population, including the hitherto loyal Slovaks. In the reborn Hungarian state, having originated as the Duchy of Nitra, the Slovaks have enjoyed a privileged position within the country, being second only to the Magyar. It seems that our trust in the Slovaks was, nevertheless, missplaced, as signs of pan-Slavic solidarity start to arise and the populace in Slovakia takes increasingly hostile positions to the government in Buda. If we are to continue pushing forward our assimilationist policies in Serbia or elsewhere, it will be indispensable to extend these with a heavy heart to Slovakia as well.
We won't trample our Slovak brothers.

Our armed forces have liberated Slovakia, ending the Magyar tyranny over the oppressed Slavic population. The Magyarisation of names and surnames shall be reversed and the coercive education laws will be derogated.

Ever since Independence was regained the idea of merging Buda with its adjoining cities of Pest and Óbuda has been floated around, though never realised due to the prohibitive cost of the large-scale urban reform it would entail. The prosperity attained in recent years, nevertheless, now makes the Budapest project a distinct reality. To build a truly unified capital first the problem of transportation and interconnection between the cities, currenlty separated by the Danube, must be solved. As of now, a single pontoon bridge connects Buda and Pest, an arrangement which although functional has some severe drawbacks - the bridge needs to be disassembled in order to let ships cross through the Danube, and it must be dismantled every winter to prevent it being destroyed by the ice. Building a new, modern chain bridge will be the first step towards making Budapest a capital worthy of our nation and a hub of industry, trade and turnover.
Budapest will be made a metropolis.

The gold-silver-tellurium deposits of Sacaramb, north of Deva, have been exploited at a small scale since Medieval times, as the numerous still extant dumps and adits attest. Nevertheless, systematic exploration of the extent of the precious deposits has not been carried out to date, meaning that the full potential of the gold mines in the region is practically untapped. Through intensive investment in geological surveys and development of the infrastructure of this remote region of Transylvania, we should be able to turn Sacaramb into one of the epicentres of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ mining industry and indeed into one of the richest auriferous districts in the entirety of Europe.
Invest in the Sacaramb gold mines.
The End of the Union of Three Nations

The liberation of Transylvania and its unification with the rest of Romania has brought to the spotlight the question of the ancient privileged groups of Transylvania, and their future within a Romanian nation state. Since medieval times, the Magyar nobility, the Szekely freemen and the Saxon settlers have allied to protect each other's interests and keep the pauperised Romanians at the bottom of the social ladder. In the Hungarian areas the Romanians are at the mercy of the wealthier Magyar nobility, and in the Saxon Königsboden the preambles of the Golden Charter even forbid Romanians form purchasing property. This anachronistic absurdity ends now.
Romanians shall no longer be second-class citizens.
The Society for Economic Development of Albania

For centuries the Straits of Otranto, a 70 Km strip of water separating Salento from Albania, has been a bridge rather than a barrier between Italy and the Balkans. The rise of $COUNTRY$ as a power to be reckoned with has awakaned an impulse within the intelligentsia to extend $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in the Balkans - for which purpose Valona, the city who the Albanians call Vlorë, would be the obvious bridgehead. The Albanian port is also coveted by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ admirality, recognising that control over the Bay of Valona would provide a perfect base for naval operations and grant $COUNTRY$ domination over the Adriatic. Advocates of the Albanian venture propose the founding of a Society for Economic Development of Albania to provide loans to the financially destitute Albanian government  - and therefore gain economic leverage - as well as the signing of a Treaty of Friendship between the two nations formalising our special interests in Albania.
Propose the investment programme to the Albanians.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have come forward with a proposal to provide our government with generous loans in exchange for recognising the special $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ interests in our country and the signing of a Pact of Friendship. The later document, for all its politesse, if signed would severely limit our freedom of action in terms of foreign policy. We must make a choice - turn down the generous $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$, or accept the loans and try to beat the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s at their own game strengthening Albania with the money recieved while not yielding political control.
We won't risk becoming puppets of the Italians.
Albania is Ready to Sign the Treaty of Friendship

The Albanian $FROMRULER$ has agreed to signing the Treaty of Friendship with $COUNTRY$ as well as the loans provided by the Society for the Economic Development of Albania. If our plans proceed as forseen, our investments should eventually turn Albania into an economic colony and undermine Albanian political independence to the point where we will virtually control Valona, and with it, the gates of the Adriatic.
Renegue on the the Pact proposal.
Sign the development and friendship pact.

Our initial investment package in Albania has not quite had the desired effects - $COUNTRY_ADJ$ keeps flowing into Albania, yet the Albanians remain fiercly independent. Moreover, the money itself is being squandered in vanity projects for the Albanian government which neither help improve Albania's pressing economical needs nor our strategical interests. We should propose a second investment plan, this time strictly delineating when and where the resources will be spent - that is, the port facilites of Valona as well as road infrastructure to connect it with the other major cities of Albania. Such infrastructure might also prove to be of use to our army in the futre if, everything else failing, our dominance need to be enforced by the strength of arms.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ investors have made manifest their displeasement at the way $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ money provided by the Society for the Economic Development of Albania is beign spent, and now propose a second investment package where they would enjoy much tighter control over the spending. It is clear from the draft proposal that the new package has clear military objectives - being focused on the port facilities of Vlorë and the road network connecting Vlorë to the rest of Albania - but our infrastructure does indeed need a deep overhaul regarless of ulterior $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ motivations.
The Albanians Break the Treaty of Friendship

The Albanians have rebuked our latest attempt to push forward our economic colonisation of the country and have even gone as far as breaking the existing Treaty of Friendship between both nations. This diplomatic slight has made patent the failure of our past policy in Albania bring about political domination, still but a distant chimera. Close advisors of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $MONARCHTITLE$, nevertheless, advance a daring plan to bring the Albanians to heel: foment an internal crisis within Albania, playing into the dissensions between the masses, the ruling government and the still unruly mountain tribes. With the appropiate stimulus rebellion and street fighting will break out - and then we could walk in to restore order and be welcomed by the native population. This stimulus would be no less than the assassination of the Albanian head of state.
We won't tarnish our reputation over Albania.
Albania Agrees on Military-Civilian Infrastrucutre Development

Albania has agreed to the signing of the second investment package focused on the military-civilian infrastructure of the country. The port of Valona will be refitted with modern warfs and drydocks, and the roads leading from Valona to Tirana will be metalled to avoid them becoming sodden quagmires after periods of even modest bad weather.
We won't waste a single piastra more for Albania.

Success! The Albanian King walked right into our trap, and agreed to sail towards Brindisi to iron out our latest diplomatic frictions. Once on the sea, his fate was sealed - having an Italian crew, the ship proved the be an inescapable grave for the Albanian leader. As predicted, the assassination has unleashed a wave of violence throughout Albania as competing factions engage in street fighting in Tirana and the mountain tribes rebel against the central government. Out intervention should not be more than a military parade, the only question is to which degree Albania should be prostrated. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ industrialists advocate for the installation of a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Duke to rule Albania as a dependent fiefdom, whereas the Admirality pushes forward for a more sober plan limited to the annexation of the Bay of Valona.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s have shown their true faces and the intentions behind their meddling in Albania. Our $MONARCHTITLE$, while sailing to Brindisi to a bilateral diplomatic summit, was cowardly assaulted and killed by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ agents. Chaos has ensued in Albania, with several factions claiming power and the mountain tribes rising in open rebellion against Tirana. There is still a chance to turn around the situation - by seizing the supplies and weapons stored near the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Military Academy in Valona, we can gain an edge against our domestic rivals as well as prepare for the incoming $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ invasion.

The invasion of Albania has turned out to be a smashing success. The Albanian army proved to be an ineffectual fighting force, hampered by the dreath in modern equipment and the unwillingness to fight of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$-trained officers. The population has not quite greeted us as liberators, as we expected, and has instead maintained a highly apathetic attitude. Regardless, the Bay of Valona and its immediate hinterland have been annexed, giving us the naval base that we so fervently desired and making us the uncontested masters of the Adriatic.
The Adriatic is now an $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lake.
The Modernisation of the Albanian Army

One of the stumbling blocks remaining in our way to the domination of Albania is its army which, though antiquated, remains outside of our orbit. A powerful group within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Army now lobbies for a joint military cooperation programme with Albania, with the overt aim of modernising the Albanian army and introducing $COUNTRY_ADJ$ doctrine to local officers - as well as the covert objective of reorienting the loyalty of the Albanian officer corps from Tirana to $CAPITAL$. Moreover, by equipping the Albanian army with $COUNTRY_ADJ$ weapons, it will inevitably become dependent on our supply of war material. We do run the risk, of course, of strengthening a potential future enemy.
A strong Albania is against our interests.
Send Officers and weapons to Albania.

High-ranking individuals within the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Army have shown interest in starting a joing Military Cooperation programme to reform our armed forces along modern European lines. Though the benefits of agreeing to such a proposal are obvious, given the precarious state of our army, the programme carries a mortal danger with it - that our officers, in the process of being re-trained by their new $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ patrons might turn disloyal.
This will only make our officer disloyal.
Albania Agrees on Joint Military Cooperation

Albania has agreed to the Joint Military Cooperation programme. Already we can start to organise the transfer of officers and training cadres to Tirana, where a new Military Academy will be established to familiarise the Albanian professionals with modern tactics and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military thought. Shipment of weapons to re-equip the Albanians shall also commence at once, an act which will serve the double purpose of making Albania dependent on our war-industry and therefore tightly tie them to $CAPITAL$.
We will bring their army to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ standards.
Economic Pressure Fails to Subdue the Albanians

In spite of all our diplomatic efforts and all the money poured into Albania, the strategy of economic colonisation, which was to hand us the country on a plate, has failed to yield its fruits. The Albanian leadership remains as independent-minded as ever, and it seems like continuing our current path of tightening economic ties will not bring us any closer to political domination. Close advisors of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $MONARCHTITLE$, nevertheless, advance a more efficient alternative: foment an internal crisis within Albania, playing into the dissensions between the masses, the ruling government and the still unruly mountain tribes. With the appropiate stimulus rebellion and street fighting will break out - and then we could walk in to restore order and be welcomed by the native population. This stimulus would be no less than the assassination of the Albanian head of state.
We won't tarnish $COUNTRY_ADJ$ reputation over Albania.
Go ahead with the assassination plan.

The fragile equilibrium between the Army and the civilian government seems to be about to come crashing down. The man who was suppposed to bridge the transition to a united Republic, Mariscal Federico de las Casas, a military-man himself, has failed to reign in the ambitious personalities of the generals who once were heroes to the cause of Gran Colombia. Antagonised by the provisional government's attempts to curb the privileges of the army and the protected legal status of its high officers, the generals have been only too willing to entretain the disenchanted landowners who also fear the liberal character that the young Republic is developing. To make matters worse the clergy, alienated by the interim government's proposals to expropriate fallow Church land, appears to be tacitly supporting the ongoing conspiracy to topple the government of Federico de las Casas and stop the constitutionalist movement.

The conspiracy by the Army to topple the civilian government has finally borne fruit. At the helm of the plot is no other than Tomás Villa, the charismatic Mexican Tetrarch who has managed to harness discontent in the military and turn it agains De las Casas. Units loyal to the current president have managed to stave off the rebel takeover of Guadalajara and Mexico City itself, though Zacatecas and Nuevo León have silently fallen to Villa. Of the other heroes of the revolution, Santos has decided to throw his lot with De las Casas, fearing Mexican encroachment on San Salvador, and quite surprisingly Manuel Luis de Madeira, the Lusitanian Tetrarch, has supported Villa's pronunciamiento on the grounds that the current government threatens to uproot the Catholic tradition of Lusitania.

All attempts at negotiating a peaceful solution to the current standoff have failed - the appeals to the old times when the four Generals fought together as Libertadores have fallen on deaf ears, and where before a Tetrarchy stood, now there are two opposing camps determined to use force to steer the future of the Republic. Only the field of battle can now decide wether the ideals of the Colombian Revolution can survive the ambition of its heroes.

The rebel forces under the command of Tomás Villa have been defeated, ending the reactionary uprising that sought to derail the ongoing Constitutional process. In a move that surprised many, outgoing President Federico de las Casas commuted the death penalty for Villa and Luis de Madeira for internal exile in luxurious villas in Baja. Perhaps it is the remnants of the friendship that once existed between the four men that were brothers in arms, perhaps it is the sober realisation that one day tables might turn - one way or the other, the ingerence of the Army in political matters has been decisively stimmed.
The Fall of de las Casas' Government

The Liberal forces under the command of General Santos have been defeated, ending the revolutionary upheaval that threatened to overturn the social order in the young Republic. In a move that surprised many, the self-declared President Villa commuted the death penalty for Federico de las Casas and Juan Manuel Santos for internal exile in luxurious villas in Bahia. Perhaps it is the remnants of the friendship that once existed between the four men that were brothers in arms, perhaps it is the sober realisation that one day tables might turn - one way or the other, the predominance of the Army in the political life of Gran Colombia has been soundly reaffirmed.
We are saviours of the Revolution.

The constituent assemblys decision to not abolish slavery has sent a shockwave through the afrolatino community in Gran Colombia. Having drank form the currents of freedom that ran during the Colombian Revolution, frustration and bitter anger now overwhelm the men who cannot understand why a war of liberation did not result in their emancipation. It is in this context that the Almasi Movement has raised  a radical abolitionist organisation that has gathered momentum in the coastal plantations of Sonora. The movement is led by Father Ibrahima, a priest of Wolof descent, who cultivates an aura of preternaturality and claims to be the reincarnation of St. Sebastian and the new Almlasi, the Messiah. Ibrahimas masses focus on Old Testament stories of the liberation of the Hebrew people from their cruel masters and of retribution for the oppressors  an ominous warning to those who have decided to maintain the yoke on the Colombian slaves.
These are just the ramblings of a madman.

The worst fear of all slaveowners in Gran Colombia has hatched. Father Ibrahima claims to have seen a vision of drops of blood on maize stalks and thunder in the heavens - a sign that God is about to lay down the yoke placed on Africans for their sins. Announcing the revelation as the Day of the Lord, Ibrahima has activated his network and started a slave uprising of unprecedent magnitude. Appeals for Africans to rise up against their slave masters have been smuggled in old rags meant to be worn by slaves, spreading the rebellion throughout the coast of Sonora. Blood of criollo Hacendados has already been spilled, although the Interim Government still hopes that military intervention be avoided and the situation might be defused by the capture and execution of Father Ibrahima.
The African slaves will be liberated!

Failure! The attempt to use a federal police force to behead the Almasi Movement and capture Father Ibrahima has ended in disaster. Although the police managed to infiltrate up to the parish where Ibrahima congregated with his followers, once discovered by the ringleaders they were repulsed and chased out of the Churchs premises. Feeling that more of such attempts might come, Father Ibrahima has ordered his followers to go on the assault. Prisions, barracks and forts throughout Sonora have been stormed by the self-emancipated slaves, providing much needed arms for the movement. Only the Army can now restore the situation.
The slaves shall know their place!

The army has managed to defeat the rabble assembled by Father Ibrahima, captured the self-proclaimed Messiah and restored order to Sonora. The survivors of the rebellion have been sent back to their owners in the Haciendas, where a fate worse than death awaits them. Although this time we might have succeeded to maintain the established order through force, the issue of slavery remains unresolved and is sure to be a source of future trouble.
We kick the can down the road.

After a tense period where the Colombian government hesitated to act  no doubt fearing further violence against the criollo Hacendados  a Police squad has been sent to the parish of Father Ibrahima to arrest the ring leaders of the Almasi Revolt. Repulsed by Ibrahimas followers, the botched operation has finally lighted the fuse for an all-out armed conflict between the former slaves and the government that seeks to shackle them again..

Amazonie has always had a tumultuous relationship with its population of African-descent. Slavery persisted in Amazonie far longer than in other nations in the New World, and then was only abolished in the wake of the Civil War in Equinoxea. Precisely it is this frontier region in the north-west that poses great peril to our country once more  the radicals of Liberia, a nation of Arcadian freedmen, have declared their intent to liberate their brothers in Equinoxea who, they claim, live in a state of de-facto apartheid in spite of the technical equality of men in Amazonie.
They are welcome to come and try their luck.

The militia of freedmen raised by Father Ibrahima has managed to defeat the Colombian army in a gruesome, protracted struggle that has left both sides exhausted. Although the troops of the central government had superior arms and training, the very greed that drove them to force their former compatriots back under the yoke was their undoing. Unwilling to damage the property of the powerful Hacendados who pull the strings of the Congress, the armies of Gran Colombia were vulnerable to a scorched earth campaigned, which the followers of Father Ibrahima ruthlessly pursued until the enemys army was but a collection of starving malarial soldiers. Now, peace and reconstruction  onwards Liberia!
A bright future lays ahead of us.

Tragedy! News is spreading throughout Liberia of the death of the hero of the Almasi Revolt, Father Ibrahima. Always a man with a fragile health, recent years have seen the priest survive two strokes with ever-deteriorating health. The third of such kind of incident has proven to be fatal for the man who brought freedom to the Afro-Arcadians. During his rule, his charismatic aura and legitimacy gained by triumphing over Gran Colombia were enough to maintain a pseudo-Catholic theocracy, although many had already started to question this form of government during the waning years of Ibrahima in which he withdrew more and more from active political life. Some argue for a direct continuation of his regime and the preponderance of his particular version of Christianity in temporal matters, whereas others propose that his legacy be continued by enthroning the priests cousin as King of Liberia. The majority, nevertheless, seems to favour a representative democratic Republic.
Liberty and democracy go hand in hand!
Demographic Pressure in the Indian Republics

Until the turn of the century the parts of New Spain with majority native population had been effectively ruled as tributaries, with the Spaniards living in cities and collecting tribute from the Indian republics where native caciques exercise power in the name of the colonial government. This system of indirect rule is nevertheless breaking down as demographic pressure pushes poor criollos and mestizos into the still underpopulated native land, increasing competition for the already scant resources. The tension is felt not only within the villages but, most concerningly, in a near-state of war between opposing villages, which fight for jurisdiction over outlying estates. The native farmers, already suffering from crippling tax burdens, now find themselves used as soldiers for these conflicts  setting a dangerous precedent that the troubles of the villages and the villagers can be solved through violence.
We won't stop men seeking opportunities.

The development of the mechanical rasper has turned Henequen, a hitherto marginally useful crop, into practically green gold. Henequen, able to thrive on the poor soil that covers many regions in Mexico, is exploited to produce fibres that feed the hungry textile industry of Arcadia and Europe, bringing fortunes to the owners of the Henequen Haciendas. This economic miracle has, nevertheless, sunk the native farmers into further despondency  the farmer, indebted from a young age with the Hacendado over marriage costs, must eke out an existence of peonage at the service of their patrons plantation. As the Henequen boom spreads, so does the misery of the exploited farmers and the resentment of the natives with their criollo Hacendados.
Henequen will bring prosperity to our unfruitful land.
The End of the Indian Republics

The Constitution of Gran Colombia has abolished the old colonial institution of the Indian republics, replacing them by ethnically-agnostic municipalities. This measure has resulted in criollos assuming positions of power in the new municipalities, leading the natives to create parallel shadow republics, eroding the legitimacy of the central government. To compound the matter, the new mayors seek to retain the old colonial labour drafts on Indians, deepening the inter-ethnic resentment. This untenable situation has exploded in Oaxaca, where a caudillo by the name of Raymundo Guerrero has manage to co-opt the local Zapotecs into storming the Ayuntamiento of Loxicha to demand a return to the old republics. The government is only gaining enemies throughout the native lands: the caciques, traditional allies of the authorities, who now seek uncontested control over their estates  and the farmers, who dream of relieving themselves of the labour and tax burdens.

The current war is straining the very fibre that holds together Gran Colombia to its breaking point. Desperate for more money to finance the war and warm bodies with which to fight it, the Congress has had no other option but to approve the conscription of natives in the Colombian army. This move has met with bitter opposition  the native conscripts resent being torn away from their livelihoods to fight for an uncaring government, and the caciques resent the removal of their taxpayers. Desertion runs high among native units, flooding the already volatile countryside with modern arms. The war has also turned the new criollo ayuntamientos into downright extractive institutions taxing just about every product of the farmers labour: corn, beans, salt and cattle, increasing the desperation of the already impoverished natives.
All Colombian citizens must contribute to the war effort.

The repeated recruitment of Indians to fight in municipal conflicts has awakened a political awareness, heightened by their conscription into the Colombian army. This development has manifested itself clearly in Chilpacingo, were a group of disaffected Purépecha farmers has rebelled against the Ayuntamiento. Decrying of the crushing tax burdens imposed by the criollo mayor, the rebels overthrew the town council, appointed their own prefect and declared the abolition of peasant church taxes. The rebellion soon spread to other Purépechan towns as desperate farmers threw their lot with the rebels, though it wasnt long until the government responded. The ringleaders have been executed and the old town of Chilpacingo has been laid to waste, but the rebellion isnt dead: on the contrary, it has acquired an entirely new dimension as Indians throughout Mexico, from the Huasteca to Yucatan, emulate the Pronunciamiento of Chilpacingo and take retribution against the government.

In an unprecedent event in Mesoamerigan history, the native peoples from the Sierra Madre to the Valley of Mexico, from Yucatan to the Otomí Highlands, have united in a common struggle against the government of Gran Colombia. Having seen the brutal measures that the central government is willing to resort to in the Purépecha lands, the natives have agreed to form a temporary alliance to beat back the federal army and turn the Indian republics into true independent states. Led by the Nahuatl caudillo Alonso Xochiquentzin, the alliance calls itself the Leage of Cemanahuac after the old Aztec word for the universe.
The Indios will be brought to heel!
Lead the native Mesoamerigans towards freedom!

The secession of the League of Cemanahuac has led to much chaos, with many federal army units cut-off by now de-facto independent Indian strongholds and the capital of Mexico City practically surrounded by hostile Nahua territory. Our efforts to regroup and reorganise have nevertheless been successful, and now we stand poised to strike at the heart of the Indian rebellion.
We will restore order to the Indian lands.

The Gran Colombian army has finally sprung into action and started an offensive from Mexico City, seeking to relieve the beleaguered capital and widen the corridor that serves as the lifeline between rebel territory. The Colombian press trumpets the current conflict as the Caste War, demeaning our struggle as one of race waged by intolerant peoples. But we know better, and we know why we fight  for the unbridled freedom of the native peoples of Mesoameriga!
We will fight for our freedom.
The Dissolution of the League of Cemanahuac

In a momentous event in the history of the native peoples of the New World, a colonising power has been decisively beaten in the field of battle and the so-called Indians have achieved emancipation. Humiliated and bisected at the very heart of the Republic, Gran Colombia has entered a spiral of disintegration as Granada and San Salvador decide to unshackle themselves from the Mexican corpse. The victorious League of Cemanahuac is also undertaking a process of negotiated dissolution as the various constituent peoples seek to establish independent nation states. Although some revolutionaries still dream of a united native Mesoamerigan state, for now pragmatism and self-interest win the day.
The Dissolution of the League of Cemanahuac

In a momentous event in the history of the native peoples of the New World, a colonising power has been decisively beaten in the field of battle and the so-called Indians have achieved emancipation. Humiliated and bisected at the very heart of the Republic, Gran Colombia has entered a spiral of disintegration as Granada and San Salvador decide to unshackle themselves from the Mexican corpse. The victorious League of Cemanahuac is also undertaking a process of negotiated dissolution as the various constituent peoples seek to establish independent nation states. Although some revolutionaries still dream of a united native Mesoamerigan state, for now pragmatism and self-interest win the day.

In a momentous event in the history of the native peoples of the New World, a colonising power has been decisively beaten in the field of battle and the so-called Indians have achieved emancipation. Humiliated and bisected at the very heart of the Republic, Gran Colombia has entered a spiral of disintegration as Granada and San Salvador decide to unshackle themselves from the Mexican corpse. The victorious League of Cemanahuac is also undertaking a process of negotiated dissolution as the various constituent peoples seek to establish independent nation states. Although some revolutionaries still dream of a united native Mesoamerigan state, for now pragmatism and self-interest win the day.

The secessionist League of Cemanahuac has been soundly defeated and, though guerrilla resistance continues in the remote mountains of central Mexico and in the treacherous jungles of Yucatan, the political unity of the Indios has been shattered and all illusions of independence have been extinguished. The commander in chief of the rebel forces, Alonso Xochiquentzin, has been captured in Tulum while trying to board a Burgundian steamer towards Eendrachtsland, thus thwarting any attempt to set up a government-in-exile. Although Gran Colombia has won the day a long tortuous path of reconstruction lays ahead of the young Republic.

With the Spanish yoke finally thrown off for good, the current provisional government has run its course, its original purpose expired. Debates about the future of the Nahua poeple begin and some look at the past for direction, longing for a return of the Aztec Empire and claiming the legacy of Itzcoatl III, the Tlàtoani under whom the Empire reached its zenith and dominated the peoples of Mesoameriga. The current Count of Itzcoatl, Pedro Marcilla de Itzcoatl, would be crowned as the new Tlàtoani. Other respudiate Itzcoatl entirely, blaming the collapse of the Mexica civilisation on his ineffectual rule and his naive appeasement policy towards the Conquistadores. Instead, the latter group propose the Tlaxcallan - a pseudo-republican confederation who bitterly oposed the Aztec Empire - as the inspiration for the form of government of the new Nahua nation.
The Aztec Empire shall be reborn.
Embrace the republican tradition of Tlaxcallan.

Ever since the proclamation of the Republic of Aztlan the Nahua have shown increased assertiveness in foreign matters as well as a penchant to meddle in the internal affairs of their neighbours. Citing security concerns, Aztlan has issued an edict calling for all the Mesoamerigan Queens and Kings to lay down their crowns and accept the rule of the people. Calling any monarch a 'cacique' and puppet of the Spaniards, the Nahua seem hellbent on exporting their revolution through the sword.

Endless columns of refugees extend as far as the eye views in the passes in our southern frontier. The miserable people who seek asylum are none other than our very brethren  Mexicans who found themselves on the wrong side of the frontier after the Caste War and whose position had been steadily deteriorating ever since the ascension of the Count of Itzcoatl to the throne in Anahuac. The Nahua government has decided to take the final step in their campaign of terror and has engaged in large-scale ethnic cleansing, forcing Spaniards to move out of the Valley of Mexico and clear the land for Indian use.
Administrative Reform in the Teenek Kingdom

The tensions that have dominated the Huastec villages since the Colombian War of Independence seem to be finally quieting down. The violent dichotomy between the indigenous hamlets and the criollo municipalities is fading away as the new Huastec state reforms the territorial organisation system  effectively devolving more power to the villages, instead of centralising bureaucracy in head-towns ruling over subject villages. The curbing of the influence of the land-hungry Hacendados as well as the dethronement of the Hispanicised Huastecs, previously dominating politics in head-towns, has gone a long way towards returning inter-ethnic relations towards peaceful coexistence.

Our team of archeologists has returned with news of the discovery of the lost city of Uxmal, whose ruins are located on the eastern fringes of the province of Calkiní. The ancient maya metropolis has turned upside down our knowledge about post-Classical Maya infrastructure  the city, located on an arid region devoid of any rivers, lakes or cenotes, maintained a steady supply of drinkable water through the ingenious use of chultunes, cisterns to capture rainwater. The architecture found in the ruins is impressive by itself, with the so-called Governors Palace being the most impressive, its extensively ornate bas-reliefs and domed corridors surely albe to excite the imagination of local and foreign observers alike.
A glorious day for the Maya!

Reports from the field bring news that our explorers have uncovered the location of the great city of Chichén Itzá. The metropolis, which is thought to have at one point dominated the Maya world, was already in a steep decline by the time it joined the League of Mayapan, and was completely abandoned by the time the Spanish invaders arrived in Yucatán. The jungle-overrun ruins offer a striking image of the ephemerality of power, with the Castle dominating the entire archaeological complex. Actually a nine-level stepped pyramid, the preliminary studies by our archeological team indicate strong central Mexican influence on its construction, thus shedding new light on the development of the post-Classic Maya civilisation.
A glorious day for the Maya!

Our explorers have finally found Mayapan, the last great Maya city to rise to power before the Spanish conquest.
